text: Good evening, everyone.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I'm Lester Holt, and welcome to the first Democratic debate to the 2020 race for president.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Hi, I'm Savannah Guthrie.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And tonight, it's our first chance to see these candidates go head to head on stage together.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We'll be joined in our questioning time by our colleagues, Jose Diaz-Balart, Chuck Todd, and Rachel Maddow.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Voters are trying to nail down where the candidates stand on the issues, what sets them apart, and which of these presidential hopefuls has what it takes.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Well, now it's time to find out.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Tonight, round one.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: New Jersey Senator Cory Booker.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Former Housing Secretary Julian Castro.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: New York City Mayor Bill De Blasio.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Former Maryland Congressman John Delaney.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Hawaii Congresswoman Tulsi Gabbard.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Washington Governor Jay Inslee.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Minnesota Senator Amy Klobuchar.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Former Texas Congressman Beto O'Rourke.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Ohio Congressman Tim Ryan.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And Massachusetts Senator Elizabeth Warren.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: From NBC News, Decision 2020, the Democratic candidates debate, live from the Adrienne Arsht Performing Arts Center in Miami, Florida.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And good evening again, everyone.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Welcome to the candidates and to our audience here in Miami here in the Arts Center and all across the country.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Tonight we're going to take on many of the most pressing issues of the moment, including immigration, the situation unfolding at our border, and the treatment of migrant children.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And we're going to talk about the tensions with Iran, climate change, and of course, we'll talk about the economy, those kitchen table issues so many Americans face every day.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And some quick rules of the road.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Before we begin, 20 candidates qualified for this first debate.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We'll hear from 10 tonight and 10 more tomorrow.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: The breakdown for each was selected at random.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: The candidates will have 60 seconds to answer and 30 seconds for any follow-ups.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Because of this large field, not every person will be able to comment on every topic, but over the course of the next two hours, we will hear from everyone.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We'd also like to ask the audience to keep the reactions to a minimum.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We are not going to be shy about making sure the candidates stick to time tonight.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: All right.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So with that business out of the way, we want to get to it.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And we'll start this evening with Senator Elizabeth Warren.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator, good evening to you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Good to be here.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: You have many plans  free college, free child care, government health care, cancellation of student debt, new taxes, new regulations, the breakup of major corporations.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: But this comes at a time when 71 percent of Americans say the economy is doing well, including 60 percent of Democrats.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: What do you say to those who worry this kind of significant change could be risky to the economy?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So I think of it this way.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Who is this economy really working for?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It's doing great for a thinner and thinner slice at the top.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It's doing great for giant drug companies.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It's just not doing great for people who are trying to get a prescription filled.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It's doing great for people who want to invest in private prisons, just not for the African-Americans and Latinos whose families are torn apart, whose lives are destroyed, and whose communities are ruined.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It's doing great for giant oil companies that want to drill everywhere, just not for the rest of us who are watching climate change bear down upon us.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: When you've got a government, when you've got an economy that does great for those with money and isn't doing great for everyone else, that is corruption, pure and simple.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We need to call it out.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We need to attack it head on.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And we need to make structural change in our government, in our economy, and in our country.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator Klobuchar, you've called programs like free college something you might do if you were, quote, a magic genie.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: To be blunt, are the government programs and benefits that some of your rivals are offering giving your voters, people, a false sense of what's actually achievable?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Well, first, the economy.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We know that not everyone is sharing in this prosperity.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And Donald Trump just sits in the White House and gloats about what's going on, when you have so many people that are having trouble affording college and having trouble affording their premiums.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So I do get concerned about paying for college for rich kids.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I do.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: But I think my plan is a good one.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And my plan would be to, first of all, make community college free and make sure that everyone else besides that top percentile gets help with their education.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: My own dad and my sister got their first degrees with community college.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: There's many paths to success, as well as certifications.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Secondly, I'd used Pell grants.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I'd double them from $6,000 to $12,000 a year and expand it to the number of families that get covered, to families that make up to $100,000.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And then the third thing I would do is make it easier for students to pay off their student loans.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Because I can tell you this: If billionaires can pay off their yachts, students should be able to pay off their student loans.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That's time, thank you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Congressman O'Rourke, what we've just been discussing and talking about is how much fundamental change to the economy is desirable and how much is actually doable.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: In that vein, some Democrats want a marginal individual tax rate of 70 percent on the very highest earners, those making more than $10 million a year.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Would you support that?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And if not, what would your top individual rate be?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: This economy has got to work for everyone.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And right now, we know that it isn't.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And it's going to take all of us coming together to make sure that it does.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Right now, we have a system that favors those who can pay for access and outcomes.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That's how you explain an economy that is rigged to corporations and to the very wealthiest.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: A $2 trillion tax cut that favored corporations while they were sitting on record piles of cash and the very wealthiest in this country at a time of historic wealth inequality.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: A new democracy that is revived because we've returned power to the people, no PACs, no gerrymandering, automatic and same-day voter registration to bring in more voters, and a new Voting Rights Act to get rid of the barriers that are in place now
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Congressman O'Rourke
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That's how we each have a voice in our democracy and make this economy work for everybody.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Congressman, that's time, sir.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I'll give you 10 seconds to answer if you want to answer the direct question.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Would you support a 70 percent individual marginal tax rate?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Yes, no, or pass?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I would support a tax rate and a tax code that is fair to everyone.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Tax capital at the same right
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Seventy percent?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: that you  you tax ordinary income.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Take that corporate tax rate up to 28 percent.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: You would generate the revenues
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: OK, that's time.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: you need to pay for the programs we're talking about.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That's time.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator Booker, there is a debate in this party right now about the role of corporations, as you know.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator Warren in particular put out a plan to break up tech companies like Facebook, Amazon, and Google.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: You've said we should not, quote, be running around pointing at companies and breaking them up without any kind of process.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Why do you disagree?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I don't think I disagree.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I think we have a serious problem in our country with corporate consolidation.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And you see the evidence of that in how dignity is being stripped from labor, and we have people that work full-time jobs and still can't make a living wage.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We see that because consumer prices are being raised by pharmaceutical companies that often have monopolistic holds on drugs.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And you see that by just the fact that this is actually an economy that's hurting small businesses and not allowing them to compete.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: One of the most aggressive bills in the Senate to deal with corporate consolidation is mine about corporate consolidation in the ag sector.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So I feel very strongly about the need to check the corporate consolidation and let the free market work.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And I'll tell you this.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I live in a low-income black and brown community.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I see every single day that this economy is not working for average Americans.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: The indicators that are being used, from GDP to Wall Street's rankings, is not helping people in my community.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It is about time that we have an economy that works for everybody, not just the wealthiest in our nation.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: But quickly, Senator Booker, you did say that you didn't think it was right to name names, to name companies and single them out, as Senator Warren has.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Briefly, why is that?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Well, again, I will single out companies like Halliburton or Amazon that pay nothing in taxes and our need to change that.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So here's what I propose for an industrial policy.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And when it comes to antitrust law, what I will do is, number one, appoint judges that will enforce it, number two, have a DOJ and a Federal Trade Commission that will go through the processes necessary to check this kind of corporate concentration.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: At the end of the day, we have too much of a problem with corporate power growing.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We see that with everything from Citizens United and the way they're trying to influence Washington.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It's about time that we have a president that fights for the people in this country
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That's time, sir.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We need to have someone that's a champion for them.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator Warren, I mentioned you  Are you picking winners and losers?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So the way I understand this, it's there is way too much consolidation now in giant industries in this country.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That hurts workers.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It hurts small businesses.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It hurts independent farmers.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It hurts our economy overall.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And it helps constrict real innovation and growth in this economy.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Now, look, we've had the laws out there for a long time to be able to fight back.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: What's been missing is courage, courage in Washington to take on the giants.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That's part of the corruption in this system.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It has been far too long that the monopolies have been making the campaign contributions, have been funding the super PACs, have been out there making sure that their influence is heard and felt in every single decision that gets made in Washington.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Where I want to start this is I want to return government to the people, and that means calling out the names of the monopolists and saying I have the courage to go after them.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Secretary Castro, the next question is for you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Democrats have been talking about the pay gap for decades.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: What would you do to ensure that women are paid fairly in this country?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you very much for that question, Lester.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: You know, I grew up with a mother who raised my brother, Joaquin, and me as a single parent.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And I know what it's like to struggle.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I know what it's like to rent a home and to worry about whether you're going to be able to pay the rent at the first of the month and to see a mom work very, very hard and know that moms across this country are getting paid less simply because they're women.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I would do several things, starting with something we should have done a long time ago, which is to pass the Equal Rights Amendment finally in this country.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And also pursue legislation so that women are paid equal pay for equal work in this country.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It's past time that we did that.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And, you know, we have to do this.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: If we want to be the most prosperous nation in the 21st century, we need to make sure that women are paid what they deserve.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: All right, thank you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I want to put the same question to Congresswoman Gabbard.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Your thoughts on equal pay?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: First of all, let's recognize the situation we're in, that the American people deserve a president who will put your interests ahead of the rich and powerful.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That's not what we have right now.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I enlisted in the Army National Guard after the Al Qaida terror attacks on 9/11 so I could go after those who had attacked us on that day.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I still serve as a major.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I served over 16 years, deployed twice to the Middle East, and in Congress served on the Foreign Affairs and Armed Services Affairs for over six years.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I know the importance of our national security, as well as the terribly high cost of war.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And for too long, our leaders have failed us, taking us from one regime change war to the next, leading us into a new cold war and arms race, costing us trillions of our hard-earned taxpayer dollars and countless lives.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: This insanity must end.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: As president, I will take your hard-earned taxpayer dollars and instead invest those dollars into serving your needs, things like health care, a green economy, good-paying jobs, protecting our environment, and so much more.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Mayor De Blasio, good evening.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: You're the mayor of the biggest city in the United States, but it's also one of the cities in the country with the greatest gap between the wealthy and the poor.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: How would you address income inequality?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Well, we've been addressing income inequality in New York City by raising wages, by raising benefits, by putting money back in the hands of working people, $15 minimum wage, paid sick days, pre-K for all, things that are making a huge difference in working people's lives.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: But let me tell you, what we're hearing here already in the first round of questions is that battle for the heart and soul of our party.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I want to make it clear.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: This is supposed to be the party of working people.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Yes, we're supposed to be for a 70 percent tax rate on the wealthy.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Yes, we're supposed to be for free college, free public college, for our young people.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We are supposed to break up big corporations when they're not serving our democracy.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: This Democratic Party has to be strong and bold and progressive.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Start with a place where there's a real need.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And in New York, we've proven that we can do something very different, we can put money back in the hands of working people.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And let me tell you, every time you talk about investing in people and their communities, you hear folks say there's not enough money.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: What I say to them every single time is, there's plenty of money in this world, there's plenty of money in this country.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It's just in the wrong hands.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Democrats have to fix that.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Congressman Delaney, do you agree?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I think we have to do real things to help American workers and the American people.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Right?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: This is the issue that all of us hear on the campaign trail.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We need to make sure everyone has a living wage.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And I've called for a doubling of the earned income tax credit, raising the minimum wage, and creating paid family leave.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That will create a situation where people actually have a living wage.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That gets right to workers.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Then we've got to fix our public education system.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It's not delivering the results our kids needs, nor is college and post high school career and technical training programs doing that.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: You know, I'm very different than everyone else here on the stage.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Prior to being in Congress, I was an entrepreneur.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I started two businesses.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I created thousands of jobs.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I spent my whole career helping small- to mid-sized businesses all over the country, 5,000 of them I supported.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: The Obama administration gave me an award for lending to disadvantaged communities.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I know how to create jobs.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We need a short-term strategy which is to put money in the pockets of workers with the earned income tax credit, raising the minimum wage, and creating family leave, and then we need to have a long-term strategy to make sure this country is competitive and we're creating jobs everywhere in this country.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Governor Inslee, how would you address income inequality?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Well, I'm a little bit surprised.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I think plans are great, but I'm a governor.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And we've got to realize the people who brought us the weekend, unions, need  are going to bring us a long overdue raise in America.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And I'm proud of standing up for unions.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I've got a plan to reinvigorate collective bargaining so we can increase wages finally.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I marched with the SEIU folks.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It is not right that the CEO of McDonald's makes 2,100 times more than the people slinging cash at McDonald's.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And the next thing I'll do is put people to work in the jobs of the present and the future.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Look it, Donald Trump is simply wrong.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: He says wind turbines cause cancer.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We know they cause jobs.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And we know that we can put millions of people to work in the clean energy jobs of the future.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Carpenters, IBEW members, machinists, we're doing it in my state today.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And then we can do what America always does: lead the world and invent the future and put people to work.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That's what we're going to do
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So, Congressman Ryan, President Trump, and you just referred to him, promise of manufacturing jobs were all coming back to places like your home state of Ohio.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Can you make that same promise?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Yes, I believe you can, but, first, let's say the president came, he said don't sell your house to people in Youngstown, Ohio.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And then his administration just in the last two years, we lost $4,000  4,000 jobs at a General Motors facility.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That rippled throughout our community.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: General Motors got a tax cut.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: General Motors got a bailout.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And then they have the audacity to move a new car that they're going to produce to Mexico.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I've had family members that have to unbolt a machine from the factory floor, put it in a box, and ship it to China.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: My area where I come from in northeast Ohio, this issue we're talking about here, it's been going on 40 years.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: This is not a new phenomenon in the United States of America.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: The bottom 60 percent haven't seen a raise since 1980.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Meanwhile, the top 1 percent control 90 percent of the wealth.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We need an industrial policy saying we're going to dominate building electric vehicles, there's going to be 30 million made in the next 10 years.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I want half of them made in the United States.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I want to dominate the solar industry
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: and manufacture those here in the United States.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator Warren, are they coming back?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Are these jobs coming back?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So we've had an industrial policy in the United States for decades now, and it's basically been let giant corporations do whatever they want to do.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Giant corporations have exactly one loyalty, and that is to profits.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And if they can save a nickel by moving a job to Mexico or to Asia or to Canada, they're going to do it.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: There's going to be a worldwide need for green technology, ways to clean up the air, ways to clean up the water.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And we can be the ones to provide that.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We need to go tenfold in our research and development on green energy going forward.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And then we need to say any corporation can come and use that research.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: They can make all kinds of products from it, but they have to be manufactured right here in the United States of America.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And then we have to double down and sell it around the world.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: There's a $23 trillion market coming for green products.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We should be the leaders and the owners, and we should have that 1.2 million manufacturing jobs here in America.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We can do this.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: All right.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We're going to turn to the issue of health care right now and really try to understand where there may or may not be daylight between you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Many people watching at home have health insurance coverage through their employer.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Who here would abolish their private health insurance in favor of a government-run plan?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Just a show of hands, start off with.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: All right, well, Senator Klobuchar, let me put the question to you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: You're one of the Democrats who wants to keep private insurance in addition to a government health care plan.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Why is an incremental approach in your view better than a sweeping overhaul?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Well, I think it's a bold approach.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It's something that Barack Obama wanted to do when we were working on the Affordable Care Act.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And that is a public option.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I am just simply concerned about kicking half of America off of their health insurance in four years, which is exactly what this bill says.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So let me go on beyond that.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: There is a much bigger issue in addition to that, and that is pharmaceuticals.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: The president literally went on TV, on Fox, and said that people's heads would spin when they see how much he would bring down pharmaceutical prices.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Instead, 2,500 drugs have gone up in double-digits since he came into office.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Instead, he gave $100 billion in giveaways to the pharma companies.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: For the rest of us, for the rest of America, that's what we call at home all foam and no beer.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We got nothing out of it.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And so my proposal is to do something about pharma, to take them on, to allow negotiation under Medicare, to bring in less expensive drugs from other countries.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And pharma thinks they own Washington?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Well, they don't own me.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Your time is up.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator Warren, you signed on to Bernie Sanders' Medicare for all plan.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It would put essentially everybody on Medicare and then eliminate private plans that offer similar coverage.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Is that the plan or path that you would pursue as president?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So, yes.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I'm with Bernie on Medicare for all.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And let me tell you why.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I spent a big chunk of my life studying why families go broke.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And one of the number-one reasons is the cost of health care, medical bills.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And that's not just for people who don't have insurance.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It's for people who have insurance.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Look at the business model of an insurance company.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It's to bring in as many dollars as they can in premiums and to pay out as few dollars as possible for your health care.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That leaves families with rising premiums, rising copays, and fighting with insurance companies to try to get the health care that their doctors say that they and their children need.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Medicare for all solves that problem.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And I understand.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: There are a lot of politicians who say, oh, it's just not possible, we just can't do it, have a lot of political reasons for this.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: What they're really telling you is they just won't fight for it.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Well, health care is a basic human right, and I will fight for basic human rights
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Congressman O'Rourke, when you ran for Senate, you also praised a bill that would replace private insurance.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: This year, you're saying you're no longer sure.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Can you explain why?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: My goal is to ensure that every American is well enough to live to their full potential because they have health care.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: In Laredo, Texas, I met a young man, 27 years old, told me that he'd been to a doctor once in his life.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And on that visit, he was told he had diabetes, he was told he had glaucoma, and he was told untreated  because he doesn't have health care  he'll be dead before the age of 40.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So getting to guaranteed, high-quality, universal health care as quickly and surely as possible has to be our goal.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: The ability to afford your prescriptions and go to a primary care provider, to be  the ability to see a mental health care provider.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: In Texas, the single largest provider of mental health care services is the county jail system today.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: But I have an urgency about this.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And health care also has to mean that every woman can make her own decisions about her own body and has access to the care that makes that possible.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Our plan says that if you're uninsured, we enroll you in Medicare.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: If you're insufficiently insured, you can't afford your premiums, we enroll you in Medicare.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: But if you're a member of a union that negotiated for a health care plan that you like because it works for you and your family, you're able to keep it.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Your time is up.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We preserve choice by making sure everybody has care.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Your time is up, Congressman, but I do want to ask a follow-up on this.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Just to be very clear  I'll give you 10 seconds  would you replace private insurance?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: No.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I think the choice is fundamental to our ability to get everybody cared for
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Wait, wait, wait.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Congressman O'Rourke, Congressman O'Rourke, private insurance is not working for tens of millions of Americans when you talk about the co-pays, the deductibles, the premiums, the out of pocket expenses.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It's not working.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: How can you defend a system that's not working?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That's right.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So for those for whom it's not working, they can choose Medicare.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: For the
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Congressman
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: who I listen to
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: you've got to start by acknowledging the system is not working for people.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: they're able to keep them.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Why are you defending private insurance to begin with?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: 100 million Americans say they like their private health insurance, by the way.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It should be noted that 100 million Americans  I mean, I think we should be the party that keeps what's working and fixes what's broken.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I mean, doesn't that make sense?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I mean, we should give everyone in this country health care as a basic human right for free, full stop.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: But we should also give them the option to buy private insurance.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Why do we have to stand for taking away something from people?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And also it's bad policy.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: If you go to every hospital in this country and you ask them one question, which is how would it have been for you last year if every one of your bills were paid at the Medicare rate?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Every single hospital administrator said they would close.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And the Medicare for all bill requires payments to stay at current Medicare rates.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So to some extent, we're supporting a bill that will have every hospital closing.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I mean, my dad was a union electrician, right?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I actually grew up in a working-class family.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: He loved the health care that the IBEW gave him.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And I just always think about my dad in anything I would do from a policy perspective.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: He'd look at me and he'd say, good job, John, for getting health care for every American.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: But why are you taking my health care away?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I've let this  I've let this play out a little bit because I'm fascinated to hear the daylight between you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Congresswoman Gabbard, why don't you weigh in here?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I think we're talking about this in the wrong way.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: You're talking about one bill over another bill.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Really, what we're talking about is our objective, making sure that every single sick American in this country is able to get the health care that they need.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I believe Medicare for all is the way to do that.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I also think that employers will recognize how much money will be saved by supporting a Medicare for all program, a program that will reduce the administrative costs, reduce the bureaucratic costs, and make sure that everyone gets that quality health care that they need.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I also think that
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: if you  if you look at other countries in the world who have universal health care, every one of them has some form of a role of private insurance, so I think that's what we've got to look at, taking the best of these ideas, but making sure unequivocally that no sick American goes without getting the care that they need, regardless of how much or little money they have in their pocket.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Congresswoman, Congresswoman, thanks.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Let me turn to Senator Booker on this.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator Booker, explain to me where you are.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: This is hugely important to people.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So tell us where you are.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I absolutely will.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: First of all, we're talking about this as a health care issue, but in communities like mine, low-income communities, it's an education issue, because kids who don't have health care are not going to succeed in school.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It is an issue for jobs and employment, because people who do not have good health care do not succeed at work.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It's even a retirement issue, because in my community, African-Americans have a lower life expectancy because of poorer health care.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And so where I stand is very clear.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Health care  it's not just a human right, it should be an American right.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And I believe the best way to get there is Medicare for all.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: When I am president of the United States, I'm not going to wait.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We have to do the things immediately that are going to provide better care.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And on this debate, I'm sorry.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: There are too many people profiteering off of the pain of people in America, from pharmaceutical companies to insurers.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Literally, the overhead for insurance that they charge is 15 percent, while Medicare's overhead is only at 2 percent.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We can do this better.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And every single day, I will be fighting to give people more access and more affordable costs until we get to my goal
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Your time is up, Senator.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: which is every American having health care.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Time is up, Senator.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I want to
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I want to move back, if I can, to Congresswoman Gabbard
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: point, though, and that is that the insurance companies last year alone sucked $23 billion in profits out of the health care system, $23 billion.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And that doesn't count the money that was paid to executives, the money that was spent lobbying Washington.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We have a giant industry that wants our health care system to stay the way it is, because it's not working for families, but it's sure as heck working for them.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It's time for us to make families come first.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It should not be an option in the United States of America for any insurance company to deny a woman coverage for their exercise of their right of choice.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And I am the only candidate here who has passed a law protecting a woman's right of reproductive health in health insurance, and I'm the only candidate who has passed a public option.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And I respect everybody's goals and plans here, but we do have one candidate that's actually advanced the ball.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And we've got to have access for everyone.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I've done it as a public option.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Your time
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator Klobuchar, I want to get you
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That's a false claim.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I am fascinated by this.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator  Senator Klobuchar?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I just want to say, there's three women up here that have fought pretty hard for a woman's right to choose.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I'll start with that.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And then I just want to make very clear, I think we share the goal of universal health care.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And the idea I put out there, the public option, which the governor was just talking about, this idea is that you use Medicare or Medicaid without any insurance companies involved, you can do it either way.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And the estimates are 13 million people would see a reduction in their premiums, 12 more million people would get covered.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So I think it is a beginning and the way you start and the way you move to universal health care.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Secretary Castro, this one is for you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: All of you on stage support a woman's right to an abortion.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: You all support some version of a government health care option.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Would your plan cover abortion, Mr. Secretary?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Yes, it would.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I don't believe only in reproductive freedom, I believe in reproductive justice.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And, you know, what that means is that just because a woman  or let's also not forget someone in the trans community, a trans female, is poor, doesn't mean they shouldn't have the right to exercise that right to choose.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And so I absolutely would cover the right to have an abortion.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: More than that, everybody in this crowd and watching at home knows that in our country today, a person's right to choose is under assault in places like Missouri, in Alabama, in Georgia.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I would appoint judges to the federal bench that understand the precedent of Roe v. Wade and will respect it
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: and in addition to that, make sure that we fight hard as we transition our health care system to one where everybody can get and exercise that right.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator Warren, would you put limits on  any limits on abortion?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I would make certain that every woman has access to the full range of reproductive health care services, and that includes birth control, it includes abortion, it includes everything for a woman.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And I want to add on that.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It's not enough for us to expect the courts to protect us.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Forty-seven years ago, Roe v. Wade was decided, and we've all looked to the courts all that time, as state after state has undermined Roe, has put in exceptions, has come right up to the edge of taking away protections
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Your time is up, Senator.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We now have an America where most people support Roe v. Wade.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We need to make that a federal law.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Lester, thank you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator Booker, I want to kind of come back on a discussion we were having about health and the opioid crisis.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: You represent a state where 14 of the 20 largest pharmaceutical companies are based.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Should pharmaceutical companies that manufacture these drugs be held criminally liable for what they do?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: They should absolutely be held criminally liable, because they are liable and responsible.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: This is one of the reasons why well before I was running for president I said I would not take contributions from pharma companies, not take contributions from corporate PACs, or pharma executives, because they are part of this problem.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So the question is simply this.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And this opioid addiction in our country, we in cities like mine have been seeing how we've tried to arrest our way out of addiction for too long.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It is time that we have a national urgency to deal with this problem and make the solutions that are working to actually be the law of our land and make the pharmaceutical companies that are responsible help to pay for that.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Congressman O'Rourke, how would you deal with it?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Tonight in this country, you have 2.3 million of our fellow Americans behind bars.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It's the largest prison population on the face of the planet.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Many are there for nonviolent drug crimes, including possession of marijuana, at a time that more than half the states have legalized it or decriminalized it.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And yet despite what Purdue Pharma has done, their connection to the opioid crisis and the overdose deaths that we're seeing throughout this country, they've been able to act with complete impunity and pay no consequences, not a single night in jail.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Unless there's accountability and justice, this crisis will continue.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: In my administration, we will hold them to account.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We will make sure that they pay a price, and we will help those who've been victims of this malfeasance in this country get them treatment and long-term care.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I know immigration is on a lot of your minds here.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And I want to talk about it.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We're going to talk about it in a moment.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We need to take a break.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We'll be back with more from Miami after this.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We want to turn to an issue that has been in the news, especially this week.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: There are undocumented children being held alone in detention, even as close as Homestead, Florida, right here, less than 30 miles from where we are tonight.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Fathers and mothers and children are dying while trying to enter the United States of America.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We saw that image today that broke our hearts, and they had names.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Oscar Martinez and his 23-month-old daughter, Valeria, died trying to cross the river to ask for asylum in this country.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Last month, more than 130,000 migrants were apprehended at the southern border.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Secretary Castro, if you were president today, hoy, what would you specifically do?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you very much, Jose.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I'm very proud that in April I became the first candidate to put forward a comprehensive immigration plan.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And we saw those images
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: watching that image of Oscar and his daughter, Valeria, is heartbreaking.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It should also piss us all off.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: If I were president today  and it should spur us to action.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: If I were president today, I would sign an executive order that would get rid of Trump's zero-tolerance policy, the remain in Mexico policy, and the metering policy  this metering policy is basically what prompted Oscar and Valeria to make that risky swim across the river.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: They had been playing games with people who are coming and trying to seek asylum at our ports of entry.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Oscar and Valeria went to a port of entry, and then they were denied the ability to make an asylum claim, so they got frustrated and they tried to cross the river, and they died because of that.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: On day one.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Sorry, I'm just going to ask
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: On day one, I would do that executive order that would address metering.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And then I would follow that up in my first 100 days with immigration reform that would honor asylum claims, that would put undocumented immigrants, as long as they haven't committed a serious crime, on a pathway to citizenship.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And then we'd get to the root cause of the issue, which is we need a Marshall Plan for Honduras and Guatemala and El Salvador so that people can find safety and opportunity at home instead of coming to the United States to seek it.

text: Senator Booker, what would you do on day one?
