text: I'm going to get a couple of you in here.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thirty seconds, Congressman Delaney, you seem to believe you can do everything in a bipartisan manner.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Mitch McConnell doesn't operate that way.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: He operates differently.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Why do you think he is going to conform to your style?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I think we need to get things done.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That's why I believe we need to operate in a bipartisan manner.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Listen, I will sign into law bills that come to the White House that are passed on a party-line basis, absolutely.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: But all the big transformative things we've ever done in this country's history have happened when huge majorities of the American people get behind them, which is why we need real solutions, not impossible promises.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We need to put forth ideas that work, whether it's on health care, creating universal health care so that every American gets health care, but not running on making private insurance illegal.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: The gun issue is related.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: The gun safety issue is related, because I can't tell you how many times I've been with folks in Western Maryland, and they've said to me, you know, Democrats don't do anything for us, Republicans don't do anything for us.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: You fight all the time, so they vote on that single issue.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: OK.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: If we become the party of getting things done for the American people, with real solutions and not impossible promises, we'll be able to get all these things done.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I promised
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator Booker, 30 seconds.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: You  how do you deal with Mitch?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: You've been in the Senate.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: You can't get bills on the floor right now with Mitch McConnell.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Presidents can't do it.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Is President Booker going to get his bills on the floor with Senator McConnell?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: You know, when I got to the United States Senate, going back to what De Blasio said, as an African-American man in an African-American-dominated community, I knew one of the biggest issue was criminal justice reform, from police accountability to dealing with the fact that we have a nation that has more African-Americans under criminal supervision than all the slaves in 1850.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And when I got to the Senate, people told me we could not get a comprehensive criminal justice reform bill done.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: As my colleagues in the Senate know, I fought on that bill from the day I got to the Senate, built coalitions across the aisle, and today we passed the First Step Act.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It's not as far as I want to go, but thousands of people will be liberated.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I have gotten  I have taken on tough problems people said we cannot achieve, and I've been able to get things accomplished.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Senator Booker.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Rachel has got the next question.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We are going to  hold on.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Governor, you're going to be happy with where we go.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Just give us a second.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Governor Inslee, the next question is to you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: You got me?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Rachel.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: You have staked your candidacy on the issue of climate change.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It is first, second, and third priority for you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: You've said it's all the issues.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Let's get specific.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We're here in Miami, which is already experiencing serious flooding on sunny days as a result of sea level rise.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Parts of Miami Beach and the Keys could be underwater in our lifetimes.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Does your plan save Miami?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Yes, first by taking away the filibuster from Mitch McConnell, to start with.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We have to do that.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Look it, look it, we are the first generation to feel the sting of climate change, and we are the last that can do something it.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Our towns are burning.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Our fields are flooding.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Miami is inundated.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And we have to understand, this is a climate crisis, an emergency  this is our last chance in the administration, next one, to do something about it.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And we need to do what I've done in my state.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We've passed a 100 percent clean electrical grid bill.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We now have a vision statement.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And my plan has been called the gold standard of putting people to work.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: But the most important thing on this, in the biggest decision for the American public is, who is going to make this the first priority?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And I am the candidate and the only one who's saying this has to be the top priority of the United States, the organizing principle to mobilize the United States, so that we can do what we've always done, lead the world and invent the future and put 8 million people to work.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That's what we're going to do.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Governor Inslee, thank you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Congressman O'Rourke, you also put out a big climate change plan from your campaign.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: You want some big changes in a pretty short period of time, including switching to renewable energy, pushing to replace gas-powered cars in favor of electric ones.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: What's your message to a voter who supports the overall goal of what you're trying to do, but suddenly feels as if government's telling them how to live and ordering them how to live?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: What is that balance like?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I think you've got to bring everybody in to the decisions and the solutions to the challenges that we face.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That's why we're traveling everywhere, listening to everyone.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We were in Pacific Junction, a town that had never meaningly flooded before, just up against the Missouri River in Iowa.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And every home in that community had flooded.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: There were farms just outside of Pacific Junction that were effectively lakes, those farmers already underwater in debt, their markets closed to them by a trade war under this administration, and now they don't know what to do.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We in our administration are going fund resiliency in those communities, in Miami, in Houston, Texas, those places that are on the front lines of climate change today.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We're going to mobilize $5 trillion in this economy over the next 10 years.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We're going to free ourselves from a dependence on fossil fuels, and we're going to put farmers and ranchers in the driver's seat, renewable and sustainable agriculture, to make sure that we capture more carbon out of the air and keep more of it in the soil, paying farmers for the environmental services that they want to provide.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: If all of us does all that we can, then we're going to be able to keep this planet from warming another 2 degrees Celsius, and ensure that we match what this country can do and live up to our promise and our potential.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thirty seconds, Secretary Castro, does  who pays for the mitigation to  to climate, whether it's building sea walls, for people that are perhaps living in places that they shouldn't be living?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Is this a federal government issue that needs to do that?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Do they have to move these people?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: What do you do about that, where maybe they're building a place someplace that isn't safe?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Who pays to build that house?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And how much should the government be bailing them out?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Well, I don't think that that represents the vast majority of the issue.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: In fact, you know, my first visit after I announced my candidacy wasn't to Iowa or New Hampshire.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It was to San Juan, Puerto Rico.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Because people should know that if I'm elected president, everybody will count.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And, you know, I'm one of the few candidates in this race with executive experience, with a track record of getting things done.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: When I was mayor of San Antonio, we moved our local public utility, we began to shift it from coal-fired plants to solar and other renewables, and also created more than 800 jobs doing that.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And when I was HUD secretary, we worked on the National Disaster Resilience Competition to invest in communities that were trying to rebuild from natural disasters in a sustainable way.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That's the way that we're going to help make sure that we're all safer in the years to come and that we combat climate change.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And if I'm elected president, the first thing that I would do, like Senator Klobuchar also has said, is sign an executive order recommitting us to the Paris Climate Accord so that we lead again
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: All right.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Congressman Ryan, I got a full question for you here, which is simply this.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: There are  a lot of the climate plans include pricing carbon, taxing carbon in some way.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: This type of proposal has been tried in a few places, whether it's Washington state where voters voted it down, you've had the Yellow Vest Movement, we had in Australia one party get rejected out of fear of the cost of climate change sort of being put on the backs of the consumer.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: If pricing carbon is just politically impossible, how do we pay for climate mitigation?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Well, there is a variety of different ways to pay.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We talked about different ways of raising revenue.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And I think we've got to build our way out of this and grow our way out of this.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: But let me just talk real quick to the previous question about real politics.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We could talk about climate, we could talk about guns, we could talk about all of these issues that we all care about.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We have a perception problem with the Democratic Party.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We are not connecting to the working class people in the very states that I represent in Ohio, in the industrial Midwest.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We've lost all connection.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And to me, this means better childcare for everyone in this country.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Conceded.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We have got to change the center of gravity of the Democratic Party from being coastal and elital  elitist and Ivy League, which is the perception, to somebody from the forgotten communities that have been left behind for the last 30 years, to get those workers back on our side so we can say we're going to build electric vehicles, we're going to build solar panels.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: But if you want to beat Mitch McConnell, this better be a working-class party.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: If you want to go into Kentucky and take his rear end out, and if you want to take Lindsey Graham out, you've got to have a blue collar party that can go into the textile communities in South Carolina.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So all I'm saying here
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Congressman Ryan.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: All I'm saying here
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Congressman Ryan.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So, Chuck, Chuck
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: All I'm saying is here, if we don't address that fundamental problem with our connection to workers  white, black, brown, gay, straight  working-class people
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Congressman.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: none of this is going to get done, Chuck.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you very much.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Chuck
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I want to you  we're going to keep moving.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Congressman Delaney, I'm going to get to you
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: This is  I introduced the only bipartisan carbon tax bill
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thirty seconds  all right, 30 seconds, go.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: This is really important.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: All the economists agree that a carbon pricing mechanism works.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: You just have to do it right.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: You can't put a price on carbon, raise energy prices, and not give the money back to the American people.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: My proposal, which is put a price on carbon, give a dividend back to the American people.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It goes out one pocket, back in the other.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Congressman.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I can get that passed my first year as president with a coalition of every Democrat in the Congress and the Republicans who live in coastal states.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Congressman, thank you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Because Republicans in Florida, they actually care about this issue.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: OK.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you very much.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: This has got to be our way forward if we're actually serious about this issue.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Congresswoman Gabbard, we're going to move here.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: One of the first things you did after launching your campaign was to issue an apology to the LGBT community about your past stances and statements on gay rights.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: After the Trump administration's rollbacks of civil rights protections for many in that community, why should voters in that community or voters that care about this issue in general trust you now?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Let me say that there is no one in our government at any level who has the right to tell any American who they should be allowed to love or who they should be allowed to marry.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: My record in Congress for over six years shows my commitment to fighting for LGBTQ equality.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I serve on the Equality Caucus and recently voted for passage of the Equality Act.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Maybe many people in this country can relate to the fact that I grew up in a socially conservative home, held views when I was very young that I no longer hold today.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I've served with LGBTQ servicemembers, both in training and deployed downrange.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I know that they would give their life for me and I would give my life for them.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It is this commitment that I'll carry through as president of the United States, recognizing that there are still people who are facing discrimination in the workplace, still people who are unable to find a home for their families.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It is this kind of discrimination that we need to address.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: But it's not enough.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Congresswoman Gabbard.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It's not enough.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: If I can add to this, it's very important.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thirty seconds, Senator.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It's not enough.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Look, civil rights is someplace to begin, but in the African American civil rights community, another place to focus on was to stop the lynching of African-Americans.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We do not talk enough about trans Americans, especially African-American trans Americans
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: and the incredibly high rates of murder right now.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We don't talk enough about how many children, about 30 percent of LGBTQ kids, who do not go to school because of fear.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It's not enough just to be on the Equality Act.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I'm an original co-sponsor.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We need to have a president that will fight to protect LGBTQ Americans every single day from violence in America.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator Klobuchar, let me put this to you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: On the issue of civil rights, for decades  on the civil rights and demographics, honestly, and politics, for decades, the Democratic Party has counted on African-American voter turnout as step one to winning elections on a national level.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Democrats are counting on the Latino community now and in the future in the same way.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: What have you done for black and Latino voters that should enthuse them about going to the polls for you if you're your party's nominee?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: My life and my career and my work in the Senate has been about economic opportunity.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And when you want an economy that works, you need to have retirement that works, you need to have public schools that work.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And you also need to make sure that those communities are able to get those jobs of the future, the STEM jobs.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: In fact, Donald Trump, one of the first bills that he signed of the 34 he signed where I was the lead Democrat  OK, that's a first up here  was one that was about that, making sure minority community members could share in those jobs.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So to me, this is about a few things.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It's about an African-American woman that goes to a hospital in New Orleans, says her hands are swollen, and then doctor ignores her and her baby dies.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It's about the fact that African-American women make 61 cents for every dollar a white man makes.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So in short, we need, one  and I will do this in my first 100 days as president  we will work to make sure everyone can vote at this table, everyone can vote in this country
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That's time, Senator.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: and we will also go to the next step of criminal justice reform.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator Booker and I worked on that First Step Act, but we should go to the second step act, which is to help all our communities across our country.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator, thank you very much.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thirty-second follow-up to you, Secretary Castro.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: This is a 70 percent Latino city here in Miami.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: You are the only Latino Democrat who is running here this year in the presidential race.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Is that enough of an answer, what Senator Klobuchar is describing there, an economic justice agenda?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Is that enough to mobilize Latino voters to stand with the Democratic Party in a big way?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Well, I also think that we have to recognize racial and social justice.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And, you know, I was in Charleston not too long ago, and I remembered that Dylann Roof went to the Mother Emanuel AME church, and he murdered nine people who were worshipping, and then he was apprehended by police without incident.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Well, but what about Eric Garner and Tamir Rice and Laquan McDonald and Sandra Bland and Pamela Turner and Antonio Arce?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I'm proud that I'm the only candidate so far that has put forward legislation that would reform our policing system in America and make sure that no matter what the color of your skin is, that you're treated the same, including Latinos who are mistreated too oftentimes by police.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Secretary Castro, thank you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Let me go over to Lester Holt, who's got a question, I believe a viewer question.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And I'm over here, Chuck.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thanks.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We asked voters from across the country to submit their questions to the candidates.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Let me read one now.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: This comes from John in New York who submitted this question.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: He asks, does the United States have a responsibility to protect in the case of genocide or crimes against humanity?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Do we have a responsibility to intervene to protect people threatened by their governments even when atrocities do not affect American core interests?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I would like to direct that question to Congressman O'Rourke.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: John, appreciate the question.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: The answer is yes, but that action should always be undertaken with allies and partners and friends.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: When the United States presents a united front, we have a much better chance of achieving our foreign policy aims and preventing the kind of genocide to which you refer, the kind of genocide that we saw in Rwanda, the kind of genocide we want to stop going forward.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: But unfortunately, under this administration, President Trump has alienated our allies and our friends and our alliances.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: He's diminished our standing in the world and he's made us weaker as a country, less able to confront challenges, whether it's Iran or North Korea or Vladimir Putin in Russia, who attacked and invaded our democracy in 2016, and who President Trump has offered another invitation to do the same.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: He's embraced strongmen and dictators at the expense of the great democracies.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: As president, I will make sure that we live our values in our foreign policy.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I will ensure that we strengthen those alliances and partnerships and friendships and meet any challenge that we face together.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That makes America stronger.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: But what about the War Powers Act?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Congressman O'Rourke, thank you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: What about the War Powers Act being a part of that equation?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: With deep respect to the congressman, look, we've learned painful lessons as Americans that we've gone to war without congressional authorization.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And look, this is very personal for me.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I know the cost of war.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: My dad served in the Pacific in World War II in the U.S. Army, Battle of Okinawa, had half his leg blown off, and he came home with scars, both physical and emotional, and he did not recover.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: He spiraled downward and he ultimately took his own life.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And that battle didn't kill him, but that war did.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And, look, even in the humanitarian crisis  and I think we should be ready, Congressman, to intervene, God forbid there is genocide  but not without congressional approval.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Democrats and Republicans both in the Congress have not challenged presidents and have let them get away with running the military without that congressional approval.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We learned a lesson in Vietnam we seem to have forgotten, that decisions have to be made by the United States Congress
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I'm going to pick up  I want to pick up this point, and I want to put this to Congressman Ryan.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Today the Taliban claimed responsibility for killing two American servicemembers in Afghanistan.

text: Leaders as disparate as President Obama and President Trump have both said that they want to end U.S. involvement in Afghanistan, but it isn't over for America.

text: First, I listen to people and that's how I get things done.

text: That is my focus.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I have a track record of passing over 100 bills where I'm the lead Democrat.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And that is because I listened and I acted.

text: And I think that's important in a president.

text: Everything else just melts away.

text: Secondly, I'm someone that can win and beat Donald trump.

text: Everyone in America knows we have too much gun violence.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: The problem we have is that corporations have bought Washington, D.C.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: The gun manufacturers own the Senate of the United States.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: So even though more than 90 percent of Americans want mandatory background checks on every gun purchase, we can't get it through the Senate.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: So the question you have to ask yourself is, how do we change the Senate of the United States in a material way?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And there are two things.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: That's why I am for term limits of 12 years for every congressperson and senator, to change who's in charge, to get rid of Mitch McConnell and Lindsey Graham and Ted Cruz.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: But I am also -- Senator Sanders is right.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We need to win a huge victory across the board.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: All right, Mr. Steyer.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Democrats need to go to the grassroots.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I built one of the biggest grassroots organizations in the United States.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Your time's up, sir.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: The way to win at the grassroots is, tell the truth and organize.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Your time's up, sir.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Bill Whitaker?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: That's what it's going to take in 2020.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Your time's up, sir.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Bill Whitaker?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Let's talk about education.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: South Carolina's schools score in the bottom half of the national assessment.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Black students here consistently score worse than white students.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Mayor Bloomberg, a key element of your response to failing schools in New York City was a dramatic increase in public charter schools.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: As president, would you pursue that same strategy and seek to expand charter schools nationwide?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I'm not sure they're appropriate every place.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I can only tell you, in New York, they provided parents with an alternative to send students to them.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We had -- the charter schools are mixed in with the non-charter public schools, because our charter schools are public schools, as well.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: They've helped each other.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I saw a statistic the other day, when I came into office, zero New York City schools were in the top 25 of the state.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: When I left, 23 out of 25 were from New York City.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We've cut the gap between the rich and the poor.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We've made an enormous difference in all of the options that parents have.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I raised teacher salaries by 43 percent.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I put an extra $5 billion into our school system.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I value education.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It is the only way to solve the poverty problem is to get people a good education.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And rather than just talk about it in New York, we actually did it.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Senator Warren?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: So this is one thing where a president can make a big difference all by herself.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And I'm going to start with my secretary of education.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: My secretary of education will be someone who has taught in public school.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: My secretary of education will be someone who believes in public education.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And my secretary of education will believe that public dollars should stay in public schools.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: One more thing.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: My secretary of education will believe that it is time to get rid of high-stakes testing.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We need to support our children.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: But, look, we want to build a future in this country?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We build a future by investing in our children.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I've got a plan to put $800 billion new federal dollars into our public schools.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Thank you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Education is not free.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We must invest in the future of our children.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Senator Sanders?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: This campaign, our campaign, our campaign is about changing American priorities.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Instead of giving tax breaks to billionaires, we're going to have high-quality, universal childcare for every family in this country.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Because the psychologists tell us 0 to 4 are the most important years of human development.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We are going to triple funding for low-income Title I schools, because kids' education should not depend upon the ZIP Code in which they live.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We're going to make public colleges and universities tuition-free through a tax on Wall Street speculation.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And we're going to move to make certain that no teacher in America earns less than $60,000 a year.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We want great teachers.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Can I...
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Mayor Buttigieg?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Look, the best thing that we can do to support public education is to support public educators.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I'm a little biased, because I'm married to one.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And I get an education about education every day I come home.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I have seen how teachers are expected to dip into their own pockets to furnish their classrooms.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Teachers are being expected to handle the mental health challenges that their students are facing because we don't have an adequate mental health system to support kids.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And now some politicians, because they aren't willing to face the need for commonsense gun law, are expecting teachers to somehow transform themselves into highly trained armed guards when there's a threat to a classroom.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We have to show not only with compensation, but with support for the profession overall our regard for those who are educating our kids.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And, yes, that means a secretary of education who will support teachers.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It also means investing.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Thank you...
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I'm proposing an education access...
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: One way we -- one way we can support our teachers is to cancel student loan debt.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We're going to pass this on to Major.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Candidates, good evening.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Candidates, good evening.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: People across this country are being crushed by student loan debt.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: This is an issue we need to talk about.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And that's what my plan would do, through the education...
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: As we all know, as we all know, the political conversation in our country is interactive, and because of our partner, Twitter, this debate is no different.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: So I want to put a question from Twitter to you, Senator Klobuchar.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: This is from Casey Pennington.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: How will your policies address and ensure affordable housing and education equity for minimum wage workers?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Thank you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: This is one of the first times we've talked about housing.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And I put forward an extensive policy.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I think -- when I've looked at this both in my job in local government and in the Senate, one sure way we can make sure that kids get a good start is if they have a roof over their head and a stable place to live.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: So the way you do that is, first of all, taking care of the Section 8 backlog of applicants.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: There are literally hundreds of thousands of people waiting.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And I have found a way to pay for this and a way to make sure that people get off that list and get into housing.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Secondly, you create incentives for affordable housing to be built and, third, to help people pay for it.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And I want to make clear, given South Carolina and the rural population, as well as urban, that this isn't just an urban problem.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It's a big urban problem, but it's also a rural problem, where we have housing deserts and people want to have their businesses located there, but they're not able to get housing.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: So for me, it's building a coalition.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And I actually like to get these things done and to -- the way you do it is by building a coalition between urban and rural so you can pass affordable housing and finally get it done.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: This is a point...
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Senator Warren, hold on one second, because I want to -- I want to...
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: This is a point where we need to talk about race, though.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I understand.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It is not enough to talk about housing neutrally...
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Can we just speak up when we want to?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Is that the idea?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: ... and just be race-blind.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It is important to recognize the role that the federal government played for decades and decades in discriminating against African-Americans having an opportunity to buy homes.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: That's red-lining.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Mayor...
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And while Mayor Bloomberg was blaming the housing crash of 2008 on African-Americans and on Latinos, in fact, I was out there fighting for a consumer agency to make sure people never get cheated again on their mortgages.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We have a -- I have a housing plan, and what it has in it specifically...
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Senator Warren, thank you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: ... is a piece...
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Senator Warren, thank you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: ... to deal with the effects of red-lining.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We can no longer pretend that everything is race-neutral.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We have got to address race consciously, what's happening in this country.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: OK. Mayor Bloomberg, please, we were going to ask you about this.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I want to give you a chance to respond, because in addition to what Senator Warren just said on Twitter, she called you a liar and a borderline racist because of what you said about red-lining.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Yes, she's -- I'm sorry, but, unfortunately, she's misinformed on red-lighting.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: You can go back and look at the record.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I fought against it before '08, the crisis, during '08, and after that.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Red-lining is not the problem with the mortgage market, but it was a problem for the communities where it was done, and we stopped that.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Let me also say, because just -- since I have the floor for a second, that I really am surprised that all of these -- my fellow contestants up here, I guess, would be the right word for it...
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: ... given nobody pays attention to the clock -- I'm surprised they show up, because I would have thought after I did such a good job in beating them last week, that they'd be a little bit afraid to do that.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: But let me just say, when you're talking about affordable housing, we created 175,000 units of affordable housing in New York City.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And I listened to them.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: They're in Congress and they say they can't get it done, can't get it done.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: But if you change something like the president, they would.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: No, you have to learn how to work with both sides of the aisle and then you can get stuff done.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I did it in New York City.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I got the Republican State Senate to vote for gay marriage virtually before anybody else in this country.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: You can work across the aisle.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: You just have to know how to deal with people.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Mayor Bloomberg, thank you very much.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Back to you, Bill.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Vice President Biden, black men earn 73 cents for every dollar earned by white men, are about twice as likely to be unemployed, five times more likely to be incarcerated, conditions that ripple across black families and have endured during both Democratic and Republican administrations.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: How do you convince black voters that you can change years of inequities?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Two ways.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Number one, my entire life I've been involved with the black community.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I was a public defender.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I worked in the projects, I came along, and the first thing I did as the chairman of the Judiciary Committee, extended the Voting Rights Act eventually for 25 years.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And I have been deeply involved.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And my first effort I had as a councilman was doing away with red-lining in the county.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: The way we do this, we've got to help them create wealth, and that's why we double the amount of money that is available for young entrepreneurs and black entrepreneurs, are as successful as any other group of people in the country.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We go from 1.5 billion to $3 billion, taking $30 billion off the sidelines.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: That's how you create wealth.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Secondly, I provide for the opportunity for first-time home buyers to be able to have a $15,000 tax credit so they can get the mortgage at the front end and be able to keep it.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Thirdly, I go after those people who are involved gentrification, because what's happening is we're moving people out of their neighborhoods in ways that in fact make no sense.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: They're being bought out.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: You cannot find a place to live.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And thirdly, I make sure that with regard to housing, we allow people -- look, right now if you live in a black neighborhood and you have the same exact house as the guy across the street in a white neighborhood has, your house is valued significantly less than the white, the same exact house.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We've got to deal with the institutional racism.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Thank you, Mr. Vice President.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I note how you cut me off all the time but I'm not going to be quiet anymore, OK?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Mr. Steyer.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Every single policy area in the United States has a gigantic subtext of race.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We're talking about education.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We're talking about criminal justice.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We're talking about housing.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We're talking about loans.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I started a bank to basically correct the injustice in the financial services industry.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Basically, to make loans to black-owned, Latino-owned, and women-owned businesses.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We've supported over 8,000 affordable housing units.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: But more than that, I believe I'm the only person on this stage who believes in reparations for slavery.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Something happened.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We should have a formal commission on race to retell the story of the last 400-plus years in America of African-Americans, of systematic legal injustice, discrimination, and cruelty, but also of 400-plus years of contribution in terms of building the United States of America and leading the United States of America from a moral standpoint.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Thank you, Mr. Steyer.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Senator Klobuchar, next question, new topic, new topic.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Senator Klobuchar...
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: ... for this whole campaign, I don't know where you got the impression...
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: If you could honor the rules of the debate, thank you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Senator Klobuchar, I'd like to change topics and ask you, rural areas have populations who are older, sicker, and poorer than non-rural communities.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And they have to travel farther to get medical help when they need it.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Expanding coverage is going to be useless if there are no providers to go to.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: So how would you ensure that there is available health care in rural areas?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: People aren't always aware, I know you are in South Carolina, about how much poverty there is, particularly child poverty in rural areas.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: So the answer is one size doesn't fit all.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And one of the ways you do this, right now we have something called critical access hospitals so they're designated for rural areas.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And actually, I am leading -- the lead Democrat on a bill to extend that, to have other types of hospitals, like emergency rooms in rural areas be covered.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: The other issue is we don't have enough personnel.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And so that's where we get to this education plan.. And I don't want agree with some of my colleagues here about putting hard-earned taxpayer money into rich kids going to college.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: What I think we need to do instead is look at what our needs are in our economy.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We're going to have a million openings for home health care workers, particularly in rural areas, that we don't know how to fill.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We're going to have over 100,000 openings for nursing assistants.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We're not going to have a shortage of sports marketing degrees.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We're going to have a shortage of plumbers and nurses.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: So putting incentives in place with how we do loan payback, making one- and two-year degrees free, and then of course creating loan payback programs if people will go, especially medical students, into rural areas.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Final thing is comprehensive immigration reform.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I have passed...
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Senator, time.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I have passed the bill that allows doctors from other countries that study in our medical schools to stay and serve in rural areas.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We need to expand that.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Mayor Buttigieg, the floor is yours, would you like -- same question.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Yes, so, when I was born, there was no difference in your life expectancy, if you were born in a rural area or a city.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Now the gap is the biggest it has been in a generation, and that is particularly affecting black rural families in places like South Carolina.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We're seeing hospital closures right and left.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And we're seeing them, in particular, in states where Medicaid was not expanded, something that is hurting black and poor white families and is largely the result of racial voters suppression.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: See, all of these things are connected, housing, wages, the ability to get anything meaningful done on criminal justice reform.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: All of these things are going to be harder to deal with as long as black voices are systematically excluded from political participation, which is happening on everything from the purging of voter rolls to the closing of voting locations.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And that harms everyone.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: You're out of time, sir.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It's why in my Frederick Douglass plan for comprehensively dealing with these issues, part of the core of it is a 21st Century Voting Rights Act.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Senator Sanders.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Yes, I'm very proud working with Congressman Jim Clyburn, South Carolina, that we increased funding for the Community Health Center Program by $11 billion as part of the Affordable Care Act, which now provides for 9 million Americans access to primary health care, dental care, mental health counseling, and low-cost prescription drugs, in that bill.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We also put $2 billion into a program which would provide debt forgiveness for doctors, nurses, dentists, we have a major dental affordable crisis in this country, to make sure that they are practicing in underserved areas.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: The advantage of a Medicare for All health care program, because it's not driven by profits for the drug companies and the insurance companies, we will have health care for all people in all parts of this country.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: But in order for any of that to happen it has to pass.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And we're talking about a plan that...
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Thank you.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Next topic.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Gayle?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: ... even goes beyond even what they do...
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I'm sorry, we're going to go to Mayor Bloomberg.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We're going to change topics.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Mayor Bloomberg, as mayor of New York, you declared war on obesity, you banned trans-fats from restaurants and you tried to do the same thing with large surgary drinks.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: So if you become president, will you push those policies on the national level as well?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Well, I think what's right for New York City isn't necessarily right for all the other cities, otherwise you would have a naked cowboy in every city.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: So let's get serious here.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: But I do think it's the government's job to have good science and to explain to people what science says or how to take care of themselves and extend their lives.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: The -- we are a country where there are too many people that are obese.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We should do something about that.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: But just a look what happened with smoking.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We did ban smoking in New York City in public places, restaurants, offices, and that sort of thing.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And it has spread across America, across Europe, across Latin America, even into places in the Middle East and into the Far East.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It has saved an enormous number of lives.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: So it just goes to show, if you have good public health, then you can do things.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I have more hair than I think I do.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And one of the great problems today, you read about the virus, what's really happening here is the president fired the pandemic specialist in this country two years ago.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: So there's nobody here to figure out what the hell we should be doing.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And he has defunded -- he had defunded Centers for Disease Control, CDC, so we don't have the organization we need.

text: This is a very serious thing.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: As you see, the stock market is falling apart because people are really worried and they should be.

text: We're going to talk about that.

text: We don't have anybody to respond.

text: I'm sorry.

text: Before I leave you, are New Yorkers living longer because of your policies?

text: There's no question about that.

text: All right.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Before I left, life expectancy in New York City had grown by three years during our 12 years in office such that, when I left, it was three years greater than the national average.

text: All right.

text: Vice President Biden, please.

text: Vice President Biden.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Look, one of the things we have to do, we have a thing in the Defense Department called DARPA, a special operation thing to find out all the things we have to deal to make us safer.

text: They came up with the internet, I mean, they came up with the internet, they came up with the whole idea of stealth technology.

text: I'm going to do the same thing at the National Institute of Health.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We're going to focus at least $50 billion over the first five years on -- focusing on obesity, diabetes, Alzheimer's, and cancer.

text: And we're going to make that investment because no one else is willing to make that investment.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We can, in fact, find cures if we make the investment, and we can get that done.

text: The American people support it.

text: Even Republicans will support it.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We have to focus on extending life, saving life, and making people -- put them in a position to be able to live longer and more securely.

text: All right, Senator  Biden, thank you.

text: Senator Klobuchar, Senator Sanders wants to legalize marijuana on day one of his presidency...

text: ... and is promising to expunge the record of anyone who has been arrested for possession.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: As a former prosecutor, is that a a realistic promise?
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Well, it is realistic to want to legalize marijuana, I want to do that, too.

text: And I also think you need to look back and -- at people's records and you maybe can't do it on day one, as he said.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I think you want to have a process that you go through, because there's too many people that have things on their records that have stopped them from getting jobs.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I think a lot of what we also need to do is to make sure that when we do this that we have money for treatment.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And it's not necessarily because of marijuana.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It is because of things like opioids and the like.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And that's why one of the first plans I put out was for treatment, because if you want to make the criminal justice system work, you don't want to have repeat customers, and you want to help people to get off of drugs.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And the way you do that is with drug courts.
title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: The way you do that, by the way, is with my proposal for a clemency board in the White House so that you don't have a president that pell-mell gives pardons to his buddies and to white-collar offenders, but that, instead, you have a set process that you use that's fair and is outside of the Justice Department, and while getting their advice.

text: All right, thank you, Senator Klobuchar.

title: 1st 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: What would you do?

text: What we did with Ebola -- I was part of making sure that pandemic did not get to the United States, saved millions of lives.

text: And what we did, we set up, I helped set up that office in the presidency, in the president's office, on -- on diseases that are pandemic diseases.

text: We increased the budget of the CDC.
title: 10th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We increased the NIH budget.

text: We should -- and our president today -- and he's wiped all that out.

text: We stopped it.

text: And the second thing I'd point out to you is that what I would do immediately is restore the funding.

text: I could get that done.
