text: Everyone understands the urgency, but we've got two problems.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The first is corruption, an industry that makes its money felt all through Washington.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The first thing I want to do in Washington is pass my anti-corruption bill so that we can start making the changes we need to make on climate.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And the second is the filibuster.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: If you're not willing to roll back the filibuster, then you're giving the fossil fuel industry a veto overall of the work that we need to do.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Vanessa -- Senator, thank you, Vanessa has got the next question.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Can I respond?
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: She mentioned me.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Vice President Biden, you have said that you want to hold oil and gas executives accountable for their role in harming our planet.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You have even suggested that you might put them in jail.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Which companies are you talking about?
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And how far are you willing to go?
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'm willing to go as far as we have to.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: First of all, I would eliminate all the subsidies we have for oil and gas, eliminate it, period.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That would save millions and millions -- billions of dollars.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Number two, I think that any executive who is engaged -- and by the way, minority communities are the communities that are being most badly hurt by the way in which we deal with climate change.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They are the ones that become the victims.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's where the asthma is, that's where the groundwater supply has been polluted.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's where, in fact, people, in fact, do not have the opportunity to be able to get away from everything from asbestos in the walls of our schools.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I have a trillion-dollar program for infrastructure.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That will provide for thousands and thousands of new jobs, not $15 an hour, but $50 an hour, plus benefits, unions, unions being able to do that.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And what it does is, it will change the nature -- look, here's the last point I want -- and my time is going to run out.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Here's the last point I want to make to you.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: On day one, when I'm elected president, I'm going to invite all of the members of the Paris Accord to Washington, D.C.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They make up 85 percent of the problem.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They know me.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'm used to dealing with international relations.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I will get them to up the ante in a big way.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Vice President Biden, you didn't answer my questions.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I thought I did.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'm sorry.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: What would you do with these companies that are responsible for the destruction of our planet?
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: What would I do with them?
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I would make sure they, number one, stop.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Number two, if you demonstrate that they, in fact, have done things already that are bad and they've been lying, they should be able to be sued, they should be able to be held personally accountable, and they should -- and not only the company, not the stockholders, but the CEOs of those companies.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They should be engaged.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And it's a little bit like -- look, this is the industries we should be able to sue.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We should go after -- just like we did the drug companies, just like we did with the tobacco companies.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The only company we can't go after are gun manufacturers, because of my buddy here.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But that's a different story...
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We're going to stay on the topic.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: My question is to Mayor Bloomberg.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Mayor Bloomberg, your business is heavily invested in China.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I think you mentioned that a few questions back.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The number one producer in the world of carbon emissions.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: How far would you go to force China to reduce those emissions and tackle the climate crisis?
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Well, you're not going to go to war with them.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You have to negotiate with them and try to -- and we've seen how well that works with tariffs that are hurting us.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: What you have to do is convince the Chinese that it is in their interest, as well.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Their people are going to die just as our people are going to die.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And we'll work together.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: In all fairness, the China has slowed down.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It's India that is an even bigger problem.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But it is an enormous problem.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Nobody's doing anything about it.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We could right here in America make a big difference.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We're closing the coal-fired power plants.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: If we could enforce some of the rules on fracking so that they don't release methane into the air and into the water, you'll make a big difference.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But we're not going to get rid of fracking for a while.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And we, incidentally not just natural gas.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You frack oil, as well.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It is a technique, and when it's done poorly, like they're doing in too many places where the methane gets out into the air, it is very damaging.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Other countries tried that.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But it's a transition fuel, I think the senator said it right.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We want to go to all renewables.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But that's still many years from now.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And we -- before I think the senator mentioned 2050 for some data.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: No scientist thinks the numbers for 2050 are 2050 anymore.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The world is coming apart faster than any scientific study had predicted.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We've just got to do something now.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Mayor Buttigieg, your thoughts.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Let's be real about the deadline.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It's not 2050, it's not 2040, it's not 2030.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Because if we don't elect a president who actually believes in climate science now, we will never meet any of the other scientific or policy deadlines that we need to.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So first of all, let's make sure we're actually positioned to win, which, once again, if we put forward two of the most polarizing figures on this stage as the only option, it's going to be a real struggle.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Now, I've got a plan to get us carbon neutral by 2050.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I think everybody up here has a plan that more or less does the same.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So the real question is, how are we going to actually get it done?
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We need leadership to make this a national project that breaks down the partisan and political tug of war that prevents anything from getting done.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: How do you do it?
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Well, first of all, making sure that those jobs are available quickly.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Secondly, ensuring that we are pulling in those very sectors who have been made to feel like they're part of the problem, from farming to industry, and fund as well as urge them to do the right thing.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And then global climate diplomacy.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'm a little skeptical of the idea that convincing is going to do the trick when it comes to working with China.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: America has repeatedly overestimated our ability to shape Chinese ambitions.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But what we can do is ensure that we use the hard tools...
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: All right, Mayor Buttigieg.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Warner?
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: ... to enforce what has to happen...
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Yes, I want to make sure that the question of environmental justice gets more than a glancing blow in this debate...
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: ... because for generations now in this country, toxic waste dumps, polluting factories have been located in or near communities of color, over and over and over.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And the consequences are felt in the health of young African-American babies, it's felt in the health of seniors, people with compromised immune systems.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It's also felt economically.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Who wants to move into an area where the air smells bad or you can't drink the water?
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I have a commitment of a trillion dollars to repair the damage that this nation has permitted to inflict on communities of color for generations now.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have to own up to our responsibility.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We cannot simply talk about climate change in big, global terms.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We need to talk about it in terms of rescuing the communities that have been damaged.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Warren, thank you.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Hallie?
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Vice President Biden, I want to ask you about something else that is important to people here.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I want to ask you about Latinos, owning one out of every four new small businesses in the United States.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Many of them have benefited from President Trump's tax cuts, and they may be hesitant about new taxes or regulations.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Will taxes on their small businesses go up under your administration?
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: No.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Taxes on small businesses won't go up.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: As a matter of fact, we're going to make sure there's more money available for small businesses in the Latino community and the black community to be able to get the capital to start businesses.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And at the Treasury Department, there's going to be a window available where we significantly increase the amount of money available so people can borrow the money to get started.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They have demonstrated they're incredibly successful.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We should not be raising taxes on them.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We should start rewarding work, not just wealth.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's why we have to change the tax code the way it is.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's why the wealthy have to start to pay their fair share.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And that's why we have to focus on giving people the ability to garner wealth, generate wealth.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And that's why this whole idea of red-lining, lending to people in areas wasn't the cause of Wall Street failing.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The greed of Wall Street was the reason why it occurred, not red-lining.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And lastly I want to say, look, the idea of China, China is -- and their Belt and Road proposal, they're taking the dirtiest coal in the world mostly out of Mongolia and spreading it all around the world.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It's clear.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Make it clear when you call them to Washington in the first 100 days, if you continue, you will suffer severe consequences because the rest of the world will impose tariffs on everything you're selling because you are undercutting the entire economy.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Mr. Vice President.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Mayor Buttigieg, will taxes on those businesses go up under you?
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Not if they are small businesses.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I mean, what we've got to do is level the playing field, where a company like Amazon or Chevron is paying literally zero on billions of dollars in profits and it puts small businesses, like the ones that are revitalizing my own city, often Latino-owned on our west side, at a disadvantage.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We need to recognize that investing in Latino entrepreneurship is not just an investment in the Latino community, it is an investment in the future of America.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And it is time for a president who understands the value of immigration in lifting up all of our communities and our country.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We're getting the exact opposite message from the current president.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And it is time to recognize not just the diversity of the Latino community, but the importance of issues like economic empowerment, like health care, as well as immigration.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have a tax system...
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have an entrepreneurship gap in America.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And that is a gap between white entrepreneurs and black and Latino entrepreneurs.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And the principal reason for this is they don't have the money for equity to get the businesses started.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It's about a $7 billion gap.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We want to have real entrepreneurship and a level playing field.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I have a plan to put the $7 billion in to have the fund managed by the people...
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator, thank you.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: ... who are routinely cut out.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: When we talk...
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It can't just be about taxes.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is a record number of candidates for a presidential primary debate, so to accommodate the large group, there are no opening statements tonight.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'm Anderson Cooper moderating tonight's debate, along with CNN's Erin Burnett and New York Times national editor Mark Lacey.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We are in Ohio tonight, because it's one of the most critical battleground states.

text: Ohio has backed all but two presidential winners in every election since 1896.

text: I sit on the Armed Services Committee.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We need to make an investment to level the playing field and end the black and white wealth...
title: 9th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We want to welcome our viewers in the United States and watching around the world, watching us on CNN, CNN International, CNN En Espanol, Cnn.com, thenewyorktimes.com, CNN's Facebook page, and listening on the Westwood One radio network, SiriusXM satellite radio, NPR, and the American Forces Network.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And live from Otterbein University, just north of Columbus, Ohio, this is the CNN-New York Times Democratic presidential debate.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Before we begin, a reminder of the ground rules.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You'll each receive 75 seconds to answer questions, 45 seconds for responses and rebuttals, and 15 seconds for clarifications.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Please refrain from interrupting your fellow candidates, as that will count against your time.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And we remind our audience here in the Rike Center at Otterbein to be respectful so the candidates can hear the questions and each other.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: All right, let's begin.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Since the last debate, House Democrats have officially launched an impeachment inquiry against President Trump, which all the candidates on this stage support.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Warren, I want to start with you.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You have said that there's already enough evidence for President Trump to be impeached and removed from office.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But the question is, with the election only one year away, why shouldn't it be the voters who determine the president's fate?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Because sometimes there are issues that are bigger than politics.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I think that's the case with this impeachment inquiry.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: When I made the decision to run for president, I certainly didn't think it was going to be about impeachment.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But when the Mueller report came out, I read it, all 442 pages.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And when I got to the end, I realized that Mueller had shown, too, a fare-thee-well, that this president had obstructed justice and done it repeatedly.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And so at that moment, I called for opening an impeachment inquiry.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Now, that didn't happen.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And look what happened as a result.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Donald Trump broke the law again in the summer, broke it again this fall.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You know, we took a constitutional oath, and that is that no one is above the law, and that includes the president of the United States.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Impeachment is the way that we establish that this man will not be permitted to break the law over and over without consequences.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is about Donald Trump, but, understand, it's about the next president and the next president and the next president and the future of this country.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The impeachment must go forward.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator Warren.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You're all going to get in on this, by the way.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Sanders, do Democrats have any chance but to impeach President Trump?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Please respond.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: No, they don't.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: In my judgment, Trump is the most corrupt president in the history of this country.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It's not just that he obstructed justice with the Mueller Report.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I think that the House will find him guilty of  worthy of impeachment because of the emoluments clause.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is a president who is enriching himself while using the Oval Office to do that, and that is outrageous.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I think in terms of the recent Ukrainian incident, the idea that we have a president of the United States who is prepared to hold back national security money to one of our allies in order to get dirt on a presidential candidate is beyond comprehension.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So I look forward, by the way, not only to a speedy and expeditious impeachment process, but Mitch McConnell has got to do the right thing and allow a free and fair trial in the Senate.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Vice President Biden, during the Clinton impeachment proceedings, you said, and I quote, The American people don't think that they've made a mistake by electing Bill Clinton, and we in Congress had better be very careful before we upset their decision.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: With the country now split, have Democrats been careful enough in pursuing the impeachment of President Trump?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Yes, they have.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I said from the beginning that if, in fact, Trump continued to stonewall what the Congress is entitled to know about his background, what he did, all the accusations in the Mueller Report, if they did that, they would have no choice  no choice  but to begin an impeachment proceeding, which gives them more power to seek more information.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This president  and I agree with Bernie, Senator Sanders  is the most corrupt president in modern history and I think all of our history.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And the fact is that this president of the United States has gone so far as to say, since this latest event, that, in fact, he will not cooperate in any way at all, will not list any witnesses, will not provide any information, will not do anything to cooperate with the impeachment.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They have no choice but to move.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Harris, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi has said that members of Congress have to be, in her words, fair to the president and give him a chance to exonerate himself.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You've already said that based on everything you've seen, you would vote to remove him from office.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Is that being fair to the president?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Well, it's just being observant, because he has committed crimes in plain sight.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I mean, it's shocking, but he told us who he was.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Maya Angelou told us years ago, listen to somebody when they tell you who they are the first time.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'm even willing to pilot something like UBI and to see how that would work.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: During that election, Donald Trump told us he could shoot somebody on Fifth Avenue and get away with it.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And he has consistently since he won been selling out the American people.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: He's been selling out working people.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: He's been selling out our values.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: He's been selling out national security.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And on this issue with Ukraine, he has been selling out our democracy.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Our framers imagined this moment, a moment where we would have a corrupt president.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And our framers then rightly designed our system of democracy to say there will be checks and balances.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is one of those moments.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And so Congress must act.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But the reality of it is that I don't really think this impeachment process is going to take very long, because as a former prosecutor, I know a confession when I see it.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And he did it in plain sight.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: He has given us the evidence.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And he tried to cover it up, putting it in that special server.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And there's been a clear consciousness of guilt.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This will not take very long.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Donald Trump needs to be held accountable.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: He is, indeed, the most corrupt and unpatriotic president we have ever had.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Booker, you have said that President Trump's, quote, moral vandalism disqualifies him from being president.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Can you be fair in an impeachment trial?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Please respond.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So, first of all, we must be fair.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We are talking about ongoing proceedings to remove a sitting president for office.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This has got to be about patriotism and not partisanship.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Look, I share the same sense of urgency of everybody on this stage.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I understand the outrage that we all feel.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But we have to conduct this process in a way that is honorable, that brings our country together, doesn't rip us apart.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Anybody who has criticisms about a process that is making all the facts bare before the American public, that works to build consensus, that's what this nation needs, in what is a moral moment and not a political one.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So I swore an oath to do my job as a senator, do my duty.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This president has violated his.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I will do mine.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator Booker.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Klobuchar, you have  what do you say to those who fear that impeachment is a distraction from issues that impact people's day-to-day lives, health care, the economy, and could backfire on Democrats?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We can do two things at once.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's our job.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have a constitutional duty to pursue this impeachment, but we also can stand up for America, because this president has not been putting America in front of his own personal interests.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: He has not been standing up for the workers of Ohio.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: He's not been standing up for the farmers in Iowa.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I take this even a step further.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You know, when he made that call to the head of Ukraine, he's digging up dirt on an opponent.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's illegal conduct.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's what he was doing.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: He didn't talk to him about the Russian invasion.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: He talked to him about that.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So I'm still waiting to find out from him how making that call to the head of Ukraine and trying to get him involved in interfering in our election makes America great again.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'd like to hear from him about how leaving the Kurds for slaughter, our allies for slaughter, where Russia then steps in to protect them, how that makes America great again.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I would like to hear from him about how coddling up to Vladimir Putin makes America great again.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It doesn't make America great again.

title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And we can get this public option done.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And we can take on the pharmaceutical companies and bring down the prices.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But what really bothers me about this discussion, which we've had so many times, is that we don't talk about the things that I'm hearing about from regular Americans.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That is long-term care.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We are seeing -- I once called it a silver tsunami.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The aging -- and then someone told me that was too negative, so I call it the silver surge -- the aging of the population.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We need to make easier to get long-term care insurance and strengthen Medicaid.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: In this state, the state of Ohio, that has been hit by the opioid epidemic, we need to take on those pharma companies and make them pay for the addictions that they have caused and the people that they have killed.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Those are the issues that I hear about when I'm in Toledo.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Vice President Biden...
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'd like to be...
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Let me -- let me bring you in here, Vice President, for your response.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Are Senators Warren and Sanders being realistic about the difficulty of enacting their plans?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: First of all, the plan we're hearing discussed is the Biden plan, the one I built forward.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Build on Obamacare, add a public option.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We can go into that.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I can talk about that if you'd like.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But here's the deal.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: On the single most important thing facing the American public, I think it's awfully important to be straightforward with them.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The plan is going to cost at least $30 trillion over 10 years.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That is more on a yearly basis than the entire federal budget.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And we talk about how we're going to pay for it.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The study recently came out showing that, in fact, it will reduce costs.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But for people making between $50,000 and $75,000 a year, their taxes are going to go up about $5,000, because the fact is they'll pay more in new taxes, 7.4 percent plus, or 5 percent, plus a 4 percent income tax.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: If you're making -- if a fireman and a schoolteacher are making $100,000 a year, their taxes are going to go up about $10,000.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That is more than they will possibly save on this health care plan.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have a plan put forward that will work.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Sanders, do you want to respond to -- we were coming to you.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I get a little bit tired -- I must say -- of people defending a system which is dysfunctional, which is cruel, 87 million uninsured, 30,000 people dying every single year, 500,000 people going bankrupt for one reason, they came down with cancer.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I will tell you what the issue is here.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The issue is whether the Democratic Party has the guts to stand up to the health care industry, which made $100 billion in profit, whether we have the guts to stand up to the corrupt, price-fixing pharmaceutical industry, which is charging us the highest prices in the world for prescription drugs.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And if we don't have the guts to do that, if all we can do is take their money, we should be ashamed of ourselves.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator Sanders.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We can stand up to them.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Harris, your response?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is the sixth debate we have had in this presidential cycle and not nearly one word, with all of these discussions about health care, on women's access to reproductive health care, which is under full-on attack in America today.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And it's outrageous.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: There are states that have passed laws that will virtually prevent women from having access to reproductive health care.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And it is not an exaggeration to say women will die, poor women, women of color will die, because these Republican legislatures in these various states who are out of touch with America are telling women what to do with our bodies.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Women are the majority of the population in this country.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: People need to keep their hands off of women's bodies and let women make the decisions about their own lives.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And let's talk about that.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That is a significant health care issue in America today.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I want to turn now to jobs.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: According to a recent study, about a quarter of American jobs could be lost to automation in just the next 10 years.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Ohio is one of the states likely to be hardest hit.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Sanders, you say your federal jobs guarantee is part of the answer to the threat from automation, but tens of millions of Americans could end up losing their jobs.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Are you promising that you will have a job for every single one of those Americans?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Damn right we will.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I'll tell you why.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: If you look at what goes on in America today, we have an infrastructure which is collapsing.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We could put 15 million people to work rebuilding our roads, our bridges, our water systems, our wastewater plants, airports, et cetera.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Furthermore -- and I hope we will discuss it at length tonight -- this planet faces the greatest threat in its history from climate change.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And the Green New Deal that I have advocated will create up to 20 million jobs as we move away from fossil fuel to energy efficiency and sustainable energy.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We need workers to do childcare.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We need workers, great teachers to come in to school systems which don't have the teachers that we need right now.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We need more doctors.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We need more dentists.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We need more carpenters.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We need more sheet metal workers.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And when we talk about making public colleges and universities tuition fee and cancelling student debt, we're going to give those people the opportunity to get those good jobs.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Sanders, thank you.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Mr. Yang, your main solution to job loss from automation is a universal basic income.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Why is giving people $1,000 a month better than Sanders' plan to guaranteeing them a job?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I am for the spirit of a federal jobs guarantee, but you have to look at how it would actually materialize in practice.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: What are the jobs?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Who manages you?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: What if you don't like your job?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: What if you're not good at your job?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The fact is, most Americans do not want to work for the federal government.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And saying that that is the vision of the economy of the 21st century to me is not a vision that most Americans would embrace.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Also, Senator Sanders, the description of a federal jobs guarantee does not take into account the work of people like my wife, who's at home with our two boys, one of whom is autistic.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have a freedom dividend of $1,000 a month.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It actually recognizes the work that is happening in our families and our communities.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It helps all Americans transition.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Because the fact is -- and you know this in Ohio -- if you rely upon the federal government to target its resources, you wind up with failed retraining programs and jobs that no one wants.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: When we put the money into our hands, we can build a trickle-up economy from our people, our families, and our communities up.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It will enable us to do the kind of work that we want to do.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is the sort of positive vision in response to the fourth industrial revolution that we have to embrace as a party.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Booker, a federal jobs guarantee or $1,000 a month, are those the best solutions there?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Please respond.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Well, first of all, I'm happy to get in finally.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I just want to say, as a great -- as a great New Jersian, Yogi Berra, said, \"I am having deja vu all over again.\"
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'm having deja vu all over again, first of all, because I saw this play in 2016's election.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We are literally using Donald Trump's lies.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And the second issue we cover on this stage is elevating a lie and attacking a statesman.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That was so offensive.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: He should not have to defend ourselves.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And the only person sitting at home that was enjoying that was Donald Trump seeing that we're distracting from his malfeasance and selling out of his office.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I'm having deja vu all over again.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I'm having deja vu all over again because we have another health care debate, and we're not talking about the clear and existential threat in America that we're in a state that has had two Planned Parenthoods close.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We are seeing all over this country women's reproductive rights under attack.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And God bless Kamala, but you know what?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Women should not be the only ones taking up this cause and this fight.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And men...
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It is not just because women are our daughters and our friends and our wives.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It's because women are people.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And people deserve to control their own bodies.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator, thank you.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We are going to get to that issue later on tonight.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Warren, you wrote that blaming job loss on automation is, quote, \"a good story, except it's not really true.\"
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So should workers here in Ohio not be worried about losing their jobs to automation?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So the data show that we have had a lot of problems with losing jobs, but the principal reason has been bad trade policy.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The principal reason has been a bunch of corporations, giant multinational corporations who've been calling the shots on trade, giant multinational corporations that have no loyalty to America.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They have no loyalty to American workers.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They have no loyalty to American consumers.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They have no loyalty to American communities.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They are loyal only to their own bottom line.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I have a plan to fix that, and it's accountable capitalism.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It says, you want to have one of the giant corporations in America?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Then, by golly, 40 percent of your board of directors should be elected by your employees.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That will make a difference when a corporation decides, gee, we could save a nickel by moving a job to Mexico, when there are people on the board in the boardroom saying, no, do you know what that does to our company, do you know what that does to our community, to what it does to our workers?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We also need to make it easier to join a union and give unions more power when they negotiate.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We need to restructure strength in this economy, and that's where it starts.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Secretary Castro, what's your response to Senator Warren's claim that automation is a good story, except it's not really true?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Well, I think -- I think what folks have said is that that is only part of the issue, right?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You know, I believe that we need to address communities that are being impacted by automation.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But I think we need to focus on making sure that we spark job opportunity for people across this country.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: As I mentioned earlier, here in Ohio, in the latest job data, Ohio is losing jobs under Donald Trump.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: He has broken his promises to Ohio and the industrial Midwest.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I would invest in infrastructure to put people back to work.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I would invest in a Green New Deal to unleash millions of new jobs in a clean energy economy.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I was in Newton, Iowa, a few weeks ago and I visited a place called TPI.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Newton, Iowa, had a Maytag washing machine manufacturing facility, and then it closed down.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: TPI manufactures wind turbines.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They're putting hundreds of people to work at decent-paying jobs and creating a better future for those families.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: On top of that, let me just say this.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We need to support working families.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We need to invest in things like...
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Mr. Secretary.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: ... universal childcare, so that people can afford childcare instead of having to pay 20 percent of their income for it.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Warren, I just need -- I just need to address this.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Go ahead, Mr. Yang.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Warren, I've been talking to Americans around the country about automation.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And they're smart.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They see what's happening around them.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Their Main Street stores are closing.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They see a self-serve kiosk in every McDonalds, every grocery store, every CVS.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Driving a truck is the most common job in 29 states, including this one; 3.5 million truck drivers in this country.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And my friends in California are piloting self-driving trucks.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: What is that going to mean for the 3.5 million truckers or the 7 million Americans who work in truck stops, motels, and diners that rely upon the truckers getting out and having a meal?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Saying this is a rules problem is ignoring the reality that Americans see around us every single day.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Warren, respond, please.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So I understand that what we're all looking for is how we strengthen America's middle class.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And actually, I think the thing closest to the universal basic income is Social Security.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It's one of the reasons that I've put forward a plan to extend the solvency of Social Security by decades and add $200 to the payment of every person who receives Social Security right now and every person who receives disability insurance right now.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That $200 a month will lift nearly 5 million families out of poverty.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And it will sure loosen up the budget for a whole lot more.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It also has a provision for your wife, for those who stay home to do caregiving for children or for seniors, and creates an opportunity for them to get credit on their Social Security.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So after a lifetime of hard work, people are entitled to retire with dignity.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator Warren.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I see this as an important question about just -- I want to understand the data on this.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator, thank you very much.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I want to make sure we're responding to make this work.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Your time is up.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I want to give Congresswoman Gabbard a chance to respond.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You know, really what this is about is getting to the heart of the fear that is well founded.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: As people look to this automation revolution, they look to uncertainty.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They don't know how this is going to affect their jobs and their everyday lives.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I agree with my friend, Andrew Yang.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I think universal basic income is a good idea to help provide that security so that people can have the freedom to make the kinds of choices that they want to see.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This has to do with bad trade deals that we've seen in the past that have also driven fear towards people losing the way that they provide for their families.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Really what we need to do is look at how we can best serve the interests of the American people.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I do not believe a federal jobs guarantee is the way to do that.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The value that someone feels in themselves and their own lives is not defined by the job that they have but is intrinsic to who we all are as Americans, whatever we choose to do with our lives, and we can't forget that.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you very much.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: One of the industries most at risk from a changing economy is the auto industry.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: General Motors used to be the largest employer in Ohio.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Now it's 72nd.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Today, thousands of GM workers here in Ohio and across the country are on strike.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: All of you on the stage have voiced support for these workers.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Booker, one of the latest impasses in negotiations involves bringing jobs back from Mexico.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: As president, how would you convince GM to return production to the United States?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Well, first of all, the one point I wanted to make about the UBI conversation -- and I hope that my friend, Andrew Yang, will come out for this -- doing more for workers than UBI would actually be just raising the minimum wage to $15 an hour.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We just have different approaches.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have to start putting the dignity back in work.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And, number one, you start having trade deals, not like this thing that the president is trying to push through Congress right now that gives pharmaceutical companies and other corporations benefits and doesn't put workers at the center of every trade deal.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We must make sure we are not giving corporate tax incentives for people to move jobs out of our country, but start to put the worker at the center of that and make sure that they have the resources to succeed.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But it's more than that.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I stood with these workers because we're seeing this trend all over our country.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I stood with unions because, right now, unions in America are under attack.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: As union membership has gone down, we have seen a stratification of wealth and income in this country.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So the other thing that I'll do as president of the United States is begin to fight again to see union strength in this country spread, to make sure we have sectoral bargaining so that unions from the auto workers all the way to fast food workers can ensure that we improve workers' conditions and make sure that every American has a living wage in this country.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Congressman O'Rourke, same question for you.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: How would you convince GM to bring production back to the United States from Mexico?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I've met with these members of the UAW who are striking outside of facilities in Cincinnati, in Lordstown, Ohio, which has just been devastated, decimated by GM and their malfeasance, paying effectively zero in taxes last year.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The people of Ohio investing tens of millions of dollars in the infrastructure around there.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: What they want is a shot.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And they want fairness in how we treat workers in this country, which they are not receiving today.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Part of the way to do that is through our trade deals, making sure that if we trade with Mexico, Mexican workers are allowed to join unions, which they are effectively unable to do today.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Not only is that bad for the Mexican worker, it puts the American worker at a competitive disadvantage.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: If we complement that with investment in world-class pre-K through 12 public education, get behind our world-class public school educators, if we make sure that cost is not an object to be able to attend college, and if we elevate the role of unions in this country, and create more than 5 million apprenticeships over the next eight years, we will make sure that every single American has a shot.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They don't want a handout.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They don't want a job guarantee.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They just want a shot.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And as president, I will give them that shot.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Congressman.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Income inequality is growing in the United States at an alarming rate.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The top 1 percent now own more of this nation's wealth than the bottom 90 percent combined.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Sanders, when you introduced your wealth tax, which would tax the assets of the wealthiest Americans, you said, quoting you, Senator, Billionaires should not exist.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Is the goal of your plan to tax billionaires out of existence?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: When you have a half-a-million Americans sleeping out on the street today, when you have 87 people -- 87 million people uninsured or underinsured, when you've got hundreds of thousands of kids who cannot afford to go to college, and millions struggling with the oppressive burden of student debt, and then you also have three people owning more wealth than the bottom half of American society, that is a moral and economic outrage.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And the truth is, we cannot afford to continue this level of income and wealth inequality.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And we cannot afford a billionaire class, whose greed and corruption has been at war with the working families of this country for 45 years.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So if you're asking me do I think we should demand that the wealthy start paying -- the wealthiest, top 0.1 percent, start paying their fair share of taxes so we can create a nation and a government that works for all of us?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Yes, that's exactly what I believe.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Mr. Steyer, you are the lone billionaire on this stage.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: What's your plan for closing the income gap?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Well, first of all, let me say this.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Sanders is right.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: There have been 40 years where corporations have bought this government, and those 40 years have meant a 40-year attack on the rights of working people and specifically on organized labor.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And the results are as shameful as Senator Sanders says, both in terms of assets and in terms of income.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It's absolutely wrong.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It's absolutely undemocratic and unfair.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I was one of the first people on this stage to propose a wealth tax.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I would undo every Republican tax cut for rich people and major corporations.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But there's something else going on here that is absolutely shameful, and that's the way the money gets split up in terms of earnings.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: As a result of taking away the rights of working people and organized labor, people haven't had a raise -- 90 percent of Americans have not had a raise for 40 years.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: If you took the minimum wage from 1980 and just adjusted it for inflation, you get $11 bucks.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: If you included the productivity gains of American workers, it would be over $20 bucks.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: There's something wrong here, and that is that the corporations have bought our government.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Our government has failed.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's why I'm running for president, because we're not going to get any of the policies that everybody on this stage wants -- health care, education, Green New Deal, or a living wage...
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Mr. Steyer.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: ... unless we break the power of these corporations.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Mr. Steyer.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Vice President Biden, you have warned against demonizing rich people.

text: Do you believe that Senator Sanders and Senator Warren's wealth tax plans do that?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: No, look, demonizing wealth -- what I talked about is how you get things done.

text: And the way to get things done is take a look at the tax code right now.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The idea -- we have to start rewarding work, not just wealth.

text: I would eliminate the capital gains tax -- I would raise the capital gains tax to the highest rate, of 39.5 percent.

text: I would double it, because guess what?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Why in God's name should someone who's clipping coupons in the stock market make -- in fact, pay a lower tax rate than someone who, in fact, is -- like I said -- the -- a schoolteacher and a firefighter?

text: It's ridiculous.

text: And they pay a lower tax.

text: Secondly, the idea that we, in fact, engage in this notion that there are -- there's $1,640,000,000,000 in tax loopholes.

text: We could eliminate it all.

text: I could go into detail had I the time.

text: Secondly -- I mean, thirdly, what we need to do is we need to go out and make it clear to the American people that we are going to -- we are going to raise taxes on the wealthy.

text: We're going to reduce tax burdens on those who are not.

text: And this is one of the reasons why these debates are kind of crazy, because everybody tries to squeeze everything into every answer that is given.

text: The fact is, everybody's right about the fact that the fourth industrial revolution is costing jobs.

text: It is.

text: The fact is also corporate greed is they're going back and not investing in our employees, they're reinvesting and buying back their stock.

text: Not only that, but the New York Times and CNN have also smeared veterans like myself for calling for an end to this regime change war.
