text: I believe that they will do the right thing.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Mayor Buttigieg, just yesterday, you referred to mandatory buybacks as confiscation and said that Congressman O'Rourke has been picking a fight to try to stay relevant.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Your response on guns?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Look, Congressman, you just made it clear that you don't know how this is actually going to take weapons off the streets.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: If you can develop the plan further, I think we can have a debate about it.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But we can't wait.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: People are dying in the streets right now.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We can't wait for universal background checks that we finally have a shot to actually get through.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We can't wait to ban the sale of new weapons and high-capacity magazines so we don't wind up with millions more of these things on the street.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We can't wait for red flag laws that are going to disarm domestic abusers and prevent suicides, which are not being talked about nearly enough as a huge part of the gun violence epidemic in this country.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We cannot wait for purity tests.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have to just get something done.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Congressman O'Rourke, your response.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is not a purity test.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is a country that loses 40,000 of our fellow Americans every year to gun violence.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is a crisis.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We've got to do something about it.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And those challenges that you described are not mutually exclusive to the challenges that I'm describing.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I want to make sure we have universal background checks and red flag laws and that we end the sale of these weapons of war, but to use the analogy of health care, it would be as though we said, look, we're for primary care, but let's not talk about mental health care because that's a bridge too far.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: People need that primary care now, so let's save that for another day.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: No, let's decide what we are going to believe in, what we're going to achieve.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And then let's bring this country together in order to do that.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Listening to my fellow Americans, to those moms who demand action, to those students who march for our lives, who, in fact, came up with this extraordinary bold peace plan...
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Congressman.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: ... that calls for mandatory buybacks, let's follow their inspiration and lead and not be limited by the polls and the consultants and the focus groups.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Let's do what's right...
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Mayor Buttigieg, your response?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Mayor Buttigieg?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The problem isn't the polls.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The problems is the policy.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I don't need lessons from you on courage, political or personal.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Everyone on this stage is determined to get something done.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Everyone on this stage recognizes, or at least I thought we did, that the problem is not other Democrats who don't agree with your particular idea of how to handle this.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The problem is the National Rifle Association and their enablers in Congress, and we should be united in taking the fight to them.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's a mischaracterization.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Anderson, I've got to answer this.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Never took you or anyone else on who disagrees with me on this issue.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is not going to be a one and done, that we do one thing or two things or three things and then we're done.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have to reduce gun violence overall.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But when you, Mayor Buttigieg, described this policy as a shiny object, I don't care what that meant to me or my candidacy, but to those who have survived gun violence, those who've lost a loved one to an AR-15, an AK-47, marched for our lives, formed in the courage of students willing to stand up to the NRA and conventional politics and poll-tested politicians, that was a slap in the fact to every single one of those groups and every single survivor of a mass casualty assault with an AR-15 and an AK-47.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We must buy them back.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Congressman...
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: What we owe to those survivors is to actually deliver a solution.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'm glad you offered up that analogy to health care, because this is really important.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We are at the cusp of building a new American majority to actually do things that congressmen and senators have been talking about with almost no impact for my entire adult life.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Mayor.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: No, this is really important, OK?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: On guns, we are this close to an assault weapons ban.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That would be huge.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And we're going to get wrapped around the axle in a debate over whether it's \"hell, yes, we're going to take your guns\"?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have an opportunity...
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Mayor.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Your time is up.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: ... to deliver health care to everybody, and some on this stage are saying it doesn't count unless we obliterate...
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I want to give somebody -- I want to give other -- I want to give other candidates a chance.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Booker, what's your response to Mayor Buttigieg?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Well, look, I again, worry about how we talk to each other and about each other and what this last week has shown.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: There was a young man in my neighborhood, I watched him grow up.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I lived in some high-rise projects with him named Shahad, and he was murdered on my block last year with an assault rifle.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'm living with a sense of urgency on this problem, because when I go home to my community, like millions of Americans, we live in communities where these weapons, where these gun shots are real every single day.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I know where the American public is.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is not about leadership.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is why when I talk about things like gun licensing and point out the differences between us, I'm not attacking people or their character or their courage on these issues.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We all have courage.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But it's frustrating that when the American people, 77 percent of Americans agree on licensing, we don't need leadership right now.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We just need folks that are going to stand up and follow where the people already are, because there are millions of Americans where this is a daily nightmare, where we're surrendering our freedoms...
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: ... to fear in this country.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is the first time in American history, this fall, where we have sent our children to school, the strongest nation on the Planet Earth, and said to them, \"We can't protect you\"...
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: ... \"so in school, we're going to teach you how to hide.\"
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: There are more duck-and-cover drills and shelter-in-place drills in America now than fire drills.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: If I'm president of the United States, I will bring an urgency to this issue and make sure that we end the scourge of mass violence in our country.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Klobuchar -- Senator Klobuchar, Senator Warren -- Senator Warren supports a voluntary -- excuse me, Senator Klobuchar, you support a voluntary buyback, if I'm correct, right.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: What is wrong with a mandatory buyback?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Your response.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I just keep thinking of how close we are to finally getting something done on this.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'm looking at the mayor of Dayton.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I met one of the survivors from that shooting, 30 seconds, nine people killed.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The public is with us on this in a big way.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The majority of Trump voters want to see universal background checks right now.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The majority of hunters want to see us move forward with gun safety legislation.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: There are three bills right now on Mitch McConnell's desk, the background check bill, my bill to close the boyfriend loophole so domestic abusers don't get guns, the bill to make it easier for police to vet people before they get a gun.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's what we should be focusing on.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I just don't want to screw this up.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: When I'm president, I do want to bring in an assault weapon ban and I do want to put a limitation on magazines so what happened in Dayton, Ohio, will never happen again.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But let's not mess this up with this fight.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Warren, you support a voluntary gun buyback of assault-style weapons, as well.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Why not a mandatory one?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So, look, I want to get what works done.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I want to use the method we used, for example, with machine guns.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We registered them, we put in a huge penalty if you didn't register them, and a huge tax on them, and then let people turn them in, and it got machine guns out of the hands of people.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But the problem here that we need to focus on is, first, how widespread gun violence is.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: As you've rightly identified, it's not just about mass shootings.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And the question we have to ask is, why hasn't it happened?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You say we're so close.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have been so close.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I stood in the United States Senate in 2013...
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: ... when 54 senators voted in favor of gun legislation and it didn't pass because of the filibuster.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator...
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have got to attack the corruption and repeal the filibuster or the gun industry will always have a veto over what happens.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Harris?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Harris, you disagree with Senator Warren.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You think the buyback should be mandatory.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Please respond.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Five million assault weapons are on the streets of America today.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: During the course of this debate, eight people will die from gun violence.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The leading cause of death of young black men in America is gun violence, more than the top other six reasons total.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is a serious matter.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I have personally hugged more mothers of homicide victims than I care to tell you.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I have looked at more autopsy photographs than I care to tell you.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I have attended more police officer funerals than I care to tell you.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'm done.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And we need action.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And Congress has had years to act and failed because they do not have the courage.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: When I'm elected, I'll give them 100 days to pull their act together, put a bill on my desk for signature, and if they don't, I will take executive action and put in place a comprehensive background check requirement and ban the importation of assault weapons into our country because it is time to act.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Biden -- Vice President Biden, your response.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'm the only one on this stage who has taken on the NRA and beat them, and beat them twice.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We were able to get assault weapons off the streets and not be able to be sold for 10 years.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Recent studies show that mass violence went down when that occurred.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The way to deal with those guns and those AR-15s and assault weapons that are on the street -- or not on the street, that people own, is to do what we did with the National Firearms Act as it related to machine guns.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You must register that weapon.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You must register it.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: When you register it, the likelihood of it being used diminishes exponentially.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'm the only one that got -- got -- moved the -- to make sure that we could not have a magazine that had more than 10 rounds in it.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I've done this.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I know how to get it done.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: If you really want to get it done, go after the gun manufacturers and take back the exemption they have of not being able to be sued.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That would change it.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Mr. Vice President.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Secretary Castro, the vast majority of homicides committed with a gun in this country are from handguns, not assault-style weapons.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: What's your plan to prevent those deaths?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you very much for the question.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You know, I grew up in neighborhoods where it wasn't uncommon to hear gunshots at night.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I can remember ducking into the back seat of a car when I was a freshman in high school, across the street from my school, my public school, because folks were shooting at each other.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You know, in the neighborhoods -- let me answer this question about voluntary versus mandatory.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: There are two problems I have with mandatory buybacks.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Number one, folks can't define it.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And if you're not going door to door, then it's not really mandatory.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But also, in the places that I grew up in, we weren't exactly looking for another reason for cops to come banging on the door.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And you all saw a couple days ago what happened to Atatiana Jefferson in Fort Worth.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: A cop showed up at 2:00 in the morning at her house when she was playing video games with her nephew.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: He didn't even announced himself.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And within four seconds, he shot her and killed her through her home window.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: She was in her own home.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And so I am not going to give these police officers another reason to go door to door in certain communities, because police violence is also gun violence, and we need to address that.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Secretary Castro, thank you.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Turning to another key issue here in Ohio and around the country, the opioid epidemic, Senator Klobuchar, CNN reached out to Ohio Democratic voters for their most pressing questions.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Brie, a teacher in Proctorville, asks, in rural Ohio, the opioid epidemic has affected our communities and schools.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I have many high school students who have lost one or both parents to heroin.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Teachers are on the front lines daily, witnessing these tragedies.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: How will you tackle this problem in general, but specifically what will you offer people in rural communities where rehabilitation is not easily accessed and access to jobs is difficult?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Well, I want to thank her for this question.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is something that should never have happened to begin with.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I remember, when I was a prosecutor, these were not the kind of cases that were coming in our door.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And it's gotten worse and worse.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And we now know why.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: As the evidence is coming out of those lawsuits, probably one of the most horrible things that I saw was the e-mail from one of the pharma executives that actually said, \"Keep pumping them out.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They're eating them like Doritos.\"
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So my first answer to that question, and which is included in my plan, is that the people that should pay for this, that should pay for the treatment, are the very people that got people hooked and killed them in the first place.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And that is the people that are manufacturing these opioids.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's the first way.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And you can, with a 2 cents per milligram tax, bring in the money, plus with the federal master settlement, to help rural areas where they're so isolated, and also in urban areas, where it's, by the way, not just opiates.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: There are still mental health issues and crack cocaine issues.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is personal for me.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: My dad, he struggled with alcoholism his whole life.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And by his third DWI, they said to him, the prosecutor, you've got to face jail or you got to go to treatment.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: He picked treatment, and he was pursued by grace.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And he has been sober ever since.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And now he's 91 and in assisted living, and he said to me last year, it's hard to get a drink around here, anyway.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But he still has an AA group that visits him there.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And so for me, I believe that everyone in this country, including the people in rural America, have that same right to be pursued by grace.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Mr. Steyer, how would you address the opioid epidemic that exists here in Ohio and around the country?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Please respond.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Well, I think this is one of the most heartbreaking experiences that America has had, 72,000 people died of opioid overdoses last year, and that's not only a tragedy for them, it's a tragedy for their family and their communities.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And so I think we have to treat this as a health citizens.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have to move the resources and the support there to try and help people.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But I think that Senator Klobuchar makes a good point.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The reason I'm running for president is that we have a broken government.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And we have a broken government because corporations have bought it.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And every single one of these conversations is about that broken government.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It's about drug companies buying the government and getting what they want.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It's about the gun manufacturers buying the government and get what we want.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We need to break the corporate stranglehold on our government.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I've put forward actual structural changes, including term limits, a natural referendum, the end to the idea that corporations are people and have the rights of American citizens politically, and make it a lot easier to vote
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: These corporations have taken over our government.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And 72,000 deaths...
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Mr. Steyer.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: ... last year are the tragic result.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Mr. Steyer.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Mr. Yang, you want to decriminalize the possession and use of small amounts of opioids, including heroin.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: How would that solve the crisis?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's exactly right.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And we have to recognize this is a disease of capitalism run amok.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: There was a point when there were more opiate prescriptions in the state of Ohio than human beings in the state of Ohio.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And for some reason, the federal government thought that was appropriate.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They ended up levying a $600 million fine against Purdue Pharma, which sounds like a lot of money, until you realize that company made $30 billion.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They got a 2 percent fine, and they killed tens of thousands of Americans, eight an hour.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So if the government turned a blind eye to this company spreading a plague among its people, then the least we can do is put the resources to work in our community so our people have a fighting chance to get well, even though this is not a money problem.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We all know this is a human problem.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And part of helping people get the treatment that they need is to let them know that they're not going to be referred to a prison cell.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They will be referred to treatment and counseling.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I talked to an EMT in New Hampshire, and he said he saves the same addicts over and over again, because the fact is, after you save someone who's OD'ing, you just bring them back to their house and they OD again the following week.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So we need to decriminalize opiates for personal use.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have to let the country know this is not a personal failing.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This was a systemic government failing.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And then we need to open up safe consumption and safe injection sites around the country, because they save lives.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Mr. Yang.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Congressman O'Rourke, is decriminalizing opioids part of the solution?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Please respond.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Yes, it is, for many of the reasons that Mr. Yang just described.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: His tax plan's a failure.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And also just from some personal experiences I've had as a member of Congress where constituents of mine have come forward, in some cases publicly, at a town hall meeting to describe their addictions.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I remember a veteran telling me that he bought heroin off the street because he was originally prescribed an opioid at the V.A.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Now, imagine if that veteran, instead of being prescribe an opioid, had been prescribed marijuana because we made that legal in America, ensured the V.A....
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Yes, preach, Beto.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: ... could prescribe it, expunge the arrest records for those who've been arrested for possession, and make sure that he was not prescribed something to which he would become addicted.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I also want to agree with Senator Klobuchar.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Until we hold those responsible accountable for their actions, Purdue Pharma, Johnson & Johnson, we're going to continue to have this problem going on again.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So that veteran that I met, and anyone with drug addiction today, is not a problem for the criminal justice system.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They're an opportunity for our public health system in America.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Congressman.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Harris, you want to hold the drug manufacturers that fueled the crisis accountable.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Are you in favor of sending those drug company executives to jail?
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I am.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I will tell you, as a former prosecutor, I do think of this as being a matter of justice and accountability, because they are nothing more than some high-level dope dealers.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They have been engaged...
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I've seen it happen before.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I've taken on the pharmaceutical companies when I was attorney general of California and led the second largest Department of Justice.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I've seen what they do.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The biggest pharmaceutical companies, the eight biggest pharmaceutical companies and insurance companies last year profited $72 billion on the backs of people like the families that we are talking about that have been overwhelmed by this crisis, which is a public health epidemic.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And they knew what they were doing.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They were marketing false advertising.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They knew what they were pushing in communities and states like Ohio, without any concern about the repercussions because they were profiting and making big bucks.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And, yes, they should be held accountable.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is a matter of justice.
title: 4th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Klobuchar, you've said this of Mayor Buttigieg, quote, \"Of the women on the stage, do I think that we would be standing on that stage if we had the experience he had?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: No, I don't.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Maybe we're held to a different standard.\"
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator, what did you mean by that?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: First of all, I've made very clear I think that Pete is qualified to be up on this stage, and I am honored to be standing next to him.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But what I said was true.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Women are held to a higher standard.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Otherwise, we could play a game called name your favorite woman president, which we can't do, because it has all been men.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And including all vice presidents being men.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I think any working woman out there, any woman that's at home knows exactly what I mean.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have to work harder, and that's a fact.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But I want to dispel one thing, because for so long why has this been happening?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I don't think you have to be the tallest person on this stage to be president.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I don't think you have to be the skinniest person.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I don't think you have the loudest voice on this stage.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I don't think that means that you will be the one that should be president.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I think what matters is if you're smart, if you're competent, and if you get things done.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I am the one that has passed over a hundred bills as the lead Democrat in that gridlock of Washington in Congress on this stage.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I think you've got to win.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I am the one, Mr. Vice President, that has been able to win every red and purple congressional district as a lead on a ticket every time.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I govern both with my head and my heart.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And if you think a woman can't beat Donald Trump, Nancy Pelosi does it every single day.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Mr. Vice President, Mr. Vice President, just a quick response?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I think a woman is qualified to be president, and there's no reason why -- if you think the woman is the most qualified person now, you should vote for them.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The reason why I think I should be president and be the nominee is, number one, I have brought people together my entire career.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: In the United States Senate, I've passed more major legislation than everybody on this stage combined, from the Violence Against Women Act to making sure we have the chemical weapons treaty to dealing with Milosevic, the whole range of things that I've been engaged in my whole career.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I've done it.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I've brought people together.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'm always told by everybody around here things have changed, you can't do that anymore.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: If we can't -- I thought the question was initially asked of the senator, how do you unify this country?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have to unify this country.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I have done it.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I have done it repeatedly.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And lastly, to be commander-in-chief, there's no time for on-the-job training.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I've spent more time in the Situation Room, more time abroad, more time than anybody up here.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I know every major world leader.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They know me, and they know when I speak, if I'm the president of the United States, who we're for, who we're against, and what we'll do, and we'll keep our word.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Mr. Vice President.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Ashley?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Booker, one of the defining characters of the Trump presidency is that the American people hear from him directly all the time about everything, on Twitter and just about everywhere else.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Setting aside your views of his tone, is that unfiltered communication something you as president would continue?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Is this one of the norms broken by President Trump that needed to change?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So, look, this president has broken norms, as you've said.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: He used his platforms to demean, degrade, and divide this country in ways that are repugnant and appalling.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But the next president, whoever they are, is going to have to be someone who can heal and bring this nation together, this whole nation.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So, absolutely, in that office I will do whatever it takes to make sure we bring this country together.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But it's not for a Kumbaya moment.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We are a nation that achieves great things when we stand together and work together and fight together.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So, absolutely.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: When I was mayor of the largest city in my state -- and this is where I agree with Mayor Pete -- mayoral experience is very important.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I happen to be the other Rhodes Scholar mayor on this stage.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And what I learned there is that you have to be an executive that can heal.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator Warren.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: In my city, we have racial divides, we have geographic divides that go from wealth to people that are struggling.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The success of my city was because we brought us all together and did things that other people said couldn't be done.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: When I am president of the United States, my campaign from the very beginning has not changed.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: My charge is to see a nation right now which has so much common pain, to channel that back into a sense of common purpose.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I will do whatever it takes, bringing creativity to that office like has never been seen before.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Rachel?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Chants of \"Lock Her Up\" are still heard at President Trump's rallies today.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Now some opponents of the president are turning the same slogan against him.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They've chanted \"Lock Him Up\" at a recent World Series game in Washington and at a Veterans Day event in New York and, Senator Sanders, at at least two of your campaign events recently.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator, should Democrats discourage this?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Or are you OK with it?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Well, I think the people of this country are catching on to the degree that this president thinks he is above the law.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And what the American people are saying: Nobody is above the law.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I think what the American people are also saying is, in fact, that if this president did break the law, he should be prosecuted like any other individual who breaks the law.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But at the end of the day, what we need to do is to bring our people together not just in opposition to Trump.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The initial question I think that you wrote -- that somebody raised here was that we are a divided nation.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You know what?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I kind of reject that.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I think when you talk about the pain of working families in this country, majority of the American people want to raise the minimum wage to a living wage.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: When you talk about the climate crisis, the overwhelming majority of the American people know that it is real, they know we have to take on the fossil fuel industry, they know we have to transform our energy system away from fossil fuel to energy sufficiency and sustainable energy.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Even on issues like guns, the American people are coming together to end the horrific level of gun violence.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So I believe, yeah, we've got to deal with Trump, but we also have to have an agenda that brings our people together so that the wealth and income doesn't just go to the people on top but to all of us.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Vice President Biden, let me ask you to pick up on the issue that Senator Sanders just raised about no one being above the law.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: When President Ford pardoned President Nixon, he said it was to heal the country.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Would you support a potential criminal investigation into President Trump after he leaves office, even if you thought it might further inflame the country's divisions?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Look, I would not direct my Justice Department like this president does.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'd let them make their independent judgment.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I would not dictate who should be prosecuted or who should be exonerated.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's not the role of the president of the United States.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It's the attorney general of the United States, not the president's attorney, private attorney.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And so I would -- whatever was determined by the attorney general I supported, that I appointed, let them make an independent judgment.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: If that was the judgment that he violated the law and he should be, in fact, criminally prosecuted, then so be it.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But I would not direct it.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I don't think it's a good idea that we mock -- that we model ourselves after Trump and say lock him up.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Look, we have to bring this country together.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Let's start talking civilly to people and treating -- you know, the next president starts tweeting should -- anyway.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Look, it's just -- look, it's about civility.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have to restore the soul of this country.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And that's not who we are, that's not who we've been, that's not who we should be.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Follow the law, let the Justice Department make the judgment as to whether or not someone should be prosecuted, period.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Sanders, let me ask you briefly to respond to that, the difference of opinion there with Vice President Biden.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Well, I think Joe is right.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I think that it is the function of the attorney general.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But what I am of the opinion is that the American people now do believe, and the more they see these impeachment hearings on television, they do believe that we have a president who thinks he's above the law.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have a president who has engaged in corruption.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have a president who has obstructed justice and, in my view, somebody who's violated the emoluments clause.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I think Joe is right, that is the function of an independent Department of Justice.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But my inclination is that the American people do believe that this president is in violation of the law.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Can I respond very quickly?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Briefly, Senator.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Distinction, should he be impeached and should he be thrown out of office?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's one question.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: He's very close to -- he's indicted himself.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Number two, after he's thrown out of office or after he's defeated, should he be then prosecuted?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We're...
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Should he be prosecuted for a criminal offense while he was president?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's a judgment to be made by an attorney general.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Mr. Vice President, thank you.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Ashley?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We now focus on an issue facing many Americans, childcare and paid family leave.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Here in Georgia, the average price of infant daycare can be as much as $8,500 per child per year.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's more than instate tuition at a four-year public college in Georgia.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Mr. Yang, what would you do as president to ease that financial burden?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: There are only two countries in the world that don't have paid family leave for new moms, the United States of America and Papua New Guinea.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That is the entire list.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And we need to get off this list as soon as possible.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I would pass paid family leave as one of the first things we do.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I have two kids myself who are four and seven, one of whom is autistic and has special needs, and it's breaking families' backs.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We need to start supporting our kids and families from the beginning, because by the time they're showing up to pre-K and kindergarten, in many cases, they're already years behind.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Studies have shown that two-thirds of our kids' educational outcomes are determined by what's happening to them at home.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is stress levels, number of words read to them as children, type of neighborhood, whether a parent has time to spend with them.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So we need to have a freedom dividend in place from day one, $1,000 a month for every American adult, which would put in many cases $2,000 a month into families' pockets, so that they can either pay for childcare or if they want stay home with the child.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We should not be pushing everyone to leave the home and go to the workforce.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Many parents see that tradeoff and say if they leave the home and work, they're going to be spending all the money on childcare anyway.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: In many cases, it would be better if the parent stays home with the child.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Mr. Yang.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Sticking with this topic, no parent in the United States is federally guaranteed a single day of paid leave when they have a new baby.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: A number of you on stage tonight have plans to address this.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Harris, you're one of the candidates proposing legislation to guarantee up to six months of paid family leave.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And Senator Klobuchar, you're one of the candidates proposing up to three months.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I want to hear from both of you on this, starting with you, Senator Klobuchar.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Why three months?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I've looked at this economically, and I want to make sure that we help people.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Because as just pointed out, we are way behind the curve, our country is, when it comes to providing paid family leave and childcare.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We must do this and we will do this if we have the right person heading up the ticket so we can win big.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But what I have done with all of my plans is I have shown how I'm going to pay for them meticulously.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I think that is really, really important when we have a president in the White House right now one who has told over 10,000 lies.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So when you look at my website, at amyklobuchar.com, you will see my plans and you're also going to see how I'm going to pay for it.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I think that is so important, because this president is literally increasing the debt, treating our farmers and workers like poker chips in a bankrupt casino, and really putting this country in a worst financial situation every single day.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So, yes, my plan is three months.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I think that's good.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'd love to do more.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: As I've said before, I'd love to staple free diplomas under people's chairs.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I just am not going to go for things -- and this is not -- I'm talking about Senator Harris' plan here, but I'm talking about some of the other ideas that have been out here.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I am not going to go for things just because they sound good on a bumper sticker and then throw in a free car.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I think that we have an obligation -- we have an obligation as a party to be, yes, fiscally responsible, yes, think big, but make sure we have people's backs and are honest with them about what we can pay for.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And that is everything from sending rich kids to college for free, which I don't support, to kicking 149 million off their health insurance -- current health insurance in four years.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I just think we have to be smart about how we do this.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And, Senator Harris, why six months?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And also, how would you pay for that?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Sure.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And, everybody, please visit my website, kamalaharris.org, for the details on everything I talk about.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Six months, so part of how I believe we're going to win this election is, it is going to be because we are focused on the future, we are focused on the challenges that are presented today and not trying to bring back yesterday to solve tomorrow.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So on paid family leave, it is no longer the case in America that people are having children in their 20s.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That empowers people in the same way we empower homeowners.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And what that does is it actually slashes poverty, 10 million people out.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I would use the emergency powers of the presidency.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: People are having children in their 30s, often in their 40s, which means that these families and parents are often raising young children and taking care of their parents, which requires a lot of work, from traveling back and forth to a hospital to daycare to all of the activities that are required, much less the health care needs that are required.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And what we are seeing in America today is the burden principally falls on women to do that work.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And many women are having to make a very difficult choice whether they're going to leave a profession for which they have a passion to care for their family, or whether they are going to give up a paycheck that is part of what that family relies on.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So six months paid family leave is meant to and is designed to adjust to the reality of women's lives today.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The reality also is that women are not paid equal for equal work in America.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We passed the Equal Pay Act in 1963, but fast forward to the year of our lord 2019, and women are paid 80 cents on the dollar, black women 61 cents, Native American women 58 cents, Latinas 53 cents.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So my policy is about -- there's a whole collection of the work that I am doing that is focused on women and working women in America and the inequities and, therefore, the injustice that women in America are facing that needs to be resolved and addressed.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Kristen?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Mr. Steyer, millions of working Americans are finding that housing has become unaffordable, especially in metropolitan areas.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It is particularly acute in your home state of California, in places like Los Angeles and San Francisco.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Why are you the best person to fix this problem?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: When you look at inequality in the United States of America, you have to start with housing.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Where you put your head at night determines so many things about your life.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It determines where your kids go to school.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It determines the air you breathe, where you shop, how long it takes you to get to work.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: What we've seen in California is, as a result of policy, we have millions too few housing units.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And that affects everybody in California.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It starts with a homeless crisis that goes all through the state, but it also includes skyrocketing rents which affect every single working person in the state of California.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I understand exactly what needs to be done here, which is we need to change policy and we need to apply resources here to make sure that we build literally millions of new units.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But the other thing that's going to be true about building these units is, we're going to have to build them in a way that's sustainable, that, in fact, how we build units, where people live has a dramatic impact on climate and on sustainability.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So we are going to have to direct dollars, we're going to have to change policy and make sure that the localities and municipalities who have worked very hard to make sure that there are no new housing units built in their towns, that they have to change that and we're going to have force it, and then we're going to have to direct federal dollars to make sure that those units are affordable so that working people can live in places and not be spending 50 percent of their income on rent.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Mr. Steyer.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Mr. Steyer.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Warren, I see your hand raised.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Yes.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Think of it this way.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Our housing problem in America is a problem on the supply side, and that means that the federal government stopped building new housing a long time ago, affordable housing.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Also, private developers, they've gone up to McMansions.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They're not building the little two bedroom, one bath house that I grew up in, garage converted to be a bedroom for my three brothers.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So I've got a plan for 3.2 million new housing units in America.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Those are housing units for working families, for the working poor, for the poor poor, for seniors who want to age in place, for people with disabilities, for people who are coming back from being incarcerated.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It's about tenants' rights.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But there's one more piece.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Housing is how we build wealth in America.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The federal government has subsidized the purchase of housing for decades for white people and has said for black people you're cut out of the deal.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That was known as red-lining.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: When I built a housing plan, it's not only a housing plan about building new units.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It's a housing plan about addressing what is wrong about government-sponsored discrimination, how we need to address it, and we need to say we're going to reverse it.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Booker?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'm so grateful, again, as a mayor who was a mayor during a recession, who was a mayor during a housing crisis, who started my career as a tenants' rights lawyer, these are all good points, but we're not talking about something that is going on all over America, which is gentrification and low-income families being moved further and further out, often compounding racial segregation.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And so all these things we need to put more federal dollars in it, but we've got to start empowering people.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We use our tax code to move wealth up, the mortgage interest deduction.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: My plan is very simple.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: If you're a renter who pays more than a third of your income in rent, then you will get a refundable tax credit between the amount you're paying and the area median rent.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I know that we have to do this.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And by the way, for those people who are facing eviction, it is about time that the only people when they show up in rentals court that have a lawyer is not the landlord, it is also low-income families struggling to stay in their homes.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Rachel?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We're going to take a quick break, but we'll be right back with these candidates from the MSNBC-Washington Post Democratic candidates debate in Atlanta, Georgia.

title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: American farmers are struggling under the effects of President Trump's trade war with China.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The Trump administration's payments to farmers to offset those losses already have a price tag that is more than double what was spent on the Obama administration's auto bailout.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Mayor Buttigieg, would you continue those farm subsidies?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We shouldn't have to pay farmers to take the edge off of a trade war that shouldn't have been started in the first place.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I will support farmers, but not long ago, I was in Boone, Iowa, a guy came up to me, he said I got my Trump bailout check, but I would have rather spent that money on conservation.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: By the way, this isn't even making farmers whole.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: If you're in soybeans, for example, you're getting killed.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And it's not just what this president has done with the trade war.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: In a lot of parts of the country, the worst thing is these so-called small refinery waivers, which are killing those who are involved in ethanol.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Look, I don't think this president cares one bit about farmers.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: He keeps asking them to take one for the team, but more and more I'm talking to people in rural America who see that they're not going to benefit from business as usual under this president.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I believe that so many of the solutions lie with American farmers, but we have to stand up for them, not just with direct subsidies and support, but with making sure we do something about the consolidation, the monopolies that leave farmers with fewer places to purchase supplies from and fewer places to sell their product to.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And American farming should be one of the key pillars of how we combat climate change.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I believe that the quest for the carbon negative farm could be as big a symbol of dealing with climate change as the electric car in this country.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And it's an important part of how we make sure that we get a message out around dealing with climate change that recruits everybody to be part of the solution, including conservative communities where a lot of people have been made to feel that admitting climate science would mean acknowledging they're part of the problem.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Mr. Mayor, I'm sorry to interrupt, but I need you to answer the question.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Would you continue those subsidies or not?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Yes, but we won't need them because we're going to fix the trade war.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, sir.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The U.N. recently reported that what was once called climate change is now a climate crisis, with drastic results already being felt.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Climate is also an issue important to our audience.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We received thousands of questions from our viewers, and many of them were about climate.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Calista from Minneapolis writes this.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Leading the world in resolving the climate crisis will be a multi-decade project, spanning far beyond even a two-term presidency.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: If you are elected president, how would you ensure that there is secure leadership and bipartisan support to continue this project?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Congresswoman Gabbard?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is an issue that impacts all of us as Americans and people all over the world.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is not a Democrat issue or a Republican issue.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is about the environmental threats that each and every one of us face.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: These are the kinds of conversations that we're having in our town hall meetings and house parties in different parts of the country where we have Democrats, Republicans, libertarians, and independents coming together, saying, hey, we are all concerned about making sure that we have clean water to drink for our families, that we have clean air to breathe, that we're able to raise our kids in a community that's safe.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It is the hyper-partisanship in Washington, unfortunately, that has created this gridlock that has stood in the way of the kinds of progress that I would bring about as president, transitioning our country off of fossil fuels and ending the nearly $30 billion in subsidies that we as taxpayers are currently giving to the fossil fuel industry, instead investing in a green renewable energy economy that leads us into the 21st century with good-paying jobs, a sustainable economy, investing in infrastructure, and transitioning our agriculture -- that is a great contributor to the environmental threats we face -- towards an agriculture system that focuses on local and regional production of food, healthy food that will actually feed the health and well-being of our people, leading as a -- as a leader in the world to make the global change necessary to address these threats.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Congresswoman.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I want to bring in Mr. Steyer on this.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You've made climate change a central point of your political career.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: To this issue of making change -- changes that last, making changes that are permanent, could you address that, sir?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Rachel, I'm the only person on this stage who will say that climate is the number-one priority for me.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Vice President Biden won't say it.

text: Senator Warren won't say it.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It's a state of emergency, and I would declare a state of emergency on day one.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I've spent a decade fighting and beating oil companies, stopping pipelines, stopping fossil fuel plants, ensuring clean energy across the country.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I know that we have to do this.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I also know that we can do this.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I would make this the number-one priority of my foreign policy, as well.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We can do this and create literally millions of good-paying union jobs across this country.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I would make sure that my climate policy was led by environmental justice and members of the communities where this society has chosen to put our air and water pollution, which are low-income black and brown communities.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And when we ask, how are we going to pull this country together, how about this: We take on the biggest challenge in history, we save the world, and we do it together.

text: I do.

text: Quickly, Vice President Biden, you were name-checked there.

text: I'd like to give you a chance to respond.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Yeah, I was.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I think it is the existential threat to humanity.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It's the number-one issue.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I might add, I don't really need a kind of a lecture from -- from my friend.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: While I was passing the first climate change bill and that PolitiFact said was a game-changer, while I managed the $90 billion recovery plan, investing more money in infrastructure that related to clean energy than any time we've ever done it, my friend was introducing more coal mines and produced more coal around the world, according to the press, than all of Great Britain produces.

text: Now, he's -- I welcome him back into the fold here, and he's been there for a long while.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But the idea that we talk about where we started and how we are, let's get this straight.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I think it is the existential threat of all time.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Can I respond to that, Rachel?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Mr. Vice President.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You may respond, Mr. Steyer.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Look, I came to the conclusion over 10 years ago that climate was the absolute problem of our society and it was the unintended consequence of our whole country being based on fossil fuels.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Everybody in this room has lived in an economy based on fossil fuels.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And we all have to come to the same conclusion that I came to over a decade ago.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: If we're waiting for Congress to pass one of the bills -- and I know everybody on this stage cares about this.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But Congress has never passed an important climate bill ever.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is a problem which continues to get worse.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's why I'm saying it's a state of emergency.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's why I'm saying it's priority one.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: If it isn't priority one, it's not going to get done.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And this is something where we absolutely have to address it upfront.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have to make it the most important thing.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And we can use it to rebuild and reimagine what the United States is.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We can be the moral leaders of the world again, while we clean up our air and water and create millions of good-paying jobs.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Sanders, I'm going to ask you to jump in here.

text: I was also named in that.

text: Tom, you stated...

text: You were.

text: You talked about the need to make climate change a national emergency.

text: I've introduced legislation to just do that.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Now, I disagree with the thrust of the original question, because your question has said, what are we going to do in decades?
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We don't have decades.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: What the scientists are telling us, if we don't get our act together within the next eight or nine years, we're talking about cities all over the world, major cities going underwater, we're talking about increased drought, talking about increased extreme weather disturbances.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The United Nations is telling us that in the years to come there are going to be hundreds of millions of climate refugees causing national security issues all over the world.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: What we have got to do tonight, and I will do as president, is to tell the fossil fuel industry that their short-term profits are not more important than the future of this planet.
title: 5th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And by the way, the fossil fuel industry is probably criminally liable, because they have lied and lied and lied when they had the evidence that their carbon products were destroying the planet, and maybe we should think about prosecuting them, as well.

text: Look, the point about nuclear power is, it's not at the stage in the United States where it's competitive on price.

text: It has a lot of risks to it in terms of disasters.

text: And we have no ability to store the toxins that come out of it and last 100,000 years.

text: We actually have the technology that we need.

text: It's called wind and solar and batteries.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So, in fact, what we need to do, we can do.

text: We've got to stop taking a look at this as something that we can't do, because we can do this, and we can do it in a way that creates, rebuilds this country on an accelerated basis, creates millions of union jobs, and we come at it from the standpoint of environmental justice.

text: This is our greatest opportunity to reinvent this country, to actually take on the biggest challenge in history and succeed together.

text: Vice President Biden, you've been reassuring voters that things will return to normal once President Trump leaves office, that Republicans will have what you call an epiphany and come to the table to work with a Biden administration.

text: Look, I didn't say return to normal.

text: Normal's not enough.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Normal -- in fact, we have to move beyond normal, whether it's health care, the environment, whatever it is.

text: We have to build on what we had started in our administration, and that's been interrupted very badly, number one.

text: Number two, with Trump out of the way, it's not going to change things in a fundamental way.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But what it will do is it will mean that we're in a position where he's not going to be able to intimidate the base, his base is not going to be able to intimidate those half a dozen Republicans we may need in other things.
