text: I refuse to accept the notion, as some on this stage do, that we can never, never get to a place where we have cooperation again.

text: I miss Kamala, I miss Cory, though I think Cory will be back.

text: I grew up the son of immigrants, and I had many racial epithets used against me as a kid.

text: They have numbers.

text: The average net worth of a black household is only 10 percent that of a white household.

text: For Latinos, it's 12 percent.

text: These are the numbers that define race in our country.

title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'd like to follow up.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The question, again, Mr. Yang, was about Dreamers.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Could I address immigration reform?
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You pledged to move -- you pledged to move on a permanent legislative fix in your first 100 days.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Dreamers say that they are frustrated by Democrats' failure to prioritize their status in deal after deal.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So why should Dreamers trust Democrats now?
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I believe everyone on this stage would do the right thing by Dreamers in the first 100 days.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I would make it a top priority.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'm the son of immigrants myself.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The fact is, almost half of Fortune 500 companies were started by an immigrant or children of immigrants.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Immigrants make our country stronger and more dynamic.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And immigrants are being scapegoated for issues they have absolutely nothing to do with.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: If you go to the factory in Michigan, it's not wall-to-wall immigrants.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It's wall-to-wall robot arms and machines.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have to send the opposite message of this administration.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And as your president, I think I could send a very clear message, where if you are considering immigrating to this country and I am the president, you would realize my son or daughter can become president of the United States.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's the opposite of the current administration, and that's the message I would love to send to the world.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Mr. Yang.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Sanders, a related question to you.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Donald Trump...
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Actually, Senator Sanders -- Senator Sanders, I have a new question for you.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You can respond to Mr. Yang's comments, as well.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I can't respond to the immigration question?
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is related, sir.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But there are estimated to be as many as 12 million undocumented immigrants in the U.S., more than 2 million right here in California.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: If you have a chance to forge a bipartisan immigration reform plan, would you insist on a path to citizenship for all 12 million or just a segment of that population?
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is what I would do.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Day one, executive order, restore the legal status of 1.8 million young people in the DACA program.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Day one, we change border policy so that federal agents will never snatch babies from the arms of their mothers.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Day one, day one, we introduce bipartisan legislation, which will, in fact, be comprehensive, which will result in a path toward citizenship for all of the 11 million who are undocumented.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That is what the people of our country want.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Trump thinks mistakenly that he is going to win re-election by dividing us up.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We are going to win this election by bringing our people together -- black and white and Latino, Native American, Asian American.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's what this campaign is about.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's what America must be about.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Klobuchar, you had your hand up.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I started my day-to-day with a group of immigrants who were there talking to me about housing.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I thought about this president and what he's done.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: He has used our immigrants as political pawns.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Every single day, he tries to draw a wedge.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I will be a different president.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: My view on this comes from experience.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: When I got to the Senate, Senator Kennedy asked me to be one of the two new senators that was in the group to work on the immigration reform package.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We got so close to passing that.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I voted for it.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Not everyone did.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'm sorry.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Then I was on the Judiciary Committee when President Obama was president.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And we worked very hard on that immigration reform.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We actually passed that with Republican votes.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Then I was in the small group that worked on the compromise on the Dreamers that would have solved that problem.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We didn't get that done because this president gut-punched us.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I will take my views.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I will take this experience.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I will get this done because immigrants don't diminish America.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They are America.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Mr. Steyer, briefly, your response?
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Listen, I think it's important to note that this president is not against immigration.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: He's against immigration by nonwhite people.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Yes.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is his attempt to divide us, as Senator Sanders said, on race.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And that's what he's been doing since the very first day he started running for president.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: He's been vilifying non-white people.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: He's been trying to inflame his base and scare them that if, in fact, white people lose control of this country, that they're going to lose control of their lives.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And as somebody who lives in a majority-minority state, which is California, what he's doing is so wrong on so many different levels.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I agree with Senator Sanders.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have to reframe this argument completely.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have to go back to the idea that every American is worth being a full human being on every right.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is a racial argument by a racist president who's trying to divide us and who's vilifying people.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It's absolutely wrong.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And it's led him to break the laws of humanity in our name.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Mr. Steyer.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Mayor Buttigieg, a new question to you, Mr. Mayor.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You said last month that the U.S. owes compensation to children separated from their families at the southern border.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The consensus among child welfare experts is that those thousands of children will likely suffer lifelong trauma as a result of that separation.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Are you committing as president to financial compensation for those thousands of children?
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Yes, and they should have a fast track to citizenship, because what the United States did under this president to them was wrong.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have a moral obligation to make right what was broken.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And on the larger issue of immigration, my understanding of this issue isn't theoretical.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It's not something I formed in committee rooms in Washington.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It begins with the fact that my household, my family, came from abroad.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: My father immigrated to this country and became a U.S. citizen.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It comes from the fact that I'm the mayor of a city where neighborhoods that were left for dying are now coming back to life, largely because of the contributions mainly of Latino immigrants.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I've seen those same neighborhoods shut down, families huddling in church, panicking just because of the rumor of an ICE raid.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That did not make our country safer.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Could I respond?
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I had to look into the eyes of an 8-year-old boy whose father was deported, even though he had nothing so much as a traffic ticket against his name, and try to think of something to tell that boy because I couldn't tell him what he most wanted to hear, which is just that he was going to have his dad back.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: How could harming that young man possibly make America safer?
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Mr. Mayor, just...
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: When I am president, based on those experiences, I will make sure that this is a country of laws and of values.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And that means not only ending these unspeakable, cruel practices at the border, but finally and truly fixing the immigration system that has needed a full overhaul since the 1980s.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Mr. Mayor...
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We cannot wait 4 years, 10 years.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We cannot wait anymore to do something about this.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Mr. Mayor.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Just to follow up...
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: ... since you do support compensation for those families, should the U.S. also compensate descendants of enslaved people?
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Do you support reparations for African-Americans?
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I support H.R.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: 40, which is the bill that has been proposed in Congress to establish a commission to look at reparations.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But we shouldn't wait for that commission to do its work to do things that are reparative.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Remember, we're not talking about a gift to anybody.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We're talking about mending what was broken.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We're talking about the generational theft of the wealth of generations of African-Americans.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And just crossing out a racist policy and replacing it with a neutral one is not enough to deliver equality.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Harms compound, just like a dollar saved in its value compounds over time.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So does the value of a dollars stolen.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's just the math.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Let's talk about how we -- excuse me.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And that is why the United States must act immediately with investments in minority-owned businesses, with investments in health equity, with investments in HBCUs, and on the longer term look at reparations so that we can mend what has been broken.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Vice President Biden, do you support reparations?
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Look, let me -- since I haven't spoken on this, I've got a chance.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Number one, the reason we're the country we are is because of immigration.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We've been able to cherry pick the best from every single continent.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The people who come here have determination, resilience.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They are ready to stand up and work like the devil.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have 24 out of every 100 children in our schools today is Hispanic.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The idea that we are going to walk away and not provide every opportunity for them is not only stupid and immoral, but it's bad for America.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They are the future of America and we should invest in them.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Everybody will benefit from it, every single American.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And you should get used to it.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is a nation of immigrants.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's who we are.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's why we're who we are.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's what makes us different.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And we should invest in them.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Mr. Biden.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Klobuchar, you had your hand up.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Well, I was -- I was harkening back.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I made my case on immigration to what the mayor said about Washington.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So I look at this a different way.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: When we were in the last debate, Mayor, you basically mocked the hundred years of experience on the stage.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And what do I see on this stage?
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I see Elizabeth's work starting the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and helping 29 million people.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I see the vice president's work in getting $2 billion for his cancer moon shot.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I see Senator Sanders' work -- working to get the veterans bill passed across the aisle.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I see what I've done, which is to negotiate three farm bills and be someone that actually had major provisions put in those bills.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So while you can dismiss committee hearings, I think this experience works.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I have not denigrated your experience as a local official.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I have been one.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You know -- I'm sorry.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I just think you should respect our experience when you look at how you evaluate someone who can get things done.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Mr. Mayor, I'll give you a chance to respond.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You actually did denigrate my experience, Senator, and it was before the break, and I was going to let it go, because we got bigger fish to fry here.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But you implied that my...
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Oh, I don't think we have bigger fish to fry than picking a president of the United States.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You're right.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And before the break, you seemed to imply that my relationship to the First Amendment was a talking point, as if anyone up here has any more or less commitment to the Constitution than anybody else up here.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Let me tell you about my relationship to the First Amendment.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It is part of the Constitution that I raised my right hand and swore to defend with my life.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That is my experience.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And it may not be the same as yours, but it counts, Senator.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It counts.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Mr. Mayor.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Klobuchar, you have 45 seconds to respond.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I have been -- I certainly respect your military experience.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's not what this is about.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is about choosing a president.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I know my view of this is I know you ran to be chair of the Democratic National Committee.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's not something that I wanted to do.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I want to be president of the United States.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And the point is, we should have someone heading up this ticket that has actually won and been able to show that they can gather the support that you talk about of moderate Republicans and independents, as well as a fired-up Democratic base, and not just done it once, I have done it three times.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I think winning matters.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I think a track record of getting things done matters.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I also think showing our party that we can actually bring people with us, have a wider tent, have a bigger coalition, and, yes, longer coattails, that matters.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Yamiche?
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Excuse me.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I got to respond to that.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I got to respond to that.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator, I know that, if you just go by vote totals, maybe what goes on in my city seems small to you.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: If you want to talk about the capacity to win, try putting together a coalition to bring you back to office with 80 percent of the vote as a gay dude in Mike Pence's Indiana.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Again, I would -- Mayor, if you -- if you had won in Indiana, that would be one thing.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You tried and you lost by 20 points.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Let's talk about how we win an election, which is something everybody here wants to do, in terms of defeating the most dangerous president in American history.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So let me tell you how you win it: You have the largest voter turnout in the history of America.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And you don't have -- you don't have the largest voter turnout unless you create energy and excitement.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And you don't create energy and excitement unless you are prepared to take on the people who own America and are prepared to speak to the people who are working in America.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We need a progressive agenda -- Medicare for all, raising the minimum wage to a living wage, leading the world in combatting climate change, making public colleges and universities available to all...
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator Sanders.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: ... because we have free tuition, and canceling all student debt in this country.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator Sanders.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'd like to turn to a new subject, and that is, of course, education.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Warren, you've proposed free public college tuition and student loan forgiveness for most families.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Why should wealthy families be able to send their kids to public college for free?
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Why not concentrate that government help on those most in need?
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So, as I've talked about before, I have a two cent wealth tax proposed for millionaires and billionaires, and that gives us enough money to invest in all of our babies, age 0 to 5, to put an historic $800 billion investment in public schools K through 12, and that will permit us to offer technical school, two-year college, four-year college for every single person who wants an education, cancel student loan debt for 50 -- put a $50 billion investment in our historically black colleges and universities, and cancel student loan debt for 43 million Americans.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Look, this is about money, but this is also about values.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We need to make an investment in our future, and the best way to do that is let's invest in the public education of our children.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That starts when you're babies and it goes long after high school.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We want to have families.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I meet families every day in the selfie lines who talk about what it means to be crushed by student loan debt.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's why I have a proposal popular among Democrats, popular among Republicans, popular among independents, to ask those at the top to pay a little more so somebody can get rid of that student loan debt so they can make an investment in themselves, start a small business, buy a car, create a future for themselves and for this country.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I see some hands, but I want to go to Mayor Buttigieg.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Can I respond?
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Mayor Buttigieg, your plan offers free or discounted public college only to families making up to $150,000 a year.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Do you think Senator Warren's plan offers free college to too many families?
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I do think that if you're in that lucky top 10 percent -- I still wish you well, don't get me wrong.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I just want you to go ahead and pay your own tuition.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Now, we can still have public service loan forgiveness for those who go into lower income fields to deal with that.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But if you're in that top 10 percent, I think you're going to be for the most part OK.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And there is a very real choice on where every one of these tax dollars goes.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So I very much agree with Senator Warren on raising more tax revenue from millionaires and billionaires.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I just don't agree on the part about spending it on millionaires and billionaires when it comes to their college tuition.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Mayor.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Mayor Buttigieg.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So -- no, wait, wait, wait.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I want to...
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: No.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: He mentioned me by name.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'm going to let -- I'm going to let you respond, Senator Warren.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Go ahead.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: He mentioned me by name.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Look, the mayor wants billionaires to pay one tuition for their own kids.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I want a billionaire to pay enough to cover tuition for all of our kids, because that's how we build a future.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The other part is we've got to deal with student loan debt.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And right now, most of the people on this stage are nibbling around the edges of a huge student loan debt burden that disproportionally affects people of color.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: African-Americans are more likely to have to borrow money to go to school, more likely to borrow more money while they're in school, and have a harder time paying it off.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We want to make an investment in the future?
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Then open up education for all of our kids.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's how we build a future.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Sanders?
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Could I respond after Bernie?
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We believe -- I believe in the concept of universality.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And one of the crises in America today is people are sick and tired of filling out forms.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So you're not eligible for the program today because you're at $150,000, but you lost your job, are you eligible?
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You get a better job, you're eligible.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I think what we have to do is what we do with Social Security, what we do with public education.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Donald Trump's kids can go to a public school.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They should be able to go to a public school.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: What we need right now is a revolution in education.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have got to end this dysfunctional childcare system and make sure that every working-class person in this country can find high-quality, affordable childcare.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We need to make public colleges and universities tuition-free.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And by taxing billionaires and by taxing Wall Street, we will cancel all student debt in this country.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator Sanders.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Tim?
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Switching gears here, Mr. Steyer, earlier this year in Iowa, I met a father, Bill Stumpf, and his son, Kyle, in Dubuque.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Kyle is a remarkable young adult with significant disabilities.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And though he's been employed for about five years at a local pizza parlor, the future is very uncertain for his family.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Bill worries that there aren't enough jobs, living facilities, social programs designed to meet the needs of his son.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So I'm wonderful, as president, are there specific steps that you would take to help people like Kyle become more integrated into the workforce and into their local communities?
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Look, the United States has made a commitment to treat everybody equally.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And that means supporting people with disabilities, both in terms of education and later when they're part of the workforce.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That means bringing the resources to bear to make sure that we're treating them fairly, in school and after school, to try and integrate them fully and to make them have as full a life as possible.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The question we've got here across the board is, can we afford to do the kinds of things that Senator Sanders and Senator Warren are pushing?
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And the answer is yes, that, in fact, what we need to do is to undo the tax breaks that have been given for two generations to rich Americans and big corporations.
title: 6th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Last year, the top 400 corporations paid an 11 percent tax.

text: But what do you do about farms and factories that simply can't be moved?
title: 7th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's why we have to fight climate change with such urgency.
title: 7th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Climate change has come to America from coast to coast.
title: 7th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Seeing it in Iowa.
title: 7th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have seen it in historic floods in my community.
title: 7th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I had to activate our emergency operation center for a once-in-a-millennium flood.
title: 7th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Then two years later had to do the same thing.
title: 7th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: In Australia there are literally tornadoes made of fire taking place.
title: 7th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is no longer theoretical and this is no longer off in the future.
title: 7th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have got to act, yes, to adapt, to make sure communities are more resilient, to make sure our economy is ready for the consequences that are going to happen one way or the other.
title: 7th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But we also have to ensure that we don't allow this to get any worse.
title: 7th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And if we get right, farmers will be a huge part of the solution.
title: 7th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We need to reach out to the very people who have sometimes been made to feel that accepting climate science would be a defeat for them, whether we're talking about farmers or industrial workers in my community, and make clear that we need to enlist them...

text: But, Mayor Buttigieg...
title: 7th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: ... in the national project to do something about it.

text: ... to clarify, what do you do about farms and factories that cannot be relocated?

title: 7th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We are going to have to use federal funds to make sure that we are supporting those whose lives will inevitably be impacted further by the increased severity and the increased frequency.
title: 7th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And by the way, that is happening to farms, that is happening to factories, and that disproportionately happens to black and brown Americans, which is why equity and environmental justice have to be at the core of our climate plan going forward.

text: Thank you, Mayor Buttigieg.

text: And it's unbelievably expensive.

text: But this is why climate is my number one priority.

text: Well, they're probably confused because they've not read it.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: What's your response?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: My response is, Obamacare is working.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: The way to build this and get to it immediately is to build on Obamacare.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And so, do you want to know what I'm going to do?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: But the reality is that I have been spending time in this campaign listening to American families, listening to experts, listening to health care providers, and what I came away with is a very clear understanding that I needed to create a plan that was responsive to the needs of the American people, responsive to their needs understanding that insurance companies have been jacking up the prices for far too long, that American families have to be held down by deductibles and co-pays and premiums that can cause them bankruptcy.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I listened to the American families who said four years is just not enough to transition into this new plan, so I devised a plan where it's going to be 10 years of a transition.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I listened to American families who said I want an option that will be under your Medicare system that allows a private plan.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So I designed a plan where, yes, responsive to the needs of American families, there will be a public plan, under my plan for Medicare, and a private plan, under my plan for Medicare.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Because the bottom line is this: We must agree that access to health care must be a right and not just a privilege of those who can afford it.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And in America today, far too many people -- in fact, 30 million people -- are going without access to health care.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Senator Harris.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Vice President Biden, your response.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Well, my response is that the senator has had several plans so far.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And any time someone tells you you're going to get something good in 10 years, you should wonder why it takes 10 years.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: If you noticed, there is no talk about the fact that the plan in 10 years will cost $3 trillion.

text: You will lose your employer-based insurance.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And in fact, you know, this is the single most important issue facing the public.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And to be very blunt and to be very straightforward, you can't beat President Trump with double-talk on this plan.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Your response, Senator Harris?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Absolutely.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Unfortunately, Vice President Biden, you're just simply inaccurate in what you're describing.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: The reality is that our plan will bring health care to all Americans under a Medicare for All system.

text: Our plan will allow people to start signing up on the first day.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Babies will be born into our plan, and right now, 4 million babies almost are born every day in America -- or every year in America.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Under our plan, we will ensure that everyone has access to health care.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Your plan, by contrast, leaves out almost 10 million Americans.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So I think that you should really think about what you're saying, but be reflective and understand that the people of America want access to health care and do not want cost to be their barrier to getting it.

text: Senator Harris, thank you.

text: Vice President Biden, your response?

text: The plan, no matter how you cut it, costs $3 trillion when it is, in fact, employed, number one.

text: Ten years from now, after two terms of the senator being president, after her time.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Secondly, it will require middle-class taxes to go up, not down.

text: Thirdly, it will eliminate employer-based insurance.

text: And fourthly, what happens in the meantime?

text: I'd like to respond.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: First of all, the cost of doing nothing is far too expensive.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Second, we are now paying $3 trillion a year for health care in America.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Over the next 10 years, it's probably going to be $6 trillion.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We must act.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: My plan is about immediately allowing people to sign up and get into coverage.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Right now in America, we have seniors, who every day -- millions of seniors are going into the Medicare system and they are getting full coverage and the kind of coverage they need.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: All people should have access to health care.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And costs should not be their barrier.

text: Thank you, Senator Harris.

text: Mayor de Blasio, let's bring you in here.

text: What's your response?

text: I don't know what the vice president and the senator are talking about.

text: The folks I talk to about health insurance say that their health insurance isn't working for them.

text: There's tens of millions of Americans who don't even have health insurance, tens of millions more who have health insurance they can barely make work because of the co-pays, the deductibles, the premiums, the out-of-pocket expenses.

text: There's this mythology that somehow all of these folks are in love with their insurance in America.

text: I'll come to you right after Secretary Castro.

text: Secretary Castro.

text: What I hear from union members and from hard-working, middle-class people is they wish they had better insurance and they're angry at private insurance companies that skim all the profits off the top and make it impossible for everyday people to get coverage like mental care...

text: Thank you, Mr. Mayor.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: ... dental care, the things that would be full coverage for all Americans.

text: Thank you, Mr. Mayor.

text: Vice President Biden, you just heard Mayor de Blasio.

text: He said in the past that Democrats who wanted to keep the private insurance industry are defending a health care system that is not working.

text: Go back and do -- take back all the things that Trump took away, provide a public option, meaning every single person in America would be able to buy into that option if they didn't like their employer plan, or if they're on Medicaid, they'd automatically be in the plan.

text: It would take place immediately.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It would move quickly.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And it would insure the vast, vast, vast majority of Americans.

text: In the meantime, what happens?

text: That's what it costs.

text: Not $30 trillion.

text: Thank you, Mr. Vice President.

text: Senator Gillibrand, you support Medicare for All.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: How do you feel about Senator Harris continuing to call her health proposal Medicare for All, when it includes a far more significant role for private insurance than the bill you co-sponsored?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I think for the viewers in the audience right now, they're at risk of losing the forest through the trees, because the truth is, health care in America should be a right.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: When I was a young mother and had Theo as an infant, he had an allergic reaction to eggs and his whole body turned red and puffy.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I had to rush him to the emergency room.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: My heart is palpitating because I'm worried that his throat will close.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I am not worried about not having an insurance card or a credit card in my wallet.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I know whatever they're going to prescribe, whether it's an EpiPen or an inhaler, I can afford it.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: The truth about health care in America today is people can't afford it.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: They cannot afford -- and the insurance companies for these plans that rely on insurance companies, I'm sorry, they're for-profit companies.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: They have an obligation to their shareholders.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: They pay their CEO millions of dollars.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: They have to have quarterly profits.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: They have fat in the system that's real and it should be going to health care.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So let's not lose the forest for the trees.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And last, let's not forget what the Republicans are doing, because the truth is, the Republicans and Trump, their whole goal is to take away your health care.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: To make it harder for you to afford it, even if you have pre-existing conditions.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Senator Gillibrand.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator Harris, your response?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: In response to Senator Biden about the Affordable Care Act, it is important that you understand that our Medicare for All plan has actually by the architect of the Obama Affordable Care Act been described as one of the most effective ways to bring health care to all.

text: Kathleen Sebelius has endorsed our plan as being something that will get us to where we need to go.

text: In terms of the point that Senator Gillibrand is raising, I couldn't agree more.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator Biden, your plan will keep and allow insurance companies to remain with status quo, doing business as usual, and that's going to be about jacking up co-pays, jacking up deductibles...

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It will still be the situation that people going to an emergency room...

text: So how do you square that?

text: Well, I know that this is something very personal for all Americans.

text: Well, first of all, let me just say, that the person that's enjoying this debate most right now is Donald Trump, as we pit Democrats against each other, while he is working right now to take away Americans' healthcare.

text: And so, I was raised by two civil rights parents who told me, always keep your eyes on the prize.

text: And that is that in the United States of America, every Democrat should stand with the belief that everyone should have access to healthcare, that it's a human right.

text: And how we get there, it has to be to end this broken system, because we are on our way, just a handful of years of literally spending 20 percent of our economy, one out of every $5 spent on healthcare.

text: And we spend more than every other nation, on everything from MRIs to insulin drugs, multiple mores than other countries - multiple more than other countries.

text: I'm going to work to get us to a point where Medicare for All - where everyone is covered.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: But this pitting against progressives against moderates, saying one is unrealistic and the other doesn't care enough, that to me is dividing our party and demoralizing us in face of the real enemy here.

text: And I'm -

text: Thank you, Senator.

text: Thank you, Senator.

text: We will do that.

text: Senator Harris is my friend as well, but I have to say if we can't admit -- if we can't admit tonight what's in the plan, which is banning employer based insurance, we're not going to be able to admit that when Donald Trump is accusing democrats of doing that as well.

text: We need to be honest about what's in this plan.

title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Governor Inslee.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Mr. Yang, I want to bring you in.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: You support a Medicare for All system.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: How do you respond to Governor Inslee?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Well, I just want to share a story.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: When I told my wife I was running for president, you know the first question she asked me?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: What are we going to do about our health care?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That's a true story, and it's not just us.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Democrats are talking about health care in the wrong way.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: As someone who's run a business, I can tell you flat out our current health care system makes it harder to hire, it makes it harder to treat people well and give them benefits and treat them as full-time employees, it makes it harder to switch jobs, as Senator Harris just said, and it's certainly a lot harder to start a business.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: If we say, look, we're going to get health care off the backs of businesses and families, then watch American entrepreneurship recover and bloom.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Mr. Yang.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Mayor de Blasio?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Yeah, I don't understand why Democrats on this stage are fearmongering about universal health care.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It makes no sense.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Ask the American people, they are sick of what the pharmaceutical companies are doing to them.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Ask them what they feel about the health insurance companies.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: They feel it's holding back their families because they can't get the coverage they need.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: They get a lot of noes.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: They don't get a lot of help from health insurance companies.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Why are we not going to be the party that does something bold, that says we don't need to be dependent on private insurance?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We can have a system that actually covers everyone.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: You know what?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Donald Trump won this state of Michigan by saying he was going to disrupt the status quo.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: How about we be the party that's going to disrupt the status quo for working people?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Mr. Mayor, just a 15-second point of clarification.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Who are you talking about?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Who's fearmongering?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Certainly, with all due respect to Senator Bennet, what he's saying is absolutely inaccurate about taxes.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Americans right now are paying so much money for their health care, ask people about the reality of premiums, deductibles, co-pays, out-of-pocket expenses.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That's worse than any tax, and people are paying that right now.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Mr. Mayor.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator Bennet?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: This -- this is -- this has nothing to do with Republican talking points or the pharmaceutical industry.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: This has to do with having faith in the American people that they can make the right decisions for their families and they can choose a public option.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Bernie Sanders, who said last night he wrote the damn bill, and he did, just like I wrote the damn public option bill, is the guy who says it will cost $32 trillion and that we're going to have to raise those taxes to pay for it.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: He says that.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Republicans don't say it.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Don't try to district from the truth.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Senator Bennet.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: You can't hide from the truth.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I want to let Mayor de Blasio -- and then I'm going to come to you, Vice President Biden.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We need to be for universal health care.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator, if we as Democrats say we're done with private insurance, has only hurt the American people in so many ways, we're going to give them something that works for their family's full coverage that they can depend on.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: If we say that, then there's an election.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: The American people get to decide.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: The ultimate choice, Senator, is an election, and this should be the party that stands for universal health care and says we're not going to accept anything less.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Right now, in America, so many people don't have the health care they need.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That is a fact.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Tens of millions of people, including middle class people.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Mr. Mayor.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Give them a chance to make that decision through an election.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Mr. Mayor.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Vice President Biden, your response, sir?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: This is not a Republican talking point.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: The Republicans are trying to kill Obamacare.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Obamacare took care of 20 million people right off the bat, 100 million people with pre-existing conditions.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And in fact, what we got is a public option that, in fact, would allow anybody to buy in.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: No one has to keep their private insurance.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: They can buy into this plan.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And they can buy into it with $1,000 deductible and never have to pay more than 8.5 percent of their income when they do it.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And if they don't have any money, they'll get in free.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So this idea is a bunch of malarkey, what we're talking about here.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: The fact of the matter is -- the fact of the matter is that there will be a deductible.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It will be a deductible on their paycheck.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Bernie acknowledges it.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Bernie acknowledges it.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thirty trillion dollars has to ultimately be paid.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And I don't know what math you do in New York, I don't know what math you do in California, but I tell ya, that's a lot of money, and there will be a deductible.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: The deductible will be out of your paycheck, because that's what will be required.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator Harris, I want to bring you in here.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Your response?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Yeah, let's talk about math.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Let's talk about math.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Let's talk about the fact that the pharmaceutical companies and the insurance companies last year alone profited $72 billion, and that is on the backs of American families.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And under your plan, status quo, you do nothing to hold the insurance companies to task for what they have been doing to American families.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: In America today, diabetes patients, one in four cannot afford their insulin.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: In America today...
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: ... for those people who have overdosed from an opioid, there is a syringe that costs $4,000 that will save their life.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It is immoral.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It is untenable.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And it must change with Medicare for All.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Your time is up, Senator.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Vice President Biden, your response?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Real quick.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I have the only plan that limits the ability of insurance companies to charge unreasonable prices, flat out, number one.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Number two, we should put some of these insurance executives who totally oppose my plan in jail for of the $9 billion opioids they sell out there.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: They are misrepresenting to the American people what needs to be done.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And, lastly, here's the deal.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: The deal is, let's figure out how this works.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We immediately are able to cover everybody who wants to get off of their insurance plan they don't like, no matter what one it is, and buy into a Medicare option.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And they can buy the gold plan, and they're not going to have to pay -- anyway...
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Mr. Vice President.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Let's move now to immigration, please.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Secretary Castro, you think it should no longer be a crime to cross the U.S. border illegally.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: President Obama's homeland security secretary, Jeh Johnson, whom you served with, says that is a public declaration that the border is, quote, \"effectively open to all.\"
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: How is he wrong?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you for that question.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: You know, if you elect me president, you're not electing me to follow.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: You're electing me to lead.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And open borders is a right-wing talking point, and frankly I'm disappointed that some folks, including some folks on this stage, have taken the bait.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: The only way that we're going to guarantee that we don't have family separations in this country again is to repeal Section 1325 of the Immigration Nationality Act.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That is the law that this president, this administration is using to incarcerate migrant parents and then physically separate them from their children.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: My immigration plan would also make sure that we put undocumented immigrants who haven't committed a serious crime on a pathway to citizenship, that we do a 21st century Marshall Plan with Honduras, El Salvador, and Guatemala, so that we can get to the root of this challenge so people can find safety and opportunity at home instead of having to come to the United States.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That's how we can be smarter, more effective, and more humane when it comes to immigration policy.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Secretary Castro.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator Bennet, what's your response?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I disagree that we should decriminalize our border.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: This is personal for me.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: My mom is an immigrant, and she was separated from her parents during the Holocaust in Poland.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And for those reasons, I was part of the Gang of Eight that wrote -- I wrote the immigration bill in 2013 with John McCain that passed the Senate with 68 votes, that gave a pathway to citizenship for the 11 million undocumented people that are here, that would pass the most progressive DREAM Act that had ever been conceived, much less passed on the floor of the Senate, and had $46 billion of border security.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Every single Democrat voted for that bill...
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator...
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: ... and a lot of Republicans.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That should be our position.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That is our position as Democrats.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator Harris, you have indicated that you don't think it should be a criminal offense punishable by jail to cross the U.S. border illegally.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: How do you respond to Senator Bennet?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Well, again, with all due respect, you know, I -- after the last debate, for example, I went to a place in Florida called Homestead, and there is a private detention facility being paid for by your taxpayer dollars, a private detention facility that currently houses 2,700 children.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It took resilience.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It took absolutely confidence for them to come.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And by the way, there were members of us -- Julian was there, members of Congress, they would not let us enter the place, members of the United States Congress.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So I walked down the road, I climbed a ladder, and I looked over the fence.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And I'm going to tell you what I saw.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I saw children lined up single file based on gender being walked into barracks.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: The policies of this administration have been facilitated by laws on the books...
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: ... that allow them to be incarcerated as though they've committed crimes.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: These children have not committed crimes...
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Senator Harris.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: ... and should be not treated like criminals.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator Bennet, what's your response?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I think this is one in the end that we agree with.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: There's not a single person on this stage if we were president would ever separate a child from their parents at the border.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And that is what this...
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That is what this administration has done in the American people's name.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: They have turned our border into a symbol of nativist hostility.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: The symbol of this country before Donald Trump was president was the Statue of Liberty.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That should be the symbol of the United States of America, not Donald Trump's words.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Senator Bennet.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator Gillibrand, I want to bring you in.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: What's your response?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So I think when you talk about whether this should be a crime, you have to remember who we're talking about.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: When I was at the Texas border, I visited with women who had fled violence.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: A woman from El Salvador owned a small business, gangs came to her and said if you don't give us all your money, we're going to kill your family.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That's why she fled.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Another woman was raped.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That's why she fled.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So this is who we're talking about -- and they're not criminals.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So I believe that we should have a civil violation.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: No president before President Trump enforced the law in the way he has enforced it.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Because he's using it as the crutch to lock up women and children, to separate mothers and babies, to put them behind bars.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: So I don't think we should have a law on the books that can be so misused.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It should be a civil violation and we should make sure that we treat people humanely.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Vice President Biden, in the first two years of the Obama administration, nearly 800,000 immigrants were deported, far more than during President Trump's first two years.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Would the higher deportation rates resume if you were president?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Absolutely not, number one.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Number two, everything landed on the president's desk but locusts.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I found that Julian -- excuse me -- the secretary, we sat together in many meetings.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I never heard him talk about any of this when he was the secretary.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Three million
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Please be respectful.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Please be respectful in the crowd.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Three million
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Please continue, Mr. Vice President.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Three million
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: The fact is -- the fact is...
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Three million
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I don't know if you can hear.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I can hear.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: But anyway...
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We can hear fine, Mr. Vice President.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: OK.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Please continue, if you will.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: The fact is what the senator from New York talked about is seeking asylum.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That woman, the women she spoke to are entitled to asylum.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That is not crossing the border illegally.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: What we should do is flood the zone to make sure we have people to make those decisions quickly.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: With regard to -- with regard to the secretary's point, I already proposed and passed...
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: ... $750 million for Guatemala, El Salvador and Honduras, to be able to change the circumstance why people fled in the first place.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: In addition to that, we're in a circumstance where if in fact you say you can just cross the border, what do you say to all those people around the world who in fact want the same thing to come to the United States and make their case, that they don't -- that they have to wait in line.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: The fact of the matter is, you should be able to -- if you cross the border illegally, you should be able to be sent back.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It's a crime.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It's a crime, and it's not one that in fact...
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank -- thank you, Mr. Vice President.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Secretary Castro, please, your response?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Yeah, first of all, Mr. Vice President, it looks like one of us has learned the lessons of the past and one of us hasn't.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Let me begin by telling you -- let me just start out by answering that question.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: My immigration plan would also fix the broken legal immigration system, because we do have a problem with that.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I agree.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Secondly, the only way that we're going to guarantee that these kinds of family separations don't happen in the future is that we need to repeal this law.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: There's still going to be consequences if somebody crosses the border.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: It's a civil action.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Also, we have 654 miles of fencing.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We have thousands of personnel at the border.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We have planes; we have boats; we have helicopters; we have security cameras...
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Secretary Castro, thank you.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: What we need are politicians that actually...
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Your time is up.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: ... have some guts on this issue.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Secretary.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Mr. Vice President, please, your response?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I have guts enough to say his plan doesn't make sense.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Here's the deal.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: The fact of the matter is that, in fact, when people cross the border illegally, it is illegal to do it unless they're seeking asylum.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: People should have to get in line.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That's the problem.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And the only reason this particular part of the law is being abused is because of Donald Trump.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We should defeat Donald Trump and end this practice.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Congresswoman Gabbard, what's your response?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Our hearts break when we see those children at these detention facilities who've been separated from their parents, when we see human beings crowded into cages in abhorrent, inhumane conditions.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: This is about leadership and understanding that we can and should have both secure borders as well as humane immigration policies.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We will have to stop separating children from their parents, make it so that it's easier for people to seek asylum in this country, make sure that we are securing our borders and making it so that people are able to use our legal immigration system by reforming those laws.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Mr. Yang, your response?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I'm the son of immigrants myself.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: My father immigrated here as a graduate student and generated over 65 U.S. patents for G.E.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: and IBM.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I think that's a pretty good deal for the United States.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: That's the immigration story we need to be telling.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: We can't always be focusing on some of the -- the -- the distressed stories.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: And if you go to a factory here in Michigan, you will not find wall-to-wall immigrants; you will find wall-to-wall robots and machines.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Immigrants are being scapegoated for issues they have nothing to do with in our economy.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Thank you, Mr. Yang.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Senator Booker you have a plan that would, quote, \"virtually eliminate immigration detention.\"
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Does that mean that the roughly 55,000 migrants currently in detention would be released into the United States?
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: Well, first of all, I just want to say, again, tonight, we are playing into Republican hands who have a very different view, and they're trying to divide us against each other.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: I'm listening to the language of my colleagues.
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (A)

text: No, Mr. Vice President, we are not going to just let people cross the border.
