text: David?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"George, thank you.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I want to turn now to our troops overseas and to America's longest war in Afghanistan.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"U.S. talks with the Taliban are dead, according to the president.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Secret talks at Camp David have been canceled before they could happen.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Many of you have weighed in on that already, so I want to move past that tonight to what all of you have promised on the campaign trail.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Many of you on this stage have said you'd bring the troops home in your first term.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Others have said in your first year.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Senator Warren, we all know the presidency is much different from the campaign trail.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: President Obama wanted to bring the troops home.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: President Trump promised to bring the troops home.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And you have said of Afghanistan, let's help them reach a peace settlement.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"It is time to bring our troops home, in your words, starting right now.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Would you keep that promise to bring the troops home starting right now with no deal with the Taliban?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And I'll tell you why.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: What we're doing right now in Afghanistan is not helping the safety and security of the United States.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It is not helping the safety and security of the world.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It is not helping the safety and security of Afghanistan.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We need to bring our troops home.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And then we need to make a big shift.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We cannot ask our military to keep solving problems that cannot be solved militarily.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We're not going to bomb our way to a solution in Afghanistan.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"We need to treat the problem of terrorism as a worldwide problem, and that means we need to be working with all of our allies, our European allies, our Canadian allies, our Asian allies, our allies in Africa and in South America.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We need to work together to root out terrorism.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It means using all of our tools.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It means economic investment.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It means expanding our diplomatic efforts instead of hollowing out the State Department and deliberately making it so we have no eyes and ears in many of these countries.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We need a foreign policy that is about our security and about leading on our values.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Senator Warren, a quick follow on that, because top U.S. leaders, military leaders on the ground in Afghanistan told me you can't do it without a deal with the Taliban.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"You just said you would, you would bring them home.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: What if they told you that?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Would you listen to their advice?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I was in Afghanistan with John McCain two years ago this past summer.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I think it may have been Senator McCain's last trip before he was sick.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And I talked to people  we did  we talked to military leaders, American and local leaders, we talked to people on the ground and asked the question, the same one I ask on the Senate Armed Services Committee every time one of the generals comes through: Show me what winning looks like.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Tell me what it looks like.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And what you hear is a lot of, \"\"Uh,\"\" because no one can describe it.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And the reason no one can describe it is because the problems in Afghanistan are not problems that can be solved by a military.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I have three older brothers who all served in the military.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I understand firsthand the kind of commitment they have made.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: They will do anything we ask them to do.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: But we cannot ask them to solve problems that they alone cannot solve.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We need to work with the rest of the world.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We need to use our economic tools.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We need to use our diplomatic tools.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We need to build with our allies.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And we need to make the whole world safer, not keep troops bombing in Afghanistan.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Senator Warren, thank you.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I do want to stay on this, and I want to turn to Mayor Buttigieg, because you're the only veteran on this stage.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: You served in Afghanistan.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"We heard in recent days from General Joseph Dunford, the chair of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, who said in recent days, \"\"I'm not going to use the word withdrawal right now.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"It's our judgment the Afghans need support to deal with the level of violence.\"\"\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: ISIS filled that vacuum.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"If he's not even using the word withdrawal, would you put your promise to bring troops home in the first year on hold to follow the advice?\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"You know, I served under General Dunford, way under General Dunford, in Afghanistan.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And today, September 12, 2019, means that today you could be 18 years old, old enough to serve, and had not been alive on 9/11.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We have got to put an end to endless war.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And the way we do it is see to it that that country will never again be used for an attack against our homeland, and that does not require an open-ended commitment of ground troops.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Let me say something else, because if there's one thing we've learned about Afghanistan, from Afghanistan, it's that the best way not to be caught up in endless war is to avoid starting one in the first place.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And so when I am president, an authorization for the use of military force will have a built-in three-year sunset.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Congress will be required to vote and a president will be required to go to Congress to seek an authorization.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Because if our troops can summon the courage to go overseas, the least our members of Congress should be able to do is summon the courage to take a vote on whether they ought to be there.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"By the way, we also have a president right now who seems to treat troops as props, or worse, tools for his own enrichment.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We saw what's going on with flights apparently being routed through Scotland just so people can stay at his hotels?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I'll tell you, as a military officer, the very first thing that goes through your mind, the first time you ever make eye contact with somebody that you are responsible for in uniform, is do not let these men and women down.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: This president is doing exactly that.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I will not.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Mayor Buttigieg, thank you.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I want to turn to Vice President Biden, because the concerns about any possible vacuum being created in Afghanistan, if you pulled the U.S. troops out, has been heightened by what we've seen in recent days on the ground in Iraq.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"When you were vice president, President Obama turned to you to bring the troops home from Iraq.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"You have said on the campaign trail, quote, \"\"I made sure the president turned to me and said, Joe, get our combat troops out of Iraq.\"\"\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"There was a major drawdown of U.S. troops, and then ISIS seized by some estimates 40 percent of the territory in Iraq.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: You then had to send thousands of troops back in.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Was it wrong to pull out of Iraq that quickly?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And did the move actually help ISIS take hold?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"No, it wasn't wrong to pull out.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: But I want to answer your Afghanistan question.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I've been in and out of Afghanistan, not with a gun, and I admire my friend for his service.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"But I've been out of Afghanistan I think more than anybody on this  and it's an open secret, you reported a long time ago, George, that I was opposed to the surge in Afghanistan.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"The whole purpose of going to Afghanistan was to not have a counterinsurgency, meaning that we're going to put that country together.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It cannot be put together.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Let me say it again.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It will not be put together.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It's three different countries.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Pakistan owns the three counties  the three provinces in the east.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: They're not any part of  the Haqqanis run it.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I will go on and on.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: But here's the point.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: The point is that it's a counterterrorism strategy.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We can prevent the United States from being the victim of terror coming out of Afghanistan by providing for bases  insist the Pakistanis provide bases for us to air lift from and to move against what we know.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We don't need those troops there.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I would bring them home.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And Joe Dunford's a fine guy, but this has been an internal argument we've had for eight years.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"With regard to  with regard to Iraq, the fact of the matter is that, you know, I should have never voted to give Bush the authority to go in and do what he said he was going to do.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"The AUMF was designed, he said, to go in and get the Security Council to vote 15-0 to allow inspectors to go in to determine whether or not anything was being done with chemical weapons or nuclear weapons.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And when that happened, he went ahead and went anyway without any of that proof.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I said something that was not meant the way I said it.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I said  from that point on  what I was argued against in the beginning, once he started to put the troops in, was that in fact we were doing it the wrong way; there was no plan; we should not be engaged; we didn't have the people with us; we didn't have our  we didn't have allies with us, et cetera.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And it was later, when we came into office, that Barack turned  the president turned to me and said, \"\"Joe\"\"  when they said we've got a plan to get out, he turned to the whole security and said, \"\"Joe will organize this.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Get the troops home.\"\"\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"My son spent a year in Iraq, and I understand.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It made  and we were right to get the combat troops out.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"The big mistake that was made, which we predicted, was that you would not have a circumstance where the Shia and the Kurds would work together to keep ISIS from coming  from moving in.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Mr. Vice President, thank you.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"What do you make of people out there who are worried that if we pull out U.S. troops too quickly from Afghanistan, it will create safe haven all over again, like the plotters of 9/11?\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"David, let me answer that, but let me just comment on something that the vice president said.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: You talked about the big mistake in Iraq and the surge.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"The truth is, the big mistake, the huge mistake, and one of the big differences between you and me, I never believed what Cheney and Bush said about Iraq...\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: You're right.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I voted against the war in Iraq\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: ... and helped lead the opposition.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And it's sad to say  I mean, I, kind of, you know, had the feeling that there would be massive destabilization in that area if we went into that war.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"As the former chairman of the Senate Committee on Veterans Affairs, I want to pick up on what Pete said.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"We cannot express our gratitude to all of the men and women who have put their lives on the line to defend them  defend us, who have responded to the call of duty.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"But I think, also, I am the only person up here to have voted against all three of Trump's military budgets.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I don't think we have to spend $750 billion a year on the military when we don't even know who our enemy is.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I think that what we have got to do is bring this world together  bring it together on climate change, bring it together in fighting against terrorism.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And make it clear that we as a planet, as a global community, will work together to help countries around the world rebuild their struggling economies and do everything that we can to rid the world of terrorism.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: But dropping bomb on Afghanistan and Iraq was not the way to do it.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Senator Sanders, thank you.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I want to take this to Mr. Yang.\r

text: \"You share the stage, as you know, when when we talk about troops in Iraq and Afghanistan, with the vice president, who was in the Situation Room, with senators who were on the Senate Armed Services, the Foreign Relations Committees, with an Afghanistan veteran who is on the stage tonight.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"As you share the stage with these candidates, what makes you the most qualified on this stage to be commander in chief?\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I've signed a pledge to end the forever wars.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"We've been in a state of continuous armed conflict for 18 years, which is not what the American people want.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We have to start owning what we can and can't do.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We're not very good at rebuilding countries.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And if you want proof, all you have to do is look within our own country of Puerto Rico.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"We've spent trillions of dollars to unclear benefits, lost thousands of lives  and thank you, Pete, for your service.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And the goal has to be to rebuild the relationships that have made America strong for decades.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I would lead our armed forces with restraint and judgment.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: What the American people want is simply a president who has the right values and point of view and they can trust to make the right decisions when it comes to putting our young men and women into harm's way.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And that's what I would do as president.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Mr. Yang, thank you.\"\r

text: Jorge?\r

text: Thank you very much.\r
