text: \"You haven't been asked about Latin America in the previous debates, so let's begin.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Senator Sanders, one country where many immigrants are arriving from is Venezuela.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"A recent U.N. fact-finding mission found that thousands have been disappeared, tortured and killed by government forces in Venezuela.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"You admit that Venezuela does not have free elections, but still you refuse to call Nicolas Maduro a dictator  a dictator.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Can you explain why?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And what are the main differences between your kind of socialism and the one being imposed in Venezuela, Cuba and Nicaragua?\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Well, first of all, let me be very clear.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Anybody who does what Maduro does is a vicious tyrant.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: What we need now is international and regional cooperation for free elections in Venezuela so that the people of that country can make  can create their own future.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"In terms of democratic socialism, to equate what goes on in Venezuela with what I believe is extremely unfair.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I'll tell you what I believe in terms of democratic socialism.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I agree with goes on in Canada and in Scandinavia, guaranteeing health care to all people as a human right.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I believe that the United States should not be the only major country on earth not to provide paid family and medical leave.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I believe that every worker in this country deserves a living wage and that we expand the trade union movement.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I happen to believe also that what, to me, democratic socialism means, is we deal with an issue we do not discuss enough, Jorge  it's not in the media and not in Congress.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: You've got three people in America owning more wealth than the bottom half of this country.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"You've got a handful of billionaires controlling what goes on in Wall Street, the insurance companies and in the media.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Maybe, just maybe, what we should be doing is creating an economy...\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Thank you.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"... that works for all of us, not 1 percent.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: That's my understanding of democratic socialism.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Secretary, you wanted to say a quick response  45 seconds?\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Sure, thank you, Jorge.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I'll call Maduro a dictator, because he is a dictator.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And what we need to do is to, along with our allies, make sure that the Venezuelan people get the assistance that they need, that we continue to pressure Venezuela so that they'll have free and fair elections, and also, here in the United States, offer temporary protected status, TPS, to Venezuelans.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: That is something that the Trump administration has failed to do.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"For all of his big talk about supporting the Venezuelan-American community, he has failed.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I will not.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I also believe that we need to do things like a 21st century Marshall plan for Honduras, El Salvador and Guatemala...\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: ... so that people can find safety and opportunity at home instead of having to make the dangerous journey to the United States.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And under my administration, we're going to put renewed focus on Latin America.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It makes sense.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: They're our neighbors and we have a lot of things in common.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"It also makes sense that, because we have a country like China that is going around the world to places like Africa and Latin America, making their own relationships, strengthening those, the United States needs to strengthen its partnerships in Latin America immediately.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Thank you, Senator.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And I will\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Senator Booker, let me ask you about Brazil.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"After the recent fires in the Amazon, some experts suggested that eating less meat is one way to help the environment.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: You are a vegan since 2014.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"That's obviously a personal choice, but President Trump and Brazil's President Bolsonaro are concerned that climate change regulations could affect economic growth.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"So should more Americans, including those here in Texas, and in Iowa...\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: ... follow your diet?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Um, you know, first of all, I want to say no.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Actually, I want to translate that into Spanish.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: No.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Look, on  let's just be clear.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"The factory farming going on that's assaulting this corporate consolidation of the agricultural industry, one of the reasons why I have a bill to put a moratorium on this kind of corporate consolidation is because this factory farming is destroying and hurting our environment.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And you see independent family farmers being pushed out of business because of the kind of incentives we are giving that don't line up with our values.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: That's what I'm calling for.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"But I want to  I want to switch, because we don't have  a crowded debate stage, we were talking about Afghanistan and Iraq.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It annoys me that we had a conversation about our troops overseas and we didn't say one word about veterans in our country.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"We have a shameful reality in America that we send people off to war and they often come home with invisible wounds, hurts and harms.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: They're disproportionately homeless.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: You hear stories about women waiting for months for gynecological care through the VA.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"It is very important that, as we  as a country, understand that we are not going to solve every problem with this outrageous increased militarism, that we also make sure that we stand up for the people that stood for us.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"We end our national anthem with \"\"home of the brave.\"\"\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It's about time we make this a better home for our bravest.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Congressman O'Rourke, Hurricane Harvey hit this town two years ago.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And not only is the Amazon burning, Greenland is melting at a record pace.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: The last five years have been the hottest ever recorded.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And we have a viewer's question about this.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: What meaningful action will you take to reverse the effect of climate change?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And can we count on you to follow through if your donors are against it?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Yes, we will follow through, regardless of the political consequences or who it offends, because this is the very future of our planet and our ability for our children and grandchildren to be able to survive on it.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We will make sure that we get to net zero greenhouse gas emissions no later than the year 2050.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: That we are halfway there by 2030.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: That we mobilize $5 trillion over the next 10 years to do that.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"That we invest here in Houston, Texas, with pre-disaster mitigation grants to protect those communities that are vulnerable to flooding given the fact that this town has seen three 500-year floods in just five years, you'd like to think you're good for 1,500 years, but you're not.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: They're coming faster and larger and more devastating than ever.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"We're also going to make sure that we free ourselves from a dependence on fossil fuels and embrace renewable wind and solar energy technology, as well as the high-paying, high-skill, high-wage jobs that come along with that.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And that we're going to pay farmers for the environmental services they want to provide.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Planting cover crops, keeping more land under conservation, using no-till farming, regenerative agriculture can pull carbon out of the air and can drive it and sequester it into the soil.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: That's the way that we're going to meet this challenge and we're going to bring everyone into the solution.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"It's  you know that movie \"\"The Day after Tomorrow\"\"?\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We have seen a warming in our world like never before.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"We're seeing flooding in the Midwest, flooding in Houston, fires in the West.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And I think having someone leading the ticket from the Midwest will allow us to talk about this in a different way and get it done.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"On day one, I will get us back into the international climate change agreement.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"On day two, I will bring back the clean power rules that President Obama had worked on.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"On day three, I will bring back the gas mileage standards.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"You can do all that without Congress, which is good.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"On day four, five, and six I will, working with Congress and mayors and business people all over the country, introduce sweeping legislation to get at that 2050 goal.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And on day seven, you're supposed to rest, but I won't.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: This is what we need to do if we're going to get at climate change.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We have to take this on as a crisis that's happening right now.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Senator Warren, should American foreign policy be based around the principle of climate change?\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Yes.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We need to work on every front on climate change.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It is the threat to every living thing on this planet and we are running out of time.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Every time the scientists go back, they say, we have less and less time than we thought we had.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: But that means we've got to use all the tools.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: One of the tools we need to use are our regulatory tools.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I have proposed following Governor Inslee, that we, by 2028, cut all carbon emissions from new buildings.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"By 2030, carbon emissions from cars.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And by 2035, all carbon emissions from the manufacture of electricity.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"That alone, those three, will cut our emissions here in the United States by 70 percent.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We can do this.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"We also need to help around the world to clean, but understand this one more time.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Why doesn't it happen?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"As long as Washington is paying more attention to money than it is to our future, we can't make the changes we need to make.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We have to attack the corruption head-on so that we can save our planet.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Sen. Harris, 45 seconds.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"When I think about this issue, it really is through the lens of my baby nieces who are one-and-a-half and 3 years old.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"When I look at what is going to be the world if we do nothing, when they turn 20, I am really scared.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And when I've been in the United States Senate for now the last two-and-a-half years and I look at our counterparts, the Republicans in the United States Senate, they must be looking at their children and then when they look at the mirror, I don't know what they see, but it's a lack of courage.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And this is an issue that, yes, it represents a existential threat.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It is also something that we can do something about.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: This is a problem that was created by human behaviors.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And we can change our behaviors in a way that saves our planet.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I've seen it happen in California.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I took on  as the attorney general of California, I ran the second-largest department of justice in the United States, second only to the United States Department of Justice.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I took on the big oil companies and we saw progress.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"If any of you have been to Los Angeles, 20 years ago, you'll remember, that sky was brown.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"You go there now, the sky is blue and you know why?\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Because leaders decided to lead and we took on these big fossil fuel companies.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We have some of the most important and strongest laws in the country and we made a difference.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And my point being, I've done it before and I will lead as president on this issue because we have no time, the clock is ticking, but we need courage, and we need courageous leadership.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We can get this done.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Mr. Yang?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"So, to follow up on what Elizabeth said, why are we losing to the fossil fuel companies?\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Yes.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Why are we losing to the gun lobby and the NRA?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And is answer is this, we all know, everyone on this stage knows that our government has been overrun by money and corporate interests.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Now, everyone here has a plan to try to curb those corporate interests, but we have to face facts.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Money finds a way.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Money will find its way back in.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"So, what is the answer?\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: The answer is to wash the money out with people-powered money.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"My proposal is that we give every American 100 \"\"Democracy Dollars\"\" that you can only give to candidates and causes that you like.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: This would wash out the lobbyist cash by a factor of eight to one.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: That is the only way we will win.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Number two, you talk about the need to do something in Latin America.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And as someone running for president, I'll tell you, there's the people on one side and the money on the other, the only way for us to win is if we bring them together.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Thank you, Mr. Yang.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Linsey.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I'd like to have an academic discussion now about education.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Mr. Yang, we'll stay with you.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Here in Houston, the school district is facing yet another year of spending cuts.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Like schools across the country, the system faces many challenges.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"One of them, thousands of students are leaving traditional public schools and going to charter schools.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: You're the most vocal proponent on this stage for charter schools.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"You have said that Democrats who want to limit them are, quote, \"\"just jumping into bed with teachers unions and doing kids a disservice.\"\"\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Why isn't taxpayer money better spent on fixing traditional public schools?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Let me be clear, I am pro-good school.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I've got a kid, one of my little boys just started public school last week and I was not there because I was running for president.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"So, we need to pay teachers more, because the data clearly shows that a good teacher is worth his or her weight in gold.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"We need to lighten up the emphasis on standardized tests, which do not measure anything fundamental about our character or human worth.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: But here's the big one.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: The data clearly shows that 65 to 70 percent of our students outcomes are determined outside of the school.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"We're talking about time spent at home with the parents, words read to them when they're young, stress levels in the house, income, type of neighborhood.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"We're putting money into schools, and educators know this, we're saying you're 100 percent responsible for educating your kids but you can only control 30 percent.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: They all know this.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: The answer is to put money directly into the families and neighborhoods to give our kids a chance to learn and our teachers a chance to teach.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Mayor Buttigieg, 45 seconds to respond.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Step one is appoint a secretary of education who actually believes in public education.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I believe in public education.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And in order to strengthen it, some things are very complex, for preparing for a future where knowledge is at your fingertips, but we have got to teach more to do with critical thinking and social and emotional learning.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Some of it is extremely simple, we have just got to pay teachers more.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And we have got to lift up the teaching profession.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I always think of a story from South Bend of friends who hosted exchange students from Japan.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: They had a student one year who wanted to be a teacher.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And they kept in touch with her when she went back to Japan and to college.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: She took the exam to try to become a teacher in a society that really regards teachers and compensates teachers well.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And she came up just short.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"So, you know what she did?\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Since she was academically good but couldn't quite make the cut to be a teacher, she had a fall-back plan, she became a doctor.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: That is how seriously some countries treat the teaching profession.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"If we want to get the results that we expect for our children, we have to support and compensate the teaching profession.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Respect teachers the way we do soldiers and pay them more like the way we do doctors.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Sen. Warren, to use Mr. Yang's term, are you just jumping into bed with teachers unions?\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"You know, I think I'm the only person on this stage who has been a public school teacher.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I had wanted to be a public school teacher since I was in second grade.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And let's be clear in all the ways we talk about this, money for public schools should stay in public schools, not go anywhere else.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I've already made my commitment.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I will  we will have a secretary of education who has been a public school teacher.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I think this is ultimately about our values.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I have proposed a two-cent wealth tax on the top one-tenth of one percent in this country.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"That would give us enough money to start with our babies by providing universal child care for every baby age zero to five, universal pre-K for every three-year-old and four-year-old in this country...\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Thank you, Senator.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"... raise the wages of every child-care worker and preschool teacher in this country, cancel student loan debt for 95 percent of the folks who've got it...\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Thank you, Senator.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: ... and strengthen our unions.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"This is how we build an America that reflects our values, not just where the money comes from with the billionaires and corporate executives.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Sen. Harris, 45 seconds to respond.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"My first-grade teacher, Mrs. Frances Wilson, God rest her soul, attended my law school graduation.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I think most of us would say that we are not where we are without the teachers who believed in us.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I have offered in this campaign a proposal to deal with this, which will be the first in the nation, federal investment, in closing the teacher pay gap, which is $13,500 a year.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Because right now, in our public schools, our teachers, 94 percent of them are coming out of their own pocket to help pay for school supplies.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And that is wrong.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I also want to talk about where we are here at TSU, and what it means in terms of HBCUs.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I have, as part of my proposal that we will put $2 trillion into investing in our HBCUs for teachers, because...\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Because  because, one, as a proud graduate of a historically black college and university, I will say  I will say that it is our HBCUs that disproportionately produce teachers and those who serve in these may professions, but also...\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Thank you, Senator.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"But this is a critical point, if a black child has a black teacher before the end of third grade, they're 13 percent more likely to go to college.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"If that child has had two black teachers before the end of third grade, they're 32 percent more likely to go to college.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"So, when we talk about investing in our public education system, it is at the source of so much.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"When we fix it, that will fix so many other things.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We must invest in the potential of our children...\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Thank you, Senator.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Sen. Sanders, 45 seconds.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: ... and I strongly believe you can judge a society based on how it treats its children.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And we are failing on this issue.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Thank you, Senator.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Guess what?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"You're guessing, all right, here's the answer.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We are the wealthiest country in the history of the world.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And yet, we have the highest child poverty rate of almost any country on earth.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We have teachers in this country who are leaving education because they can't work two or three jobs to support themselves.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Which is why, under my legislation, we'll move to see that every teacher in America makings at least $60,000 a year.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"What we will also do is not only have universal pre-K, we will make public colleges and universities and HBCUs debt-free.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And what we will always also do, because this is an incredible burden on millions and millions of young people who did nothing wrong except try to get the education they need, we are going to cancel all student debt in this country.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Thank you, Senator.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Thank you, Senator.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And we are going to do that by imposing a tax on Wall Street speculation.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Thank you, Senator.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Mr. Vice president, I want to come to you and talk to you about inequality in schools and race.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"In a conversation about how to deal with segregation in schools back in 1975, you told a reporter, \"\"I don't feel responsible for the sins of my father and grandfather, I feel responsible for what the situation is today, for the sins of my own generation, and I'll be damned if I feel responsible to pay for what happened 300 years ago.\"\"\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: You said that some 40 years ago.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"But as you stand here tonight, what responsibility do you think that Americans need to take to repair the legacy of slavery in our country?\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Well, they have to deal with the  look, there's institutional segregation in this country.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And from the time I got involved, I started dealing with that.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Red-lining banks, making sure that we are in a position where  look, you talk about education.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I propose that what we take is those very poor schools, the Title I schools, triple the amount of money we spend from 15 to $45 billion a year.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Give every single teacher a raise, the equal raise to getting out  the $60,000 level.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Number two, make sure that we bring in to help the teachers deal with the problems that come from home.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"The problems that come from home, we need  we have one school psychologist for every 1,500 kids in America today.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It's crazy.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: The teachers are  I'm married to a teacher.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: My deceased wife is a teacher.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: They have every problem coming to them.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"We have  make sure that every single child does, in fact, have 3-, 4-, and 5-year-olds go to school.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: School.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Not daycare.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: School.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We bring social workers in to homes and parents to help them deal with how to raise their children.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It's not want they don't want to help.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: They don't  they don't know quite what to do.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Play the radio, make sure the television  excuse me, make sure you have the record player on at night, the  the  make sure that kids hear words.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: A kid coming from a very poor school  a very poor background will hear 4 million words fewer spoken by the time they get there.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Thank you, Mr. Vice President.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"There's so much we  no, I'm going to go like the rest of them do, twice over, okay?\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Because here's the deal.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: The deal is that we've got this a little backwards.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And by the way, in Venezuela, we should be allowing people to come here from Venezuela.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I know Maduro.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I've confronted Maduro.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I'm the guy that came up with $740 million to see to it those three countries, in fact, changed their system so people don't have to chance to leave.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: You're all acting like we just discovered this yesterday.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Thank you very much.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Secretary Castro?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Thank you very much.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Well, that's  that's quite a lot.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"But, you know  I grew up in one of those neighborhoods that folks have talked about and a neighborhood that was grappling with the legacy of segregation.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"In fact, in two public school districts that were involved in a 1973 Supreme Court case challenging how Texas financed its schools.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And I know that today our schools are segregated because our neighborhoods are segregated.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Now, I have an education plan, like a lot of folks up here, that would pay teachers more, that would recruit diverse ranks of teachers, that would invest in our public schools, but I also believe that we have to connect the dots to uplift the quality of life to invest in housing opportunity, to invest in job opportunity, to invest in community schools that offer resources like parents able to go back and get their GED, and health care opportunities, and those things that truly ensure that the entire family can prosper.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Those are the types of things that we need to do, in addition to lifting up our public schools.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: You asked a second ago about charter schools.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Look, it is a myth that charter schools are better than public schools.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: They're not.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Thank you, Secretary.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And so while I'm not categorically against charter schools, I would require more transparency and accountability from them than is required right now.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Senator Booker, coming to you now.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It was 65 years ago this year that the Supreme Court outlawed racial segregation in public schools.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Yet for millions of students of color today, segregation remains a reality.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Nonwhite districts typically receive $2,200 less per student than those in white districts.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"This means older books, less access to computers, and often worse outcomes.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: What is your plan to address segregation?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And I'm not just talking about the achievement gap, but I'm talking about the opportunity gap in education.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"So, I'm hearing a lot of conversations on the stage that  and the way we talk about communities of color.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Look, I live in a black and brown community below the poverty line.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I've lived in public housing projects almost for a decade and saw the anguish of parents who are just so deeply frustrated that they don't have a school that serves their genius.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I think I'm the only person on the stage  even though I had no formal authority as mayor to run a school system  I stepped up and took responsibility for our schools, and we produced results.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: A lot of folks here are talking about raising teacher salary.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"We actually did it in Newark, New Jersey.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And we didn't stop there.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Yeah, we closed poor-performing charter schools, but, dagnabbit, we expanded high-performing charter schools.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We were a city that said we need to find local solutions that work for our community.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: The results speak for themselves.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"We're now the number-one city in America for Beat the Odds schools, from high poverty to high performance.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Strategies like investing in our children work.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And I'll tell you this.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I am tired of us thinking about these problems isolated, disconnected from other issues.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"That's why my friend, Secretary Castro, is 100 percent right.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"We are in the reality we are right now because, Mr. Vice President, of overtly racist policies, not 400 years ago, just in my lifetime, that were red-lining communities, disinvesting in communities, and more than just that, my kids are not only struggling with racial segregation and housing and the challenges of underfunded schools, but they're also struggling with environmental injustice.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"If you've talked to someone who's a parent of a child has had permanent brain damage because of lead, you'll know this is a national problem, because there's over 3,000 jurisdictions in America where children have more than twice the blood lead levels of Flint, Michigan.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Thank you, Senator.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And so if I'm president of the United States, it is a holistic solution to education, from raising teacher salary, fully funded special education, but combating the issues of poverty, combating the issues of racial segregation, combating the issues of a criminal justice system...\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Thank you, Senator.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"... that takes parents away from their kids, and dealing with environmental justice as a major pillar of any climate policy.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Thank you, Linsey.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: One final question coming up.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We'll be right back.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And we are now back now for a final round of questions.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: One question for each candidate.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We're going to go in reverse order from the opening statement.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And, candidates, the question is on the quality of resilience.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: No president can succeed without resilience.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Every president confronts crises, defeats, and mistakes.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"So I want to ask each of you, what's the most significant professional setback you've had to face?\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: How did you recover from it?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And what did you learn from it?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Vice President Biden?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I  I never counted any professional setback like I have as a serious setback.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: There's things that are important.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Things that are unimportant.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We're going to clear the protesters now.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Just one minute.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Senator Biden, we'll start the clock again.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I'm sorry.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We're sorry.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Go ahead.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"There's setbacks, and there's setbacks.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And I think the most critical setback that can occur to anyone is to lose  well, my dad had an expression.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"He said, Joey, it's not a question of succeeding, whether you get knocked down, it's how quickly you get up.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And he said, you never explain and never complain.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And then he would go on to say that the only obligation that really matters, the most important thing, is family.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And so I was raised to believe that that was the center of everything, family, and could be judged on based how you treatment your family and how you went from there.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And I  it took  you know, Kierkegaard said faith sees best in the dark.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Right after I got elected, my wife and daughter were killed in an automobile accident, and my two sons were badly injured.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And I just had been elected, not sworn in.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And I lost my faith for a while.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I came back.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And then later, when my son Beau came home from Iraq and  with a terminal disease, and a year later, year-and-a-half later, losing him was like losing part of my soul.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"But the fact is that I learned that the way you deal with it is you deal with finding purpose, purpose in what you do.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And that's why I hope  I hope he's proud of me today, because he wanted to make sure I didn't run for president, but I stayed engaged, because when you get hit badly, whether you're losing a job or you're raising a family like my dad, where you have to make that longest walk up the stairs to tell your kid you can't live here anymore, Dad lost his job, you know, we've all been through that, in some form or another.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And it just takes  it just  for me, the way I've dealt with it is finding purpose.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And my purpose is to do what I've always tried to do and stay engaged in public policy.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And  but there's a lot of people been through a lot worse than I have who get up every single morning, put their feet one foot in front of another, without the help I had.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: There are real heroes out there.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Some real heroes.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Thank you, Mr. Vice President.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Senator Warren?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I mentioned earlier, I've known what I wanted to be since second grade.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I wanted to be a public school teacher.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And I invested early.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I used to line my dollies up and teach school.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I had a reputation for being tough but fair.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"By the time I graduated from high school, my family didn't have money for a college application, much less to send me off to four years at a university.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And my story, like a lot of stories, has a lot of twists and turns.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Got a scholarship, and then at 19, I got married, dropped out of school, took a minimum wage job, thought my dream was over.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I got a chance down the road at the University of Houston.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And I made it as a special needs teacher.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I still remember that first year as a special needs teacher.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I could tell you what those babies looked like.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I had 4- to 6-year-olds.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"But at the end of that first year, I was visibly pregnant.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And back in the day, that meant that the principal said to me  wished me luck and hired someone else for the job.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"So, there I am, I'm at home, I got a baby, I can't have a job.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: What am I going to do?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Here's resilience.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I said, I'll go to law school.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And the consequence was  I practiced law for about 45 minutes and then went back to my first love, which was teaching.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: But it let me get into fights.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It gave me new tools.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And the reason I'm standing here today is because I got back up, I fought back.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I know what's broken.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I want to be in the fight to fix it in America.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: That's why I'm here.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Thank you, Senator.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Senator Sanders?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Resilience, to me, means growing up in a rent-controlled apartment in Brooklyn, New York, the son of an immigrant who came to this country without a nickel in his pocket.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Professional resilience means to me, George, running for U.S. Senate in Vermont and getting 1 percent of the vote, running for governor and getting 2 percent of the vote, finally becoming mayor of Burlington, Vermont, with a 10-vote margin.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"What resilience means to me is that throughout my political career, I have taken on virtually every powerful special interest in this country, whether it is Wall Street, whether it is the insurance industry, whether it is the pharmaceutical industry whose corruption and greed is killing people today, whether it is a military industrial complex or a prison industrial complex.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And I feel confident that given a lifelong record of taking on powerful special interests, of standing up for the working families of this country, that I will be able to take on the greed and corruption of the corporate elite and create a government and an economy that work for all of us, not just the 1 percent.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Thank you, Senator Sanders.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Senator Harris?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"You know, every office I've run for, whether it be district attorney or attorney general, I was told each time, it can't be done.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"They said nobody like you has done it before, nobody's ready for you.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"When I ran for D.A., I won and became the first black woman elected D.A.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"in a state of 40 million people, in San Francisco.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"When I ran for attorney general of California, I was elected  because I didn't listen.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And I was the only black elected  woman black elected attorney general in the state  in the country.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And each time, people would say, it's not your time, it's not your turn, it's going to be too difficult, they're not ready for you, and I didn't listen.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And a part of it probably comes from the fact that I was raised by a mother who said many things that were life lessons for me, including don't you let anybody ever tell you who you are.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: You tell them who you are.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And when I look around the town halls that we do in this race for president of the United States, and I look at the  the meetings that we do and the community meetings, and I see these little girls and boys, sometimes even brought by their fathers, and they bring them to me and I talk to them during these events, and they smile and they're full of joy, and their fathers tell them, see, don't you ever listen and let anybody ever tell you what you can or cannot be.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: You have to believe in what can be unburdened by what has been.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Senator Harris, thank you very much.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Mayor Buttigieg?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"You know, as a military officer serving under \"\"don't ask/don't tell,\"\" and as an elected official in the state of Indiana when Mike Pence was governor, at a certain point, when it came to professional setbacks, I had to wonder whether just acknowledging who I was, was going to be the ultimate career-ending professional setback.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I came back from the deployment and realized that you only get to live one life.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And I was not interested in not knowing what it was like to be in love any longer, so I just came out.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I had no idea what kind of professional setback it would be, especially because inconveniently it was an election year in my socially conservative community.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"What happened was that, when I trusted voters to judge me based on the job that I did for them, they decided to trust me and re-elected me with 80 percent of the vote.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And what I learned was that trust can be reciprocated and that part of how you can win and deserve to win is to know what's worth more to you than winning.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And I think that's what we need in the presidency right now.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We have to know what we are about.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And this election is not about any of us up here.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"It is not about this president, even though it's hard to talk of anything else some days.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: The very thing that drew that killer to us is the very thing that helps us set the example for the rest of this country.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"It's about the people who trust us with their lives, a kid wondering if we're actually going to make their schools safe when they've learned active shooter drills before they've learned to read, a generation wondering we will actually get the job done on climate change.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And if we hold to that, then it doesn't matter what happens to each of us professionally.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Together, we will win a better era for our country.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Mayor Buttigieg, thank you.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Mr. Yang?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I was an unhappy lawyer for five whole months and I left to start a business.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And I'm going to share with you all one of the secrets to entrepreneurship.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"If you want to start something, tell everyone you know you're going to do it.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And then you don't have a choice.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: You put your heart and soul into that.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And even though I did that, my company flopped, had its mini-rise and maximum fall.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I lost investors, hundreds of thousands of dollars, still owed $100,000 in school debt.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: My parents still told people I was a lawyer.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It was a little easier.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"So I remember lying on my floor looking up wondering, how did it come to this?\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Eventually, I picked myself back up.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I kept working in small growth companies for another 10 years and eventually had some success.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Then after I did have some success, I still remembered how hard it was, how isolating it was, how it feels like your friends no longer want to spend time with you.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And that made me interested in public service, because I feel like everyone should have that same right, to be pursued by grace.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I then got married.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And so I spent seven years starting and running a nonprofit that helped train young entrepreneurs around the country, including Sean Nguyen, who's here in the audience tonight, who left his gilded Wall Street job to become a food entrepreneur in San Antonio.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Sean, I hope I made the process a little bit easier for you than it was for me.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: But the goal of my campaign is to make this an economy that allows us to live our human values and aspirations.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Thank you, Mr. Yang.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Senator Booker?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: So my biggest professional setback is embarrassing because a lot of folks know about it.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I, with a bunch of tenant leaders in Newark, New Jersey, in 2002 took on the political machine and, boy, did they fight back.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I had tires on my car slashed.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Our campaign offices were broken into.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: My phones were tapped.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It became a spectacle.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And we lost that election.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And here's a bit of advice to everybody.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"If you're going to have a spectacular failure, have a documentary team there to capture it, because it made for an Oscar-nominated documentary called \"\"Street Fight.\"\"\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"But then, unfortunately, another setback.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"It lost in the Oscars to a movie called \"\"March of the Dagnab Penguins,\"\" for crying out loud.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"The people in my community, living in the projects, told me, don't give up on the people and the people won't give up on you.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Create bigger and bolder coalitions, and you're going to win.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And you know what?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We came back four years later and won the largest lopsided victory in our city's history.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"But more than that, the lesson was there.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We didn't give up.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"We were taking on America's toughest problems, from crime to poverty, and we transformed our city, creating tens of thousands of new jobs, the biggest economic expansion in our city, and as I said before, turned around our school system.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"There's more work to do, but I haven't given up on the people.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I still live in that community.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: But this is a big lesson.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"My staff and my friends and my community told me, if you want to go fast, you may have won the mayor's race, but that's not what life is about.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"There's an old African saying that says, if you want to go fast, go alone.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"But if you want to go far, go together.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"The lesson I learned of resilience is to trust people, because the power of the people is always greater than the people in power.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And the test of America right now is not a referendum on Donald Trump, it's a referendum on us and who we are and who we're going to be together.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"We need to use this moment in history to unite in common cause and common purpose, and then there's nothing we can't do together as a nation.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Senator Booker, thank you.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Congressman O'Rourke?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Thank you, George.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Everything that I've learned about resilience I've learned from my hometown of El Paso, Texas.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"In the face of this act of terror that was directed at our community, in large part by the president of the United States, that killed 22 people and injured many more, we were not defeated by that, nor were we defined by that.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: We don't see our differences as disqualifying or dangerous.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"We see them as foundational to our success, to our strength, and to our security, and to our safety.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Yesterday, I was visiting with one of those victims.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: He's the head coach of the Fusion.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: This is a girls soccer team of 10- and 11-year-old girls.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: His name is Luis.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: He was shot in the legs multiple times.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: He was shot in the side multiple times.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"He's still healing from his wounds in the hospital, but from his hospital bed, he's still trying to coach the Fusion girls soccer team.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Memo, his co-coach, is still fighting for his life right now at Del Sol Hospital.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Those two men, Jessica and Marcella, their wives, they exemplify resilience to me.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And when we end this scourge of gun violence in this country, when we finally confront the racism that exists in America, when we're defined not by our fears, but instead by our aspirations and our ambitions, it will be, in large part, I think, thanks to the example that El Paso has set.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Congressman, thank you.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Senator Klobuchar?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Thank you.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: My challenges and resilience have brought me up here.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I grew up with a dad who struggled with alcoholism his whole life.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And after his third DWI, he had a choice between jail and treatment.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"He chose treatment, with his faith, with his friends, with our family.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And in his words, he was pursued by grace.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"My husband's out there somewhere, hopefully smiling, and our daughter.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"When our daughter was born, I had this expectation, we're going to have this perfect, perfect birth, and she was really sick, and she couldn't swallow.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And she was in and out of hospitals for a year-and-a-half.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"But when she was born, they had a rule in place that you got kicked out of the hospital in 24 hours.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"She was in intensive care, and I was kicked out.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And I thought, this could never happen to any other mom again.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"So I went to the legislature, our state legislator, not an elected official, a mom, and I advocated for one of the first laws in the country guaranteeing new moms and their babies a 48-hour hospital stay.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And when they tried to delay the implementation of that law, I brought six pregnant friends to the conference committee so they outnumbered the lobbyists 2 to 1.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And when they said, when should it take place, they all raised their hands and said now.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: That is what motivated me to go into public service.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And when I got to that gridlock of Washington, D.C., I got to work and pass over 100 bills, and I know a lot of my friends here from the left, but remember, I am from the middle of the country.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And I believe, if we're going to get things done, that we have to have someone leading the ticket with grit, someone who's going to not just change the policies, but change the tone in the country, and someone who believes in America and believes it from their heart because of where they came from, that everyone should have that same opportunity.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Senator, thank you.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Secretary Castro?\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And thank you, George, to Jorge, to Linsey, and to David, and to all of y'all for tuning in tonight.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"In many ways, I shouldn't be here on this stage.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"You know, Castro is my mother's name and was my grandmother's name before her.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I grew up in a single-parent household on the west side of San Antonio, going to the public schools.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Eventually, my brother, Joaquin, and I became the first in our family to become professionals.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And when I got home, I took a job at the biggest law firm in town.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I was making $100,000 a year in the year 2000.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"A few months later, I got elected to the San Antonio City Council.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And the city council at the time was only paying $1,040 a year, so everybody had another job.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And my job was at the law firm.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Well, a few months after I got elected, the law firm got a client and the client wanted those of us on the city council to vote for a land deal.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"The land deal was that they wanted to build a golf course over our water supply, because we relied on an underground aquifer.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I didn't think the environmental protection plan was strong enough, so I wanted to vote against it and my constituents wanted me to vote against it.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"But under the ethics rules for lawyers in Texas  because believe it or not, lawyers have ethics rules  you can't just go against the interest of a client.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: So I was stuck.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"On the one hand, I wanted to do the right thing.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"On the other hand, my livelihood, my student loans, my new house payment, my car payment, depended on me shutting up, being conflicted out.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"So, one day, I walked into my law firm and I quit my job.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: And then I went and I voted against that land deal on the city council.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And, you know, it was the first test that I had, and I think back to that, because oftentimes we think of politics and you think of politics as dirty or corrupting.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"I wondered, before I went in it, whether it was change who I was.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And I was proud that when that first test came that I stood up for the people that I was there to represent, and not for big special interests.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: There's nobody that gets tested more in a position of public trust than the president of the United States.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: This president has failed that test.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"But I want you to know that if you elect me president, I won't.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I won't serve anybody except you and your family.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"And together, we can create an American that's better than ever.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Thank you very much.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: \"Thank you, Secretary Castro.\"\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Thank you to all of our candidates.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: It was a great debate.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: I think we learned a lot tonight thanks to you.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Thanks to Texas Southern University for hosting us tonight.\r
title: 2nd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate (B)

text: Congressman Ryan, President Trump's tariffs have boosted the U.S. steel industry but hurt auto manufacturers like those here in Michigan, which could drive up the cost of cars.

text: As president, would you continue President Trump's steel tariffs?
title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Look, I think President Trump was onto something when he talked about China.
title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: China has been abusing the economic system for a long time.
title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They steal intellectual property.
title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They subsidize goods coming into this country.
title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They've displaced steel workers, auto workers, across the board, eroded our manufacturing.
title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And we basically transferred our wealth of our middle class either up to the top 1 percent or to China for them to build their military.
title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So I think we need some targeted response against China.
title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But you know how you beat China?
title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You out-compete 'em.
title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And that's why I'd put a chief manufacturing officer in place to make sure that we rebuild the manufacturing base.
title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We've got to fill these factories that -- in Detroit, in Youngstown, that used to make cars and steel.
title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: As I said earlier, China dominates 60 percent of the solar panel market.
title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They dominate 50 percent to 60 percent of the electric vehicle market.
title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We're going to make 10 million electric vehicle somewhere in the world in the next 10 years.
title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I want them made in the United States.
title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's why I have a chief manufacturing officer that will sit in the White House and help drive this agenda.
title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Congressman, thank you.
title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Just as a point of clarification, as president, would you consider President Trump's steel tariffs, yes or no?
title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Well, I would have to re-evaluate.

text: I think some of them are effective.
title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But he's bungled the whole thing, obviously.
title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: He has -- see, here's the problem with President Trump.
title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: He has a tactical move -- one of many -- he has a tactical move.

text: What's the grand strategy for the United States?
title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: China has 100-year plan, a 50-year plan, a 30-year plan, a 20-year plan.

text: We live in a 24-hour news cycle.
title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That spells disaster for our economy and disaster for our global politics.

text: Thank you, Congressman.

text: Congressman Delaney, your response?

text: So, listen.

text: This is what I don't understand.

text: President Trump wants to build physical walls and beats up on immigrants.

text: I'm the only one running for president who actually supports the Trans-Pacific Partnership.
title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: President Obama was right about that.

text: We should be getting back in that.

text: Senator Warren just issued a trade plan...

text: You bet I did.

text: ... that would prevent the United States from trading with its allies.
