text: We can't go and -- we can't isolate ourselves from the world.

text: We have to engage...

text: Thank you.
title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: ... with fair, rules-based trade.

text: Thank you, Congressman Delaney.

text: Senator Warren, please respond.

text: You know, for decades, we have had a trade policy that has been written by giant multi-national corporations to help giant multi-national corporations.

text: They have no loyalty to America.

text: They have no patriotism.

text: If they can save a nickel by moving a job to Mexico, they'll do it in a heartbeat.

text: If they can continue a polluting plant by moving it to Vietnam, they'll do it in a heartbeat.

text: I have put out a new comprehensive plan that says we're not going to do it that way.

text: ... is everyone wants to get to America's markets.

text: Thank you, Senator.
title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: No.

text: So the question is...

text: Senator, thank you.

text: Please abide by the rules.

text: ... how we need to raise our standards.

text: You know, the question was about tariffs.

text: And they're a huge mistake.

title: 3rd 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Congressman O'Rourke, thank you so much.

text: I'd like to respond to this.

text: Yeah, OK. You're looking, I believe, at the only member of Congress who not only voted against these disastrous trade agreements, NAFTA, PNTR with China, which cost us over 4 million jobs, but also helped lead the effort against these agreements.

text: Now, Elizabeth is absolutely right.

text: If anybody here thinks that corporate America gives one damn about the average American worker, you're mistaken.

text: If they can save five cents by going to China, Mexico, or Vietnam, or anyplace else, that's exactly what they will do.

text: Senator Sanders, thank you very much.

text: Governor Hickenlooper, your response?

text: And I've done well financially.

text: We can take these steps and have an approach that is actually fair.

title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Look, I -- this is a national crisis.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I don't want to get this into a back and forth in terms of our politics here.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I've laid out a plan, building on Obamacare, providing a public option of Medicare, it would cover everyone the same way.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This idea that this is his only answer is a mistake in notion.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But regardless of whether my plan was in place or his, this is a crisis.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is like we are being attacked from abroad.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is something that is of great consequence.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is like a war.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And in a war, you do whatever is needed to be done to take care of your people.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And what you do is you -- and I have proposed it, laid it out in detail -- everything that you need in terms of dealing with this crisis would be free.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It is paid for by the taxpayers generally.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Generally.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It has nothing to do with Bernie's Medicare for all.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And by the way...

text: Vice President Biden, thank you.

text: Let me just...
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: If I may, the vice president just mentioned war.

text: Would you deploy the U.S. military in an effort to contain the virus?

text: And if so, how?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Well, I think we use all of the tools that make sense.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And if using the National Guard, which is folks I think in New York state are already using the National Guard, that is something that has to be done.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is clearly, as the vice president indicated, a national emergency.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And what I worry about is not only how we respond aggressively to the virus, but also how we respond aggressively to the economic fallout of a global recession.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So right now, in Illinois and Ohio, if my memory is correct, the governor there has said they're closing down bars, they're closing down restaurants.

text: What happens to the workers who are there?

text: What happens to the millions of workers who may end up losing their jobs?

text: So what I think we have got to do right now is, if Trump can provide or the Fed can provide a trillion and a half to -- for liquidity for the banks, what we've got to say to every worker in America, you know what, don't panic.

text: You're not going to -- you'll be able to pay your mortgage, because you're going to get a check.

text: Senator...

text: Senator, we're going to talk about the economic -- oh, go ahead, Mr. Vice President.

text: Now.

text: They have the capacity to provide this surge, help that hospitals need, and that is needed across the nation.

text: I would make sure that they did exactly what they're prepared to do.

text: They've done it.

text: They did it in the Ebola crisis.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They've done it.

text: They have the capacity to build 500-bed hospitals and -- and tents that are completely safe and secure, and provide the help to get it done to anybody -- this overflow.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So it is a national emergency.

text: I would call out the military.

text: Well, the Ebola crisis is one thing.

text: This is, obviously, a pandemic, which is far more severe and impactful to this country.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And I think one of the things that we want to remember here is that we got a lot of elderly people in this country who are told stay home, don't leave your house.

text: Who's going to get food to them?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: How do we get food to them?

text: You got schools all over this country now being shut down.

text: OK?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: How are we going to make sure that the kids do well in this crisis, not become traumatized?

text: What do we do about the parents now who have to stay home with kids and can't go to work?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So I think what -- bottom line here is that, in this crisis, we have got to start paying attention to the most vulnerable.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That includes people who are in prison right now, people who are in homeless shelters right now.

text: What about the half-a-million people who are homeless tonight?

text: Who's going to respond to them?

text: Now, in 2008, when we had the Wall Street bailout, they did very well for the people on top.

text: They bailed out the crooks on Wall Street.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They forgot about the suffering of ordinary Americans.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This time around, let us learn that lesson.

text: Let us pay attention to the working families of this country...

text: Thank you, Senator.

text: ... and to the most vulnerable.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have -- we have learned that lesson.

text: And again, I lay out in detail what we should be doing now is we should be surging help to those places which are the most vulnerable.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And here's the deal, we're going to have to not only deal with the immediate crisis, economic crisis, which is the most critical now, to let people know their mortgage is going to be paid.

text: We have to go beyond that.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But not, not do what Trump wants to do.

text: He's -- for example, he came along and said, I've got a great idea, let's -- well, you're going to tell me...

text: Senator Sanders?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The Ebola crisis, in my view, exposes the dysfunctionality of the health care system and how poorly prepared we are despite how much money that we spend.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And the Ebola crisis is also, I think, exposing the cruelty and the unjustness of our economy today.

text: We have more income and wealth inequality in America today than any time in 100 years.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And what that means that in the midst of this crisis, you know, if you're a multimillionaire, no one is happy about this crisis, you're going to get through it.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You're going to get everything you need.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You're not worried about health care.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You're not worried about income coming in.

text: Half of our people are living paycheck to paycheck.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We've got people who are struggling working two or three jobs to put food on the table.

text: What is going to happen to them?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So the lesson to be learned is we have got to move aggressively right now to address the economic crisis as a result of Ebola -- as a result -- keep talking about Ebola, you've got Ebola in my head here right now.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: As a result of the virus here, the coronavirus, what we have got to do also is understand the fragility of the economy and how unjust and unfair it is that so few have so much and so many have so little.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: People are looking for results, not a revolution.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They want to deal with the results they need right now.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And we can to that by making sure that we make everybody whole who has been so badly hurt.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: In terms of their -- they lose the job, in terms of not having the ability to care for their children, in terms of the health care costs that they have relating to the crisis, we can make them whole now, now, and put in process a system whereby they all are made whole.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That has nothing to do with the legitimate concern about income inequality in America.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's real.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's real.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But that does not affect the need for us to act swiftly and very thoroughly and in concert with all of the forces that we need to bring to bear to deal with the crisis now so no one is thrown out of their home.

text: Well, I think it goes without saying that as a nation we have to respond as forcefully as we can to the current crisis.

text: It has got to be solved with an emergency need right now.

title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Yes.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Let me...
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Sanders, will you make that same statement?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: May I just respond and ask Joe a question?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Please.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Right now, a woman's right to control her own body is under massive assault, unpredictable assault.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It is.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Joe, you have in the past on more than one occasion voted for the Hyde amendment, which says that a woman, low-income woman, could not use Medicaid funding for an abortion.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Is that still your view?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Or have you modified it?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It's not my view.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And by the way, everybody who has been in the Congress voted for the Hyde Amendment at one point or another because it was locked in other bills.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The reason why I affirmatively came out opposed to the Hyde Amendment was that if we're going to have public funding for all health care along the line, there's no way you could allow for there to be a requirement that you have Hyde Amendment, a woman who doesn't have the money could not have coverage under health care.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Well, I'm glad...
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Number two -- and I've done that -- I did that a while ago, OK?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Number one.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Number two, I would send immediately to the desk of the United States Congress, when I'm elected president -- if I'm elected president, a codification of Roe v. Wade amended by Casey, because I think it is a woman's right to choose.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I think it's a woman's opportunity to be able to make that decision.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And, in fact, I have gotten 100 percent rating from NARAL as well.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Sanders, before we move on, I just want to get you to respond.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Excuse me, you have a lifetime 100 percent voting record from NARAL?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I know my record of late from NARAL has been 100 percent.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I don't know whether it was 25 years ago.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Well, all right.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I mean, I think one of the differences, not to, you know, pick a bone here, is I have been consistent.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: All right?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I have always believed in that.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And you have not.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'm glad you have changed your views.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator, just to be clear, the vice president committed to picking a woman as his running mate.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: If you get the nomination, will you?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: In all likelihood, I will.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: For me, it's not just nominating a woman, it is making sure that we have a progressive woman and there are progressive women out there.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So my very strong tendency is to move in that direction.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Let's turn now to immigration.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Vice President Biden, you have recently said for the first time that the Obama-Biden administration made a big mistake in deporting millions of immigrants, but you didn't publicly speak out against it at the time.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: What commitment will you make tonight that as president you won't deport millions again?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Number one, I said that it took much too long to get it right.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And the president did get it right by DACA as well as making sure that he tried to protect parents as well, and, by the way, moving on an immigration bill as well.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The fact is that we already had a vote on an immigration bill, by the way, and Bernie voted against it, the immigration bill.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Had he voted for it and it had passed, we would already have 6 million undocumented would be citizens as I speak right now.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But I will send to the desk immediately a bill that requires the access to citizenship for 11 million undocumented folks, number one.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Number two, in the first 100 days of my administration, no one, no one will be deported at all.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: From that point on, the only deportations that will take place are commissions of felonies in the United States of America.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So to be clear, only felons get deported and everyone else gets to stay?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Period, yes.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Yes, and the reason is...
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Sanders?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: ... it's about uniting families, it's about making sure that we can both be a nation of immigrants as well as a nation that is decent.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Let me respond and I'll answer your question, respond to what Joe's comments about the 2007 immigration bill.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That bill was opposed by LULAC, the largest Latino organization in America.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The Southern Poverty Law Center called its guest worker programs akin to slavery.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: There wasn't really a vote on the bill.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It was killed because there was a vote on the Doggett Amendment, I think it was 49-48, and you know who voted with me on that one, Joe?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Look, and one of the things that goes on when you have that process is that not only the psychological terror, and I have talked to these kids, kids are scared to death in America when they come from school that their mom or dad may not be there, maybe deported.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: What we need to do is to end, and I will end this on day one, the ICE raids that have been so harmful to so many people.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And we need to do again what the American people want us to do.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is a country significantly built by immigrant labor, built by slave labor.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And what we have got to do is appreciate each other and end this demonization and divisiveness coming from the Trump administration.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Sanders...
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Go ahead.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Look, we are a nation of immigrants.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Our future rests upon the Latino community being fully integrated.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Twenty-four out of every 100 children in school today from kindergarten through high school is a Latino.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Right now, today.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The idea that any American thinks it doesn't pay for us to significantly invest in their future is absolutely a bizarre notion, because if we do not invest, everything that the very wealthy are concerned about and the xenophobes are concerned about will, in fact, get worse, not better.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We should be embracing, bringing them in, just like what happened with the Irish immigrants after the famine, just what happened with the Italians, et cetera.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have been through this before.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Xenophobia is a disease.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Vice President Biden.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Let's move now to the climate crisis.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'm coming right to you, Senator Sanders.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The World Health Organization calls the climate crisis a "health crisis" and warns that climate change could fuel the spread of infectious diseases.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Can you point to specific measures in your climate plan that address that threat?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Well, of course we do.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I mean, we -- look, this is what the scientists are telling us, the same scientists who make your point there, Jake.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: What they are telling us is if we don't get our act together in the next seven or eight years, there would be irreversible damage done to this planet.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We're talking about cities in America from Miami to New Orleans to Charleston, South Carolina, being under water.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We are talking about severe droughts, which will prevent farmers in the Midwest from growing the food that we need.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We're talking about extreme weather disturbances, which hit Houston, Texas, Venice, Italy, just a few months ago.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We are talking about the absolute need, and I want to hear Joe's position on this, this is not a middle of the ground thing.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is not building a few more solar panels or a few more wind turbines.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: What this is about is transforming our energy system as quickly as we humanly can away from fossil fuel.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It is insane that we continue to have fracking in America.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It is absurd that we give tens of billions of dollars a year in tax breaks and subsidies to the fossil fuel industry.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This has got to end and end now if we love our kids and future generations.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Vice President Biden?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: First thing that President Obama and I were summoned to the State Department -- excuse me, the Defense Department for was to meet with all the chiefs.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The single greatest threat to our national security, they said, is climate change, the single greatest threat to our national security.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Because as populations have to move because they can no longer live where they are, because their islands are sinking, because you saw what happened in Darfur with the change in weather patterns and the desert there.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It causes war.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It causes great migrations, great migrations.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They said that's the single biggest problem.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Number two, there's an awful lot of people today who are, in fact, getting ill because of the changes in the environment, particularly up where Bernie lives, I'm not -- it has nothing to do with him, but having -- up in the Northeast because you have everything from beetle infestation and a whole range of things that are causing diseases as well in addition to eliminating foliage.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So, Vice President Biden, let me ask you then that the -- you talk about this being the number one crisis, they told you at the Pentagon.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Yes.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The price tag for your climate plan is about $1.7 trillion.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's about $14 trillion less than Senator Sanders wants to spend on this.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Is your plan ambitious enough to tackle this crisis?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Yes, it is ambitious enough to tackle the crisis because what -- you go to joebiden.com, I lay out the first 13 things I would do immediately upon being elected.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Number one, we're going to once again reinstate all the cuts the president made in everything from the CAFE standards, how far automobiles can go, investing in light rail so that we take cars off the road, making sure we're in a position where we are now in a position that we put 500,000 charging stations in areas that, in fact, all new highways that we built.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Making sure that we spend $500 billion a year in the federal government paying for transportation, the vehicles we run.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: All of those being converted to be able to run on low carbon fuel and/or be able to run on no carbon fuel at all by having them move into a direction that is all, all carbon-free.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We can do these things.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We can lay down the tracks where nothing can be changed by the next president or following president, the one beyond that.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: In addition to that, we also have to -- I would immediately rejoin the Paris Climate Accord, which I helped put together.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I would call the 100 nations -- over 100 nations, but the 100 major polluters to the United States in the first 100 days to up the ante and make it clear that, in fact, we would -- in fact, if they didn't, there would be a price to pay.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And lastly, I would be right now organizing the hemisphere and the world to provide $20 billion for the Amazon, for Brazil no longer to burn the Amazon so they could have forests -- they're no longer forests, but they could have farming, and say, this is what we're going to do.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They absorb more carbon in the Amazon, and the region is burning now, than we emit in one entire year per year.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Mr. Vice President.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Sanders?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: All well and good, but nowhere near enough.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I mean, you mentioned we started this debate talking about a war-like situation in terms of the coronavirus.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And we said we have to act accordingly.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You said it.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I think you're right.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I said it.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have to act dramatically, boldly, if we're going to save lives in this country and around the world.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I look at climate change in exactly the same way.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It's not a question of re-entering the Paris Accord.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's fine.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Who cares.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Not a big deal.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The deal right now is do we have the courage?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And this gets back to the point I'm trying to make all night long.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Do we take on the health care industry and tell them their profits are not more important than health care for all?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Do we take on the fossil fuel industry?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Look, in terms of the fossil fuel industry, these guys have been lying.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They've been lying for years like the tobacco industry lied 50 years ago.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: "Oh, we don't know if -- if fossil fuels, if oil and carbon emissions are causing climate change."
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They knew.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Exxon Mobil knew.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They lied.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: In fact, I think they should be held criminally accountable.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But this, Jake, is an issue of enormous consequence.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: What Joe was saying goes nowhere near enough.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It's not a question of money.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Give me a minute here.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Let's -- we have time to talk about this.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is a world-changing event.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I understand.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I just want to give him a chance to respond and then we can come back to you.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: OK. All right.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Let's stay on it.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We're staying on this issue.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Number one, no more subsidies for the fossil fuel industry, no more drilling on federal lands, no more drilling, including offshore, no ability for the oil industry to continue to drill, period, ends, number one.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Number two, we're in a situation, as well, where we cannot -- we -- we are able to move rapidly to change the dynamic in terms of what we can do to set in motion -- the fact that he says climate change, Paris Accord doesn't mean much -- we can get everything exactly right.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We're 15 percent of the problem.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Eight-five percent of the problem is over there.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We need someone who can deal internationally.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We need someone who can bring the world together again.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We need someone who can move in a direction that, in fact, if you violate the commitment you make, you will pay an economic price for it, like what's happening in China.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They're exporting coal, significant coal.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: OK, look, obviously, the Paris Accord is -- is useful.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But it doesn't go anywhere -- if you're laughing, Joe, then you're missing the point.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is an existential crisis.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You -- you -- you talk about -- you know, I'm talking about stopping fracking as soon as we possibly can.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'm talking about telling the fossil fuel industry that they are going to stop destroying this planet -- no ifs, buts and maybes about it.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'm talking about speaking to...
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So am I.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Well, I'm not sure your proposal does that.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I'm talking about speaking to China, to Russia, to countries all over the world -- and in this moment, making the point that instead of spending $1.8 trillion on weapons of destruction designed to kill each other, maybe we should pool our resources and fight our common enemy, which is climate change.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I know your heart is in the right place, but this requires dramatic, bold action.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We've got to take on the fossil fuel industry.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Your plan does not do that.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: My plan takes on the fossil fuel industry and it unites the world.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You just got finished saying -- what's he going to do?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: He's going to bring these countries together, make it clear to them.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Why would they vote for you when they hear you praise a program of Fidel Castro, a dictator who jailed, tortured and killed thousands of Cubans?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I have opposed authoritarianism, whether it's in Cuba, whether it's in Saudi Arabia, whether it's in China or whether it is in Russia.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That is my life record.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I believe, unlike the president of the United States, in democracy, not authoritarianism, in Cuba or any place else.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: What I believe right now, in this world, is that we are faced with a global crisis and a movement toward authoritarianism.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's what Putin in Russia is leading.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's what MBS in Saudi Arabia is leading.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And as president of the United States, unlike Donald Trump, I would put the flag down and say that, in this country and in this world, we have got to move toward democracy and human rights.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That is my view and has always been my view.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: To be clear, Senator Sanders, Cuba has been a dictatorship for decades.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Shouldn't we judge dictators by the violation of human rights and not by any of their alleged achievements?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Well, I think you can make the same point about China.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: China is undoubtedly an authoritarian society, OK.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But would anybody deny, any economist deny that extreme poverty in China today is much less than what it was 40 or 50 years ago?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So I think we condemn authoritarianism, whether it's in China, Russia, Cuba, any place else.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But to simply say that nothing ever done by any of those administrations had a positive impact on their people would, I think, be incorrect.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Vice President Biden, you have criticized Senator Sanders for praising Castro's education system.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But in 2016 President Obama said Cuba made, quote, "a great progress in educating young people" and that its health care system "is a huge achievement that they should be congratulated for."
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: How is that different from what Senator Sanders has said?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: He was trying to change Cuban policy so the Cuban people would get out from under the thumb of Castro and his brother, that is to change the policy so that we could in fact on -- impact on Cuba's policy by getting them opened up.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's what that was about.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But the praising of the Sandinistas, the praising of Cuba, the praising, just now, of China -- China is an authoritarian dictatorship.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's what it is.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We have to deal with them because they're there.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But the idea that they, in fact, have increased the wealth of people in that country -- it's been marginal, the change that's taken place.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It is still -- they have a million Uighurs, a million Muslims in prison camps in the West.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You see what's happening in Hong Kong today.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And by the way, the idea that he praised the Soviet Union, when it was the Soviet Union, about the things that they had done well -- they're an awful dictatorship killing millions and millions of people.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And in addition to that, we have a circumstance where, after the election was all over and we knew what -- what was done by -- by the Russians now, in interfering with our elections, this man voted against sanctioning Russia for interference in our elections.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Senator Sanders...
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I don't get it.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Well, what you don't get -- and this is exactly what the problem with politics is about.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: All right, question.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Did China make progress in ending extreme poverty over the last 50 years, yes or no?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's like saying Jack the Ripper...
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: No, it's not.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Yes, it is.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: See, Joe, this is the problem.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Yes, it is.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: This is the problem.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We can't talk -- I know there's a political line.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I understand.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: China's terrible and awful, nothing ever good.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: But the fact of the matter is China, of course, is an authoritarian society.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It's what I just said.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It's a dictatorship.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: That's what I just said five minutes ago, you know.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And, by the way, you know, the question that was asked quoted Barack Obama.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: President Obama was more generous in his praise of what Cuba did in health care and education than I was.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I was talking about a program 60 years ago, in the first year of the Castro revolution.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: So the bottom line is that I think it's a little bit absurd -- if we're going to look at the world the way it is, of course, we are opposed to authoritarianism.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And by the way, you know, before it was considered good policy, a good idea.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I was condemning the dictatorship in Saudi Arabia when a lot of other people in Washington...
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: It wasn't me.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I was condemning the dictatorship in the UAE.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: You were not.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Yes, I was.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Thank you, Senator Sanders.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Vice President Biden?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Look, the idea of occasionally saying something nice about a country is one thing.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The idea of praising a country that is violating human rights around the world is, in fact -- makes our allies wonder what's going on.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: What do you think the South Koreans think when we -- or he praises China like that?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: What do you think -- what do you think the Australians believe in the shadow of China?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: What do you think is happening in Indonesia in the shadow of China?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: What do you think is happening in terms of Japan in the shadow of China?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Words matter.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: These are flat-out dictators, period.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And they should be called for it, straight up.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: We may have to work out -- for example, I was able to help negotiate a New START agreement with Russia, not because I like Putin.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: The guy's a thug.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: Mr. Vice President, sticking with foreign policy, you acknowledge that your support and vote for the Iraq War was a mistake.
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: What lessons did you learn from that mistake?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: And how might those lessons influence your foreign policy decision- making as president?
title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: I learned I can't take the word of a president when, in fact, they assured me that they would not use force.

text: Remember the context.

title: 11th 2020 Democratic Party Primary Debate

text: They were not.

text: And what's the first thing that happened when we got elected?

text: I was -- I admitted 14 years ago it was a mistake to have trusted him.

text: And I'm prepared to compare my foreign policy credentials up against my friend here on any day of the week and every day of the week.

text: Well, let's start off with the war in Iraq, Joe.

text: I was there, too.

text: I understood -- and, by the way, let's be clear about what that vote was.

text: I understood that.

text: I was on the floor of the House time and time again.

text: But the issue is not just the war in Iraq.

text: That was a long time ago.

text: It wasn't so easy for me to lead the effort against disastrous trade agreements.

text: The issue is whether or not, in difficult times, and God knows these are difficult times, we're going to have the courage to take on powerful special interests and do what's right...
